trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: sheet
trans: n. 薄片，纸张；薄板；床单

sentences.english: I’ll go and find you some clean sheets and blankets.
sentences.chinese: 我去给你们找些干净的床单和毯子。

sentences.english: white cotton sheets
sentences.chinese: 白色的棉布床单

sentences.english: a sheet of paper with names and numbers on it
sentences.chinese: 写了姓名和电话号码的一张纸

sentences.english: a sheet of glass
sentences.chinese: 一块玻璃

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of thin cloth that you put on a bed to lie on or lie under

name: tend
trans: vt. 照料，照管

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: climate change
trans: n. 气候变化

name: chartered accountant
trans: n. 特许会计师；注册会计师

name: performer
trans: n. 演出者；执行者；演奏者

sentences.english: circus performers
sentences.chinese: 马戏演员

sentences.english: He was a better songwriter than performer.
sentences.chinese: 他更擅长写歌，而不是演唱。

detailed_translations.english: an actor, musician etc who performs to entertain people

name: accuracy
trans: n. [数] 精确度，准确性

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

name: quibble
trans: n. 谬论；双关语；遁辞

sentences.english: Lawmakers spent the day quibbling over the final wording of the resolution.
sentences.chinese: 立法者们花了一天争辩决议的最后措词。

detailed_translations.chinese: 诡辩；挑剔；说模棱两可的话
detailed_translations.english: When people quibble over a small matter, they argue about it even though it is not important

name: peacekeeping
trans: adj. 维护和平的；执行停火协定的

name: blanket
trans: n. 毛毯，毯子；毯状物，覆盖层

sentences.english: She huddled herself in the blanket.
sentences.chinese: 她用毯子紧紧裹住自己。

sentences.english: They muffled up her head with a blanket.
sentences.chinese: 他们用毯子蒙住了她的头。

sentences.english: He lapped his daughter in a warm blanket.
sentences.chinese: 他把女儿裹在一个暖和的毯子里。

detailed_translations.english: a cover for a bed, usually made of wool

name: counterpart
trans: n. 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: Shakespeare
trans: n. 莎士比亚（1564-1616，英国诗人、剧作家）

sentences.english: He turned to the study of Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 他致力于莎士比亚的研究。

sentences.english: As a playwriter,Shakespeare belongs to the 16th century.
sentences.chinese: 作为一位剧作家，莎士比亚属于16世纪。

sentences.english: He was reading the plays of Shakespeare when I met him in the library the other day.
sentences.chinese: 前几天我在图书馆遇见他时，他正在阅读莎士比亚的戏剧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 莎士比亚(1564-1616,英国剧作家,诗人)

name: Republican
trans: n. 共和党人

name: gale
trans: n. [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵

sentences.english: a severe gale
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风

detailed_translations.chinese: [气象] 大风，狂风；（突发的）一阵
detailed_translations.english: a very strong wind

name: criticise
trans: vt. 批评；吹毛求疵；非难

sentences.english: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你或你的伴侣习惯性地批评对方，其实你们是在攻击对方的人格。

sentences.english: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.chinese: 我们对运转中的国家的批评越多，我们就能更少地谈到我们所在的迷失的小岛。

sentences.english: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.chinese: 这两份报纸发现，基于达令总督的不得人心，他们拥有一大优势：严词批评总督的法令，和《公报》的过分阿谀拍马对着干。

name: profound
trans: adj. 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

name: savour
trans: n. 滋味；风味

sentences.english: She sipped her wine, savouring every drop.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢地啜着酒，细细地品尝每一滴的滋味。

detailed_translations.chinese: 品尝，品味；欣赏；体会，体味
detailed_translations.english: to fully enjoy the taste or smell of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 味道， 风味； 情趣， 吸引力
detailed_translations.english: a pleasant taste or smell

name: flexible
trans: adj. 灵活的；柔韧的；易弯曲的

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: sculpture
trans: n. 雕塑；雕刻；刻蚀

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

name: spy
trans: n. 间谍；密探

sentences.english: That day he spied on her while pretending to work on the shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 那天他假装修剪灌木，却秘密地监视着她。

detailed_translations.english: If you spy on someone, you watch them secretly
someone whose job is to find out secret information about another country, organization, or group
to suddenly see someone or something, especially after searching for them

name: aplomb
trans: n. 沉着；垂直；泰然自若

sentences.english: He delivered the speech with his usual aplomb.
sentences.chinese: 他以惯常的沉着语气作了演讲。

detailed_translations.english: If you do something with aplomb, you do it with confidence in a relaxed way

name: outcome
trans: n. 结果，结局；成果

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: eulogy
trans: n. 悼词；颂词；颂扬；赞词

sentences.english: The minister delivered a long eulogy.
sentences.chinese: 部长致长篇悼词。

detailed_translations.english: a speech or piece of writing in which you praise someone or something very much, especially at a funeral

name: slippery
trans: adj. 滑的；狡猾的；不稳定的

sentences.english: In places, the path can be wet and slippery.
sentences.chinese: 路上有些地方可能又湿又滑。

sentences.english: the slippery notion of ‘standards’
sentences.chinese: “标准”这一模糊概念

detailed_translations.english: something that is slippery is difficult to hold, walk on etc because it is wet or  greasy

name: complex
trans: n. 复合体；综合设施

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: expression
trans: n. 表现，表示，表达；表情，脸色，态度，腔调，声调；式，符号；词句，语句，措辞，说法

sentences.english: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression (= the right to say what you think without being punished ).
sentences.chinese: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

detailed_translations.chinese: 词语； 表达， 表情
detailed_translations.english: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

name: spanish
trans: n. 西班牙语；西班牙人

name: complicate
trans: vt. 使复杂化；使恶化；使卷入

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

name: restore
trans: vi. 恢复；还原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: plethora
trans: n. 过多；过剩；[医] 多血症

sentences.english: a plethora of suggestions
sentences.chinese: 一大堆建议

detailed_translations.chinese: 过多；过剩；[医] 多血症
detailed_translations.english: a very large number of something, usually more than you need

name: mechanics
trans: n. 力学（用作单数）；结构；技术；机械学（用作单数）

sentences.english: He has not studied mechanics or engineering.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学习过力学或者工程学。

detailed_translations.english: the part of physics that deals with the natural forces that act on moving or stationary objects

name: emphasis
trans: n. 重点；强调；加强语气

sentences.english: a change of emphasis in government policy
sentences.chinese: 政府政策重心的变化

detailed_translations.chinese: 强调； 重视； 重要性
detailed_translations.english: special attention or importance

name: aware
trans: adj. 意识到的；知道的；有…方面知识的；懂世故的

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: previous
trans: adj. 以前的；早先的；过早的

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: property
trans: n. 性质，性能；财产；所有权

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

name: stimulate
trans: vi. 起刺激作用；起促进作用

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: hunt
trans: n. 狩猎；搜寻

sentences.english: lion/rhino/stag etc hunt
sentences.chinese: 猎狮/犀牛/雄鹿等

sentences.english: the hunt for the missing child
sentences.chinese: 搜寻失踪儿童

sentences.english: Wolves tend to hunt in packs (= hunt in groups ) .
sentences.chinese: 狼往往成群捕猎。

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when people chase animals in order to kill or catch them
to chase animals and birds in order to kill or catch them

name: creative
trans: adj. 创造性的

sentences.english: This job is so boring. I wish I could do something more creative.
sentences.chinese: 这工作太单调了，我希望能做些更有创造性的事情。

sentences.english: I teach creative writing at Trinity College.
sentences.chinese: 我在三一学院教创意写作。

sentences.english: the creative process of writing a poem
sentences.chinese: 写诗的创作过程

sentences.english: Diaghilev did his great creative work in France.
sentences.chinese: 狄亚格列夫在法国编创了富有创新性的伟大作品。

sentences.english: a creative solution to the problem
sentences.chinese: 这一问题的创新性解决方法

detailed_translations.english: involving the use of imagination to produce new ideas or things

name: undermine
trans: vt. 破坏，渐渐破坏；挖掘地基

sentences.english: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

name: offset
trans: n. 抵消，补偿；平版印刷；支管

sentences.english: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用旅费抵税。

sentences.english: What expenses can you offset against tax ?
sentences.chinese: 什么开支可以获得税项减免？

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

name: banal
trans: adj. 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的

sentences.english: conversations about the most banal subjects
sentences.chinese: 最无聊的谈话

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈腐的；平庸的；老一套的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting, because of a lack of new or different ideas

name: promotion
trans: n. 提升，[劳经] 晋升；推销，促销；促进；发扬，振兴

sentences.english: a society for the promotion of religious tolerance
sentences.chinese: 一个促进宗教包容的团体

sentences.english: I want a job with good prospects for promotion.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一份有良好晋升机会的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of helping something to develop or increase

name: Parliament
trans: n. 议会，国会

name: aerodynamics
trans: n. [流] 气体力学；[航] 航空动力学

sentences.english: Its supersonic speeds and aerodynamics do the job, compressing the air into the engine.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的超音速和空气动力学完成将空气压缩入引擎的任务。

sentences.english: And besides, the principles of aerodynamics and radar-deflection know no political borders.
sentences.chinese: 此外，空气动力学和雷达隐形技术的原理并无政治壁垒。

sentences.english: The flight path was as planned, and preliminary feedback from the engineers was that it matched the model aerodynamics performance and guidance and control very well.
sentences.chinese: 从工程师那里得到的初步反馈表明试验机符合模型的空气动力学性能，并且导航和操纵都十分出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: [流] 气体力学；[航] 航空动力学
detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of how objects move through the air

name: recession
trans: n. 衰退；不景气；后退；凹处

sentences.english: the economic recession of the early 1980s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退

sentences.english: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

detailed_translations.english: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual

name: discipline
trans: n. 学科；纪律；训练；惩罚

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: stave
trans: n. 狭板；梯级；诗句；五线谱表

detailed_translations.chinese: 狭板；梯级；诗句；五线谱表
detailed_translations.english: the set of five lines on which music is written

name: restrict
trans: vt. 限制；约束；限定

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: mundane
trans: adj. 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的

sentences.english: Initially, the work was pretty mundane.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始，这工作非常乏味。

sentences.english: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

name: precedence
trans: n. 优先；居先

sentences.english: Guests were seated in order of precedence .
sentences.chinese: 宾客们按席次就座。

sentences.english: Safety must be given precedence .
sentences.chinese: 安全必须放在第一位。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is considered to be more impor-tant than someone or something else, and therefore comes first or must be dealt with first

name: quantity
trans: n. 量，数量；大量；总量

sentences.english: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
sentences.chinese: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

name: fluctuate
trans: vi. 波动；涨落；动摇

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: brainstorm
trans: n. 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动

sentences.english: While some of the greatest ideas and solutions come up in brainstorm meetings, we also lose most of our time in discussion without action.
sentences.chinese: 当在头脑风暴的会议上有一些顶级的主意或者解决方法提出时，我们也浪费了很多时间在没有行动的讨论上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集思广益；头脑风暴；灵机一动
集体讨论；集思广益以寻找

name: physician
trans: n. [医] 医师；内科医师

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

name: complain
trans: vi. 投诉；发牢骚；诉说

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

sentences.english: Employees complained bitterly about working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们对工作条件十分不满。

name: descendant
trans: n. 后裔；子孙

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: longhaul
trans: Not Found

trans: n. 搅拌；轰动

sentences.english: Give that pan a stir , will you?
sentences.chinese: 把那锅东西搅一搅，好吗？

to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

trans: n. 温柔；柔弱性；女子本性

name: branch
trans: n. 树枝，分枝；分部；支流

sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，满地都是大大小小的树枝。

sentences.english: The topmost branches were full of birds.
sentences.chinese: 树梢上停满了鸟儿。

sentences.english: She now works in our Denver branch.
sentences.chinese: 现在她在我们的丹佛分部工作。

sentences.english: a branch of mathematics/physics/biology etc
sentences.chinese: 数学/物理/生物学等的分支

detailed_translations.english: a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it

name: multicultural
trans: adj. 多种文化的；融合或具有多种文化的

sentences.english: a multicultural society
sentences.chinese: 一个多元文化的社会

detailed_translations.english: involving or including people or ideas from many different countries, races, or religions

name: intent
trans: n. 意图；目的；含义

sentences.chinese: 他专注的凝视

detailed_translations.chinese: 专心的， 专注的； 急切的
detailed_translations.english: giving careful attention to something so that you think about nothing else
what you intend to do

name: elasticity
trans: n. 弹性；弹力；灵活性

sentences.english: the skin’s natural elasticity
sentences.chinese: 皮肤天生的弹性

detailed_translations.english: the ability of something to stretch and go back to its usual length or size

name: migration
trans: n. 迁移；移民；移动

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

name: lobby
trans: n. 大厅；休息室；会客室；游说议员的团体

sentences.chinese: 宾馆大堂

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in the entrance lobby.
sentences.chinese: 我们在入口大厅见。

sentences.english: The group is lobbying for a reduction in defence spending.
sentences.chinese: 该团体正在游说政府削减国防开支。

detailed_translations.english: a wide passage or large hall just inside the entrance to a public building
to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

name: rethink
trans: n. 重新考虑；反思；新想法

name: ubiquitous
trans: adj. 普遍存在的；无所不在的

sentences.english: Coffee shops are ubiquitous these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今好像到处都是咖啡馆。

sentences.english: a French film, starring the ubiquitous Gérard Depardieu
sentences.chinese: 一部法国电影，由家喻户晓的热拉尔·德帕迪约主演

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍存在的；无所不在的
detailed_translations.english: seeming to be everywhere – sometimes used humorously

name: reproduction
trans: n. 繁殖，生殖；复制；复制品

sentences.english: Scientists studied the reproduction, diet, and health of the dolphins.
sentences.chinese: 科学家研究了海豚的繁殖情况、进食规律和健康状况。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["sexual reproduction"]}
sentences.chinese: 有性繁殖

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of producing babies, young animals, or plants

trans: n. 生涯；职业；事业；速度，全速

sentences.english: a teaching career
sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.english: He realized that his acting career was over.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .
sentences.chinese: 护士希望有更好的职业架构。

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

name: exceed
trans: vt. 超过；胜过

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: discursion
trans: n. 漫谈离题，推论，推理

name: concentrate
trans: n. 浓缩，精选；浓缩液

sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: spectrum
trans: n. 光谱；频谱；范围；余象

sentences.chinese: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

sentences.english: the electromagnetic spectrum
sentences.chinese: 电磁（波）谱

detailed_translations.english: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

name: Cook
trans: Not Found

name: revolutionize
trans: vt. 发动革命；彻底改革；宣传革命

sentences.english: New technology is going to revolutionize everything we do.
sentences.chinese: 新科技将彻底改变我们做的每一件事。

sentences.english: His work revolutionized the treatment of this disease.
sentences.chinese: 他的研究成果给这种疾病的治疗带来了革命。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the way people do something or think about something

trans: n. 昏暗；阴暗

sentences.english: He peered into the gathering (= increasing ) gloom.
sentences.chinese: 他在渐深的暮色中眺望远方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏暗， 阴暗； 忧郁， 沮丧

name: preparatory
trans: n. 预科；预备学校

sentences.english: preparatory talks to clear the way for a peace settlement
sentences.chinese: 为缔结和平协议扫清道路的预备性会谈

sentences.english: preparatory drawings
sentences.chinese: 草图

sentences.chinese: 还有很多准备工作要做。

detailed_translations.english: done in order to get ready for something

name: discussion
trans: n. 讨论，议论

sentences.chinese: 课堂讨论

sentences.english: the topics suggested for discussion
sentences.chinese: 建议讨论的话题

sentences.english: We have had discussions about her legal situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们就她的法律状况已进行了讨论。

detailed_translations.english: when you discuss something

trans: n. 参与；分享；参股

sentences.chinese: 谢谢你的参与。

sentences.english: entertainment with plenty of audience participation
sentences.chinese: 有许多观众参与的娱乐活动

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking part in an activity or event

sentences.chinese: 犯罪、失业等统计资料

sentences.chinese: 根据官方的统计数字，500多人死于这种疾病。

sentences.chinese: 初稿

sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，民主党的得票数远远落后于绿党。

sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

sentences.chinese: 她是个勤劳肯干的工人。

trans: n. 差额；缺少

trans: adj. [数] 二进制的；二元的，二态的

sentences.english: a binary star system

trans: n. 资源，财力；办法；智谋

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

sentences.chinese: 她只穿了一件薄薄的夏装外套。

sentences.chinese: 路面上覆盖着一层薄薄的冰。

sentences.english: The skin on the eyelids is the thinnest on the body.
sentences.chinese: 眼睑上的皮肤是人体最薄的皮肤。

sentences.english: NATO will continue to thin out its forces.
sentences.chinese: 北约将继续裁军。

sentences.english: NATO will continue to thin out its forces.
sentences.chinese: 北约将继续裁军。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄的；瘦的；稀薄的；微弱的
detailed_translations.english: if something is thin, there is only a small distance between its two opposite sides or surfaces
Thin out means the same as
Thin out means the same as

name: fiction
trans: n. 小说；虚构，编造；谎言

sentences.english: romantic fiction
sentences.chinese: 爱情小说

sentences.english: historical fiction
sentences.chinese: 历史小说

sentences.english: For years he managed to keep up the fiction that he was not married.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他设法一直给人一种未婚的假象。

detailed_translations.english: books and stories about imaginary people and events

trans: n. 分数；二十；配乐；刻痕

sentences.chinese: 半场时的比分是一比一。

sentences.english: What’s the score?
sentences.chinese: 比分是多少？

sentences.english: Is anybody keeping score (= making a record of the score ) ?
sentences.chinese: 有没有人负责记分？

sentences.english: The final score was Southampton two, Leeds United nil.
sentences.chinese: 最后的比分是二比零，南安普敦队击败利兹联队。

sentences.english: The school’s test scores have not improved.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的考试成绩没有提高。

detailed_translations.english: the number of points that each team or player has won in a game or competition

name: subconsciously
trans: adv. 潜意识地

name: milestone
trans: n. 里程碑，划时代的事件

sentences.chinese: 他说该党的成立代表着赞比亚历史上的一个里程碑。

detailed_translations.english: a very important event in the development of something

name: wrinkle
trans: n. 皱纹

sentences.english: Her face was a mass of wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸上布满皱纹。

sentences.english: Alex wrinkled up her nose at the smell.
sentences.chinese: 闻到那股味道，亚历克丝皱起了鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: wrinkles are lines on your face and skin that you get when you are old
if you wrinkle a part of your face, or if it wrinkles, small lines appear on it

name: decent
trans: adj. 正派的；得体的；相当好的

sentences.english: a decent burial
sentences.chinese: 得体的葬礼

sentences.english: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧，不太合乎高级讲师的身份。

sentences.english: The chairman did the decent thing (= did what people thought he ought to ) and resigned.
sentences.chinese: 主席体面地辞去了职务。

detailed_translations.english: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

name: reef
trans: n. 暗礁；[地质] 矿脉；收帆

sentences.english: a proposal to protect several miles of thousand-year-old coral reef
sentences.chinese: 保护绵延数英里的千年古珊瑚礁的提案

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗礁；[地质] 矿脉；收帆
detailed_translations.english: a line of sharp rocks, often made of  coral  , or a raised area of sand near the surface of the sea
to tie up part of a sail in order to make it smaller

name: fall behind
trans: na. 落后；跟不上；落下；拖欠

name: geographical
trans: adj. 地理的；地理学的

sentences.english: their geographical proximity to Japan (= nearness to Japan )
sentences.chinese: 它们和日本相邻的地理位置

detailed_translations.english: relating to the place in an area, country etc where something or someone is

name: quarterly
trans: n. 季刊

sentences.english: We publish a quarterly journal.
sentences.chinese: 我们出版一份季刊。

sentences.english: The rent is payable quarterly.
sentences.chinese: 房租按季度支付。

sentences.english: It makes no difference whether dividends are paid quarterly or annually.
sentences.chinese: 红利是按季度还是按年度支付没有区别。

detailed_translations.chinese: 季度的，按季度的；一年四次的
detailed_translations.english: produced or happening four times a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 按季度，[农] 一季一次地；纵横四分地
detailed_translations.english: Quarterly is also an adverb
a magazine that is produced four times a year

name: guardian
trans: n. [法] 监护人，保护人；守护者

sentences.english: Destiny's legal guardian was her grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 德斯蒂妮的法定监护人是她的祖母。

detailed_translations.chinese: [法] 监护人，保护人；守护者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is legally responsible for looking after someone else’s child, especially after the child’s parents have died

name: dissemination
trans: n. 宣传；散播；传染（病毒）

sentences.english: He had their own uniqueness and vitality, and dissemination of a value concept.
sentences.chinese: 他有了自己的独特性和生命力，并传播一种价值理念。

name: emergency
trans: n. 紧急情况；突发事件；非常时刻

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

name: motel
trans: n. 汽车旅馆

sentences.english: Stay at a cheap motel.
sentences.chinese: 住便宜的汽车旅馆。

sentences.english: We can stay in a motel overnight, then continue on to Copenhagen tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在一家汽车旅馆过夜，然后明天再继续出发到哥本哈根。

sentences.english: A wide range of hotel, motel and apartment accommodation is available in most cities, major resorts and many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 在大部分城市、主要旅游点和许多农村地区，都能找到各种类型的旅馆、汽车旅馆和公寓住所。

detailed_translations.english: a hotel for people who are travelling by car, where you can park your car outside your room

name: refute
trans: vt. 反驳，驳斥；驳倒

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: penchant
trans: n. 嗜好；倾向

sentences.english: a penchant for fast cars
sentences.chinese: 对跑车的酷爱

detailed_translations.english: if you have a penchant for something, you like that thing very much and try to do it or have it often

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: empathy
trans: n. 神入；移情作用；执着

sentences.english: Having begun my life in a children's home, I have great empathy with the little ones.
sentences.chinese: 在一家儿童福利院长大使我对这些小孩子们怀有深深的同感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同感， 移情； 全神贯注
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand other people’s feelings and problems

name: realistic
trans: adj. 现实的；现实主义的；逼真的；实在论的

sentences.english: It’s just not realistic to expect a promotion so soon.
sentences.chinese: 这么快就想升职根本不现实。

sentences.english: You need to be realistic about the amount you can do in a day.
sentences.chinese: 你对自己一天能完成多少工作量要现实一点。

detailed_translations.english: judging and dealing with situations in a practical way according to what is actually possible rather than what you would like to happen

name: contradict
trans: vt. 反驳；否定；与…矛盾；与…抵触

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: arthritis
trans: n. [外科] 关节炎

sentences.english: I have a touch of arthritis in the wrist.
sentences.chinese: 我的手腕有轻微关节炎。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that causes the joints of your body to become swollen and very painful

name: apprise
trans: vt. 通知；报告

sentences.english: Have customers been fully apprised of the advantages?
sentences.chinese: 客户有没有被充分告知各项好处呢？

detailed_translations.english: to tell or give someone information about something

name: estimate
trans: n. 估计，估价；判断，看法

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: in this regard
trans: na. 在这一点上；“in this/that regard”的变体

name: foment
trans: vt. 煽动；挑起；热敷

sentences.english: They were accused of fomenting rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动叛乱。

detailed_translations.english: to cause trouble and make people start fighting each other or opposing the government

name: owner
trans: n. [经] 所有者；物主

sentences.english: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车，很是自豪。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns something

name: unceasing
trans: adj. 不断的；不停的

name: omen
trans: n. 预兆；征兆

sentences.english: The car won’t start. Do you think it’s an omen?
sentences.chinese: 汽车发动不起来。你觉得这是某种预兆吗？

detailed_translations.english: a sign of what will happen in the future

name: frigid
trans: adj. 寒冷的，严寒的；冷淡的

sentences.english: The guard looked at us with a frigid stare.
sentences.chinese: 守卫冷冷地盯着我们。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is frigid does not like having sex

name: key
trans: n. （打字机等的）键；关键；钥匙

sentences.english: A bunch of keys hung from his belt.
sentences.chinese: 他的皮带上挂着一串钥匙。

sentences.english: Press the ‘Escape’ key to exit.
sentences.chinese: 按退出键退出。

sentences.english: Check your answers in the key at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 用书后的解答核对答案。

detailed_translations.english: a small specially shaped piece of metal that you put into a lock and turn in order to lock or unlock a door, start a car etc

name: imagine
trans: vi. 想像；猜想；想像起来

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

name: practice
trans: n. 实践；练习；惯例

sentences.english: religious beliefs and practices
sentences.chinese: 宗教信仰和习俗

sentences.english: dangerous working practices
sentences.chinese: 危险的工作方法

detailed_translations.english: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom

name: persuade
trans: vt. 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: universally
trans: adv. 普遍地；人人；到处

sentences.english: ...a universally accepted point of view.
sentences.chinese: …一个被普遍接受的观点。

detailed_translations.english: by everyone

name: interlibrary
trans: Not Found

name: external
trans: n. 外部；外观；外面

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: vein
trans: n. 血管；叶脉；[地质] 岩脉；纹理；翅脉；性情

sentences.english: the pulmonary vein
sentences.chinese: 肺静脉

sentences.english: She felt the blood racing through her veins as they kissed.
sentences.chinese: 他们接吻时她觉得热血沸腾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血管；叶脉；[地质] 岩脉；纹理；翅脉；性情
detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes which carries blood to your heart from other parts of your body

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成脉络；象脉络般分布于

name: reserve
trans: n. 储备，储存；自然保护区；预备队；缄默；[金融] 储备金

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: invention
trans: n. 发明；发明物；虚构；发明才能

sentences.english: The invention of the computer has revolutionized the business world.
sentences.chinese: 电脑的发明使商界发生了根本变化。

sentences.english: They subsequently admitted that the story was pure invention.
sentences.chinese: 他们后来承认他们说的纯属虚构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发明，创造；捏造， 假话
detailed_translations.english: the act of inventing something

name: objectivity
trans: n. 客观；客观性

name: sufficient
trans: adj. 足够的；充分的

sentences.english: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
sentences.chinese: 有了足够的证据，我们才能提出起诉。

sentences.english: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
sentences.chinese: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。

sentences.english: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

name: criticism
trans: n. 批评；考证；苛求

sentences.english: Despite strong criticism , the new system is still in place.
sentences.chinese: 尽管遭到了猛烈的批评，新制度依然原封不动。

sentences.english: There has been widespread criticism of the decision.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定受到了普遍的批评。

sentences.english: We try to give students constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们设法对学生提出有建设性的批评。

sentences.english: Another criticism levelled at him was that his teaching methods were old-fashioned.
sentences.chinese: 还有一个针对他的批评是，他的教学方法已经过时。

sentences.english: The government’s economic strategy has attracted a lot of criticism .
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策招致了大量的批评。

sentences.english: You must learn to accept criticism .
sentences.chinese: 你必须学会接受批评。

sentences.english: Many employees find it hard to take even mild criticism .
sentences.chinese: 有许多员工甚至连轻微的批评也很难接受。

sentences.english: His actions provoked severe criticism from civil rights groups.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为招致了民权组织的严厉批评。

sentences.english: the storm of criticism that followed his announcement
sentences.chinese: 他的声明引来的批评浪潮

sentences.english: literary criticism
sentences.chinese: 文学评论

detailed_translations.english: remarks that say what you think is bad about someone or something

name: driver
trans: n. 驾驶员；驱动程序；起子；传动器

sentences.english: a taxi driver
sentences.chinese: 出租车司机

sentences.english: Do you think you’re a good driver?
sentences.chinese: 你认为自己是个好司机吗？

detailed_translations.english: someone who drives a car, bus etc

name: skip
trans: n. 跳跃；跳读

sentences.english: They saw the man with a little girl skipping along behind him.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到那个男人身后跟着一个蹦蹦跳跳的小女孩。

detailed_translations.english: to go from one subject to another in no fixed order
a skipping movement

name: sporadic
trans: adj. 零星的；分散的；不定时发生的

sentences.english: There has been sporadic violence downtown.
sentences.chinese: 市中心时有暴力事件发生。

detailed_translations.english: happening fairly often, but not regularly

name: plastic
trans: n. 塑料制品；整形；可塑体

sentences.english: a plastic spoon
sentences.chinese: 塑料汤匙

sentences.english: plastic bags
sentences.chinese: 塑料袋

detailed_translations.english: made of plastic

name: stretch
trans: vt. 伸展,张开；（大量地）使用，消耗（金钱，时间）；使竭尽所能；使全力以赴；

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

detailed_translations.english: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

name: corollary
trans: n. 推论；必然的结果

sentences.english: The number of prisoners increased as a corollary of the government's determination to combat violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 政府决心打击暴力犯罪，其后果是囚犯数量增加了。

detailed_translations.english: something that is the direct result of something else

name: equanimity
trans: n. 平静；镇定

sentences.english: He received the news with surprising equanimity.
sentences.chinese: 他得到消息时显得异常镇静。

detailed_translations.english: calmness in the way that you react to things, which means that you do not become upset or annoyed

name: subsidize
trans: vt. 资助；给与奖助金；向…行贿

sentences.english: Farming is heavily subsidized (= subsidized a lot ) by the government.
sentences.chinese: 农业得到政府的大量补贴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 资助；给与奖助金；向…行贿
detailed_translations.english: if a government or organization subsidizes a company, activity etc, it pays part of its costs

name: energy
trans: n. [物] 能量；精力；活力；精神

sentences.english: Where do those kids get their energy from?
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？

sentences.english: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
sentences.chinese: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。

sentences.english: kinetic energy
sentences.chinese: 动能

detailed_translations.english: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

name: intend
trans: vi. 有打算

sentences.english: Oddly enough, that is precisely what I intend.
sentences.chinese: 说也奇怪， 那正是我的打算。

sentences.english: They intend to be an army of light against the onslaught of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算成为一支光明之师对抗黑暗军团的猛烈进攻。

name: effectively
trans: adv. 有效地，生效地；有力地；实际上

sentences.english: Children have to learn to communicate effectively.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子应该学会有效地沟通。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that produces the result that was intended

name: text book
trans: Not Found

name: homosexual
trans: n. 同性恋者

sentences.english: The judge said that discrimination against homosexuals is deplorable.
sentences.chinese: 法官说歧视同性恋的行为应该受到谴责。

detailed_translations.english: Homosexual is also a noun
if someone, especially a man, is homosexual, they are sexually attracted to people of the same sex

name: perform
trans: vt. 执行；完成；演奏

sentences.english: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。

sentences.english: The children perform two plays each school year.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。

sentences.english: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
sentences.chinese: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责，她被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music

name: mutate
trans: vi. 变化，产生突变

sentences.english: Simple organisms like bacteria mutate rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 像细菌那样的简单有机体突变的速度很快。

detailed_translations.english: if an animal or plant mutates, it becomes different from others of the same kind, because of a change in its  genetic  structure

name: integral
trans: n. 积分；部分；完整

sentences.english: Rituals, celebrations, and festivals form an integral part of every human society.
sentences.chinese: 仪式、庆典和节日是每个人类社会不可缺少的组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing

name: lease
trans: n. 租约；租期；租赁物；租赁权

sentences.english: The landlord refused to renew his lease.
sentences.chinese: 房东拒绝和他续签租约。

sentences.english: The 99-year lease expired in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 99年期的租约于1999年到期。

sentences.english: Do you understand all the terms of the lease?
sentences.chinese: 租约条款你都理解吗？

detailed_translations.english: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

detailed_translations.chinese: 出租； 租得， 租有
detailed_translations.english: to use a building, car etc under a lease

name: offense
trans: n. 犯罪，过错；进攻；触怒；引起反感的事物

sentences.english: His solicitor said he committed the offence because he was heavily in debt.
sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

sentences.english: Don’t be upset by what he said; he meant no offence (= did not intend to offend anyone ).
sentences.chinese: 不要为他的话而生气，他并没有冒犯谁的意思。

detailed_translations.english: an illegal action or a crime

name: reinforce
trans: n. 加强；加固物；加固材料

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: indolent
trans: adj. 懒惰的；无痛的

sentences.english: The former investment banker has not been indolent: his department has been a factory for acronyms since the crisis began.
sentences.chinese: 这位前投资银行家并非懒惰，自危机开始以来，他的部门已成为加工厂的代称。

sentences.english: In a 1942 presentation at the New York Academy of Medicine, the scientists reported that after lobotomy, patients did sometimes become “indolent” or “outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 在1942年纽约医学专科学院的一个介绍会中，一些科学家提出，额叶切除术后，病人的确有时变得“懒惰”或“直言”。

detailed_translations.english: lazy

name: magnify
trans: vt. 放大；赞美；夸大

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

sentences.english: The report tends to magnify the risks involved
sentences.chinese: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

name: buff
trans: n. 浅黄色；软皮；爱好者；[俚] 健康的身体

sentences.english: Sandra was buffing her nails.
sentences.chinese: 桑德拉正在擦指甲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浅黄色；软皮；爱好者；[俚] 健康的身体
detailed_translations.english: someone who is interested in wine, films etc and knows a lot about them

detailed_translations.chinese: 有软皮摩擦；缓冲；擦亮，抛光某物
detailed_translations.english: to polish something with a cloth

name: summit
trans: n. 顶点；最高级会议；最高阶层

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: banish
trans: vt. 放逐；驱逐

sentences.english: John was banished from England.
sentences.chinese: 约翰被逐出英国。

detailed_translations.english: to not allow someone or something to stay in a particular place

name: semester
trans: n. 学期；半年

sentences.english: the fall semester
sentences.chinese: 秋季学期

detailed_translations.english: one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, especially in the US

name: contract
trans: n. 合同；婚约

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: endure
trans: vt. 忍耐；容忍

sentences.english: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
sentences.chinese: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining

name: wreckage
trans: n. （失事船或飞机等的）残骸；（船只等的）失事

sentences.english: Firemen managed to pull some survivors from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员设法从残骸中拖出了几名幸存者。

detailed_translations.chinese: （失事船或飞机等的）残骸；（船只等的）失事
detailed_translations.english: the parts of something such as a plane, ship, or building that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident

name: outbound
trans: adj. 出站；驶向外国的，向外去的

name: intellectual
trans: n. 知识分子；凭理智做事者

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: coach
trans: n. 教练；旅客车厢；长途公车；四轮大马车

sentences.english: a tennis coach
sentences.chinese: 网球教练

sentences.english: the Norwegian national coach
sentences.chinese: 挪威国家队教练

detailed_translations.english: someone who trains a person or team in a sport

name: susceptible
trans: n. 易得病的人

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

name: relation
trans: n. 关系；叙述；故事；亲属关系

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

name: patronize
trans: vt. 以高人一等的态度对待；经常光顾，惠顾；资助；保护

sentences.english: Don’t patronize me!
sentences.chinese: 别对我摆出一副纡尊降贵的样子！

sentences.english: The program focuses on kids’ interests without patronizing them.
sentences.chinese: 该节目以平等的态度关注孩子们的兴趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 以高人一等的态度对待； 光顾； 赞助， 资助
detailed_translations.english: to talk to someone in a way which seems friendly but shows that you think they are not as intelligent or do not know as much as you

name: conspicuous
trans: adj. 显著的；显而易见的

sentences.english: The notice must be displayed in a conspicuous place.
sentences.chinese: 通告一定要贴在显眼的地方。

sentences.english: a bird with conspicuous white markings
sentences.chinese: 一种长有醒目白斑的鸟

sentences.english: I felt very conspicuous in my red coat.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着红外套，感觉自己十分显眼。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

name: pore over
trans: 注视；钻研；凝视

name: constructive
trans: adj. 建设性的；推定的；构造上的；有助益的

sentences.english: The meeting was very constructive.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议很有建设性。

sentences.english: We welcome any constructive criticism .
sentences.chinese: 我们欢迎任何有建设性的批评。

detailed_translations.english: useful and helpful, or likely to produce good results

name: instruct
trans: vt. 指导；通知；命令；教授

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: gainsay
trans: n. 否认；反对

sentences.english: No one dared to gainsay him.
sentences.chinese: 没有人敢反驳他。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something is not true, or to disagree with someone

name: abscond
trans: vi. 逃匿，潜逃；避债

sentences.english: He was ordered to appear the following day, but absconded.
sentences.chinese: 他被传唤于第二天出庭，却逃跑了。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from a place where you are being kept

name: computer
trans: n. 计算机；电脑；电子计算机

sentences.english: a huge global computer network
sentences.chinese: 巨大的全球计算机网络

sentences.english: the latest computer software
sentences.chinese: 最新的计算机软件

detailed_translations.english: an electronic machine that stores information and uses programs to help you find, organize, or change the information

name: chaotic
trans: adj. 混沌的；混乱的，无秩序的

sentences.english: a chaotic mixture of images
sentences.chinese: 杂乱无章的各种图像

detailed_translations.english: a chaotic situation is one in which everything is happening in a confused way

name: philosophy
trans: n. 哲学；哲理；人生观

sentences.english: Emma studies philosophy at university.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在大学攻读哲学。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

name: majority
trans: n. 多数；成年

sentences.english: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

detailed_translations.english: most of the people or things in a group

name: folder
trans: n. 文件夹；折叠机；折叠式印刷品

detailed_translations.chinese: 文件夹；折叠机；折叠式印刷品
detailed_translations.english: a container for keeping loose papers in, made of folded card or plastic

name: surreal
trans: adj. 超现实主义的；离奇的；不真实的

sentences.english: The house was a surreal mixture of opulence and decay.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子破落中透着奢华，犹如幻梦一般。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超现实主义的；离奇的；不真实的
detailed_translations.english: a situation or experience that is surreal is very strange and difficult to understand, like something from a dream

name: practical
trans: adj. 实际的；实用性的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: penetrate
trans: vi. 渗透；刺入；看透

sentences.english: bullets that penetrate thick armour plating
sentences.chinese: 穿过厚装甲的子弹

sentences.english: Sunlight barely penetrated the dirty windows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光几乎照不进那些肮脏的窗户。

detailed_translations.english: to enter something and pass or spread through it, especially when this is difficult

name: print
trans: n. 印刷业；印花布；印刷字体；印章；印记

sentences.english: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.english: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

name: root
trans: n. 根；根源；词根；祖先

sentences.english: tree roots
sentences.chinese: 树根

sentences.english: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物会长出一些细根。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
to grow roots

name: dastard
trans: n. 懦夫；卑鄙的人

name: scenario
trans: n. 方案；情节；剧本；设想

sentences.english: The conflict degenerating into civil war is everybody's nightmare scenario.
sentences.chinese: 这场冲突恶化成内战成为每个人的恶梦。

detailed_translations.english: a written description of the characters, place, and things that will happen in a film, play etc

name: educational
trans: adj. 教育的；有教育意义的

sentences.english: the educational development of children
sentences.chinese: 儿童的教育发展

detailed_translations.english: relating to education

name: obtain
trans: vi. 获得；流行

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: rhythmical
trans: adj. 有节奏的；有韵律的

sentences.english: Good breathing is slow, rhythmic and deep.
sentences.chinese: 良好的呼吸缓慢、有节奏并且深沉。

detailed_translations.english: A rhythmic movement or sound is repeated at regular intervals, forming a regular pattern or beat

name: stick
trans: n. 棍；手杖；呆头呆脑的人

sentences.english: a pair of drum sticks
sentences.chinese: 一对鼓槌

sentences.english: a measuring stick
sentences.chinese: 量尺

sentences.english: Aunt Lou walks with a stick (= uses a stick to help her walk ) .
sentences.chinese: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

name: concoct
trans: vt. 捏造；混合而制；调合；图谋

sentences.english: John concocted an elaborate excuse for being late.
sentences.chinese: 约翰为迟到编了一个巧妙的借口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 捏造；混合而制；调合；图谋
detailed_translations.english: to invent a clever story, excuse, or plan, especially in order to deceive someone

name: earthquake
trans: n. 地震；大动荡

sentences.english: An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale struck southern California on June 28.
sentences.chinese: 6月28日加州南部地区发生了里氏6.1级地震。

sentences.english: The city is in an earthquake zone.
sentences.chinese: 该市位于地震带。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

name: subjective
trans: adj. 主观的；个人的；自觉的

sentences.english: As a critic, he is far too subjective.
sentences.chinese: 作为评论家，他过于主观。

sentences.english: a highly subjective point of view
sentences.chinese: 相当主观的看法

detailed_translations.english: a state-ment, report, attitude etc that is subjective is influenced by personal opinion and can therefore be unfair

name: overextend
trans: vt. 过分扩展；过分延长；使…承担过多的义务

sentences.english: Jackson’s company became overextended financially.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊的公司财务上开支过大了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过分扩展；过分延长；使…承担过多的义务

name: inadequate
trans: adj. 不充分的，不适当的

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

name: competitive
trans: adj. 竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

sentences.english: Competitive sports encourage children to work together as a team.
sentences.chinese: 竞技体育鼓励孩子们进行团队协作。

sentences.english: Advertising is an intensely competitive business.
sentences.chinese: 广告业是一个竞争激烈的行业。

detailed_translations.english: relating to competition

name: lecture
trans: n. 演讲；讲稿；教训

sentences.english: He regularly gives lectures on modern French literature.
sentences.chinese: 他经常讲授法国现代文学课程。

sentences.english: He lectures on European art at Manchester University.
sentences.chinese: 他在曼彻斯特大学讲授欧洲艺术。

detailed_translations.english: a long talk on a particular subject that someone gives to a group of people, especially to students in a university
to talk to a group of people on a particular subject, especially to students in a university

name: identification
trans: n. 鉴定，识别；认同；身份证明

sentences.english: Do you have any identification?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: His body was taken to Brighton mortuary for identification.
sentences.chinese: 他的尸体被送到布赖顿停尸所确认身份。

detailed_translations.english: official papers or cards, such as your passport, that prove who you are

name: exposure
trans: n. 暴露；曝光；揭露；陈列

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: pollination
trans: n. [农学] 授粉（作用）

sentences.english: The new research provides early evidence that climate change may be playing a role in driving down pollination.
sentences.chinese: 这项新的研究提供了初步证据，气候变化可能是促使授粉减少的一个因素。

sentences.english: They say there is risk of 'gene pollution' — where the inserted gene of GM plants affects non-target plants of similar kinds via pollination.
sentences.chinese: 他们说存在“基因污染”的危险——插入基因片段的转基因作物通过授粉途径对类似的非目标作物产生影响。

sentences.english: This is sobering because it suggests that pollination is vulnerable even in a relatively pristine environment that is free of pesticides and human disturbance but still subject to climate change.
sentences.chinese: 这是发人深省的，它表明授粉过程极易被打乱，甚至在一个相对平静安定的环境，没有农药和人为干扰，但仍然受到气候变化的影响。

name: supposition
trans: n. 假定；推测；想像；见解

sentences.english: His version of events is pure supposition .
sentences.chinese: 他对事情的说法纯属推测。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think is true, even though you are not certain and cannot prove it

name: survive
trans: vi. 幸存；活下来

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: bovine
trans: n. 牛科动物

sentences.english: bovine diseases
sentences.chinese: 牛病

detailed_translations.english: relating to cows

name: tidal
trans: adj. 潮汐的；潮的，有关潮水的；定时涨落的

sentences.english: tidal currents
sentences.chinese: 潮流

detailed_translations.chinese: 潮汐的；潮的，有关潮水的；定时涨落的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the regular rising and falling of the sea

name: sewage
trans: n. 污水；下水道；污物

sentences.english: Chlorine is used in sewage treatment.
sentences.chinese: 氯被用于污水处理。

sentences.english: The factory secretly dumped millions of gallons of raw sewage (= sewage that had not been treated ) into the Ohio river.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂偷偷地把几百万加仑未经处理的污水排放进了俄亥俄河。

detailed_translations.english: the mixture of waste from the human body and used water, that is carried away from houses by pipes under the ground

name: comprehensive
trans: n. 综合学校；专业综合测验

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: convincible
trans: adj. 可使信服的；可说服的

name: array
trans: n. 数组，阵列；排列，列阵；大批，一系列；衣服

sentences.english: make-up arrayed on the bathroom counter
sentences.chinese: 盥洗台上摆放整齐的化妆品

sentences.english: We visited the local markets and saw wonderful arrays of fruit and vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了当地的市场，看到了漂亮地摆放着的水果蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange something in an attractive way
An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

name: suit
trans: n. 诉讼；恳求；套装，西装；一套外衣

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

name: prerequisite
trans: n. 先决条件

sentences.english: A person with ambition is the prerequisite to success.
sentences.chinese: 一个人有雄心壮志是成功的先决条件。

sentences.english: Historical changes to the production of embroidered shoes with embroidery into a local evaluation of the level of ingenuity of a girl prerequisite.
sentences.chinese: 历史的变革使绣花鞋的制作与刺绣水平成为当地评价一个姑娘心灵手巧的先决条件。

sentences.english: Anyone has the possibility to succeed, but the prerequisite of success is your own, both industry knowledge learning and the cultivation of innovation ability, requires great effort.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都有成功的可能性，但成功的先决条件在于你自身，无论是行业知识的学习还是创新能力的培养，都需要付出极大的努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必备的， 作为先决条件的

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary before something else can happen or be done

name: particular
trans: n. 详细说明；个别项目

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

name: monument
trans: n. 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: dissertation
trans: n. 论文，专题；学术演讲

sentences.english: He is currently writing a dissertation on the Somali civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他正在写一篇关于索马里内战的论文。

detailed_translations.chinese: (博士学位)论文，学术演讲，专题论文
detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree

name: horse-riding
trans: 骑马

name: humanity
trans: n. 人类；人道；仁慈；人文学科

sentences.english: We want a clean healthy environment for all humanity .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望全人类拥有一个干净健康的生存环境。

sentences.english: crimes against humanity
sentences.chinese: 反人类罪

sentences.english: We must never forget our common humanity.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远不要忘记共同的人性。

detailed_translations.english: people in general

name: manufacturer
trans: n. 制造商；[经] 厂商

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer’s instructions before using your new dishwasher.
sentences.chinese: 使用新洗碗机之前，请先阅读厂家的说明书。

sentences.english: The fridge was sent back to the manufacturers.
sentences.chinese: 那台冰箱被退还给厂家了。

detailed_translations.english: a company that makes large quantities of goods

name: monetary
trans: adj. 货币的；财政的

sentences.english: the government’s tight monetary policy
sentences.chinese: 政府从紧的货币政策

sentences.english: objects of little monetary value
sentences.chinese: 不值钱的物件

detailed_translations.english: relating to money, especially all the money in a particular country

name: gradual
trans: n. 弥撒升阶圣歌集

sentences.english: There has been a gradual change in climate.
sentences.chinese: 气候渐渐发生了变化。

sentences.english: the gradual decline in manufacturing industry
sentences.chinese: 制造业的逐渐衰退

sentences.english: Education is a gradual process.
sentences.chinese: 教育是一个循序渐进的过程。

detailed_translations.english: happening slowly over a long period of time

name: paradox
trans: n. 悖论，反论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的人或事

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

name: domestic
trans: n. 国货；佣人

sentences.english: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 30 leading U.S. destinations.
sentences.chinese: …每天飞往美国30个主要目的地的100多个国内航班。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

name: recondite
trans: adj. 深奥的；隐藏的；默默无闻的

sentences.english: Her poems are modishly experimental in style and recondite in subject matter.
sentences.chinese: 她的诗在风格上时尚朦胧，在主题上深奥难懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 深奥的；隐藏的；默默无闻的
detailed_translations.english: recondite facts or subjects are not known about or understood by many people

name: initiate
trans: n. 开始；新加入者，接受初步知识者

sentences.english: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定向该报提起法律诉讼。

sentences.english: Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子就恐怖主义发起了辩论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始， 创造， 发起； 使初步了解； 接纳， 让…加入
detailed_translations.english: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets

name: tedious
trans: adj. 沉闷的；冗长乏味的

sentences.english: The audience coughed down the tedious speaker.
sentences.chinese: 听众用咳嗽声阻挠演讲人的沉闷发言。

sentences.english: There's no point in labouring at a tedious task.
sentences.chinese: 辛苦地干单调乏味的工作没有意义。

name: practitioner
trans: n. 开业者，从业者，执业医生

sentences.english: RMC provides structure in three areas for the practitioner: productivity, guidance , and personalization.
sentences.chinese: RMC在三个领域为从业者提供了结构：生产力，指导和个性化。

sentences.english: The dictionary is mainly for civil aviation practitioner, aviation majored students and Aviation enthusiasts.
sentences.chinese: 词典主要面向民航从业人员、航空专业学员以及航空爱好者。

sentences.english: The articulation of work and life, cast as work-life balance, has become a key feature of much current government, practitioner and academic debate.
sentences.chinese: 当今的工作和生活，扮演工作与生活的平衡，已成为一个关键特性当前的很多政府、从业者和学术争论。

name: draw back

trans: vt. 证明；展示；论证

sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露

name: Kaleidoscope
trans: Not Found

trans: v. 调查；研究

sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

trans: n. 适当；礼节；得体

sentences.english: strict in observing the proprieties
sentences.chinese: 严格遵守礼节的

detailed_translations.english: correctness of social or moral behaviour

trans: n. 山峰；最高点；顶点；帽舌

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

trans: n. 损失，代价；消费；开支

sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

name: corporate
trans: adj. 法人的；共同的，全体的；社团的；公司的；企业的

sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

name: inform
trans: vi. 告发；告密

sentences.english: They would inform him of any progress they had made.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.chinese: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it
to officially tell someone about something or give them information

name: cosmetic
trans: n. 化妆品；装饰品

sentences.english: the cosmetic industry
sentences.chinese: 化妆品行业

sentences.english: cosmetic products
sentences.chinese: 美容产品

sentences.english: Are you on the diet for health or cosmetic reasons?
sentences.chinese: 你节食是为了健康还是为了美丽？

sentences.english: ...the cosmetics counter of a department store.
sentences.chinese: …一个百货商店的化妆品专柜。

detailed_translations.english: intended to make your hair, skin, body etc look more attractive
Cosmetics are substances such as lipstick or powder, which people put on their face to make themselves look more attractive

name: micro-computer
trans: Not Found

name: enjoy
trans: vt. 欣赏，享受；喜爱；使过得快活

sentences.english: We thoroughly enjoyed our time in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我们在纽约的时间过得十分快活。

sentences.english: Thanks for a great evening. I really enjoyed it.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你这美好的晚会。我真的玩得很开心。

detailed_translations.english: to get pleasure from something

name: wander
trans: vi. 徘徊；漫步；迷路；离题

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

name: minus
trans: prep. 减，减去

sentences.english: The payment will be refunded to you minus a small service charge.
sentences.chinese: 这笔款项扣除一小笔服务费后将退还给你。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that one number or quantity is being  subtract ed  from another

used to talk about a disadvantage of a thing or situation

trans: n. 价值；重要；重大；傲慢

sentences.chinese: 他自以为很了不起。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being important

name: burst
trans: n. 爆发，突发；爆炸

sentences.english: The pipes had burst and the house was under two feet of water.
sentences.chinese: 水管爆裂，房子被水淹了两英尺。

sentences.english: a sudden burst of activity/energy/anger/enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 活动 / 能量 / 怒火 / 热情的迸发

detailed_translations.english: if something bursts, or if you burst it, it breaks open or apart suddenly and violently so that its contents come out
the act of something bursting or the place where it has burst

name: individuality
trans: n. 个性；个人；个人特征；个人的嗜好（通常复数）

sentences.english: We like our staff to show their individuality rather than wear a uniform.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢员工穿出个性，而不是穿制服。

detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone or something different from other things or people

name: absent-minded
trans: adj. 心不在焉的；健忘的；出神的

sentences.english: Grandad’s been getting rather absent-minded lately.
sentences.chinese: 爷爷最近变得越发健忘了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心不在焉的， 出神的
detailed_translations.english: likely to forget things, especially because you are thinking about something else

name: console
trans: n. [计] 控制台；[电] 操纵台

sentences.chinese: 彼得去世时没人能够安慰她。

a flat board that contains the controls for a machine, piece of electrical equipment, computer etc

trans: vt. 理解；包含；由…组成

sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.

trans: vt. 确认；确定；证实；批准；使巩固

sentences.chinese: 新的证据证实了第一个证人的说法。

sentences.chinese: 为了证实我的诊断，我要做一些化验。

sentences.english: Could you confirm the dates we discussed?
sentences.chinese: 你能确认我们商讨过的日期吗？

sentences.english: After a six-month probationary period, her position was confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的试用期后，她获准正式担任该职。

name: weight-lift
trans: Not Found

name: safety
trans: n. 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打

sentences.chinese: 为安全起见，不要独自一人旅行。

sentences.english: For your own safety , please do not smoke inside the plane.
sentences.chinese: 为了您自身的安全，请不要在飞机上吸烟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安全；保险；安全设备；保险装置；安打

trans: n. 扣除，减除；推论；减除额

sentences.chinese: 儿童不久就能推断词义了。

detailed_translations.english: the process of using the knowledge or information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion, or the opinion that you form

trans: n. [气象] 龙卷风；旋风；暴风；大雷雨

sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.chinese: 龙卷风即将来临，因此我们最好把这里的舱口封上，到地下室去。

trans: n. 荒野

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["wild animals"]}
sentences.chinese: 野生动物

sentences.english: a field full of wild flowers
sentences.chinese: 遍地野花的田野

sentences.english: animals both wild and domesticated
sentences.chinese: 野生动物和家养动物

detailed_translations.chinese: 野生的；野蛮的；狂热的；荒凉的
detailed_translations.english: living in a natural state, not changed or controlled by people
in natural and free conditions, not kept or controlled by people
if plants run wild, they grow a lot in an uncontrolled way

trans: n. 规定；条款；准备；[经] 供应品

sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

name: recommend
trans: vt. 推荐，介绍；劝告；使受欢迎；托付

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

trans: adj. [数] 负的；消极的；否定的；阴性的

sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的

name: link
trans: n. [计] 链环，环节；联系，关系

sentences.chinese: 他与她挽臂同行。

detailed_translations.english: to join two things by putting one through the other
each ring of a chain

trans: adj. 愚笨的；昏庸的；发呆的；自满的
