trans: n. 个性；品格；名人

sentences.english: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管个性不同，他们还是成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这种病会导致性格变化。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

name: refinement
trans: n. 精制；文雅；[化工][油气][冶] 提纯

sentences.english: Her mother is a woman with great refinement.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲是一个非常文雅的女人。

detailed_translations.english: Refinement is politeness and good manners

name: exam
trans: n. 考试；测验

sentences.english: At the end of each level, there’s an exam.
sentences.chinese: 在每一级别结束时都有一次考试。

sentences.english: How did you do in your exams?
sentences.chinese: 你考试考得怎么样？

sentences.english: an eye exam
sentences.chinese: 眼睛检查

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one

name: context
trans: n. 环境；上下文；来龙去脉

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

name: apprentice
trans: n. 学徒；生手

sentences.english: The apprentice lingered his work.
sentences.chinese: 这个徒弟磨洋工。

sentences.english: His apprentice always leaves the tools about.
sentences.chinese: 他的徒弟老是乱放工具。

sentences.english: That would be good for my apprentice to have, complementary.
sentences.chinese: 补充说一下，那会是成为我徒弟的优势。

name: reprint
trans: n. 重印；翻版

sentences.english: It remained an exceptionally rare book until it was reprinted in 1918.
sentences.chinese: 在1918年再版之前，这本书一直非常罕见。

detailed_translations.english: to print a book, story, newspaper article etc again
an occasion when more copies of a book are printed because all the copies of it have been sold

name: arise
trans: vi. 出现；上升；起立

sentences.english: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

name: sombre
trans: adj. 阴沉的；忧郁的；昏暗的

sentences.english: They sat in sombre silence.
sentences.chinese: 他们闷闷不乐地坐着，一声不吭。

sentences.english: We were all in a somber mood that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我们所有人都心情沉重。

sentences.english: a sombre expression
sentences.chinese: 忧郁的表情

sentences.english: on the sombre occasion of his mother’s funeral
sentences.chinese: 在他母亲葬礼的那种严肃场合

detailed_translations.english: sad and serious

name: democracy
trans: n. 民主，民主主义；民主政治

sentences.english: a return to democracy after 16 years of military rule
sentences.chinese: 16年军人统治后民主制度的恢复

detailed_translations.english: a system of government in which every citizen in the country can vote to elect its government officials

name: recuperate
trans: vi. 恢复，复原；挽回损失

sentences.english: We’ve recuperated our losses.
sentences.chinese: 我们已挽回损失。

detailed_translations.english: to get better again after an illness or injury

name: constitute
trans: vt. 组成，构成；建立；任命

sentences.english: We must redefine what constitutes a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须对家庭的构成重新定义。

detailed_translations.english: to be the parts that together form sth

name: horror
trans: n. 惊骇；惨状；极端厌恶；令人恐怖的事物

sentences.english: People watched in horror as the plane crashed to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 人们惊恐地看着飞机坠落到地面上。

sentences.english: The thought of being left alone filled her with horror.
sentences.chinese: 想到被孤零零地留下，她就不寒而栗。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great shock, fear or disgust

name: bombastic
trans: adj. 夸大的；言过其实的

sentences.english: He was vain and bombastic.
sentences.chinese: 他既虚荣又浮夸。

sentences.english: ...the bombastic style adopted by his predecessor.
sentences.chinese: …他的前任采取的浮夸方式。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as bombastic, you are criticizing them for trying to impress other people by saying things that sound impressive but have little meaning

name: masonry
trans: n. 石工；石工行业；石造建筑

sentences.english: Several people were buried under falling masonry.
sentences.chinese: 好几个人被埋在倒塌的砖石下面。

detailed_translations.english: the bricks or stone from which a building, wall etc has been made

name: accusation
trans: n. 控告，指控；谴责

sentences.english: The main accusation levelled against him was that he tried to avoid military service.
sentences.chinese: 对他提出的主要指控是他想逃避兵役。

sentences.english: Burton’s enemies had made false accusations against him.
sentences.chinese: 伯顿的敌人对他提出不实的指责。

sentences.english: She’s made all sorts of wild accusations against me in the past.
sentences.chinese: 她过去对我妄加指责，说了种种不是。

sentences.english: They fled the country, amid accusations of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 在一片贪污腐败的指责声中，他们逃离了该国。

detailed_translations.english: a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong

name: Congress
trans: n. 国会；代表大会；会议；社交

name: shove
trans: n. 推；挤

sentences.english: He shoved her towards the car.
sentences.chinese: 他推着她走向汽车。

sentences.english: Everyone was pushing and shoving to see the prince.
sentences.chinese: 大家都推着挤着要看王子。

detailed_translations.english: to push someone or something in a rough or careless way, using your hands or shoulders
to put something somewhere carelessly or without thinking much
a strong push

name: appellation
trans: n. 称呼；名称；名目

sentences.english: He earned the appellation "rebel priest."
sentences.chinese: 他得了一个“叛逆牧师”的称号。

detailed_translations.english: a name or title

name: encounter
trans: n. 遭遇，偶然碰见

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: portion
trans: n. 部分；一份；命运

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: assistant
trans: n. 助手，助理，助教

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

name: encroachment
trans: n. 侵入，侵犯；侵蚀

sentences.english: It's a sign of the encroachment of commercialism in medicine.
sentences.chinese: 这是营利主义入侵医学界的一种迹象。

detailed_translations.english: You can describe the action or process of encroaching on something as encroachment

name: planet
trans: n. 行星

sentences.english: The picture shows six of the nine planets in the solar system.
sentences.chinese: 这张图片展示太阳系9个行星中的6个行星。

detailed_translations.english: A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet.

name: syndrome
trans: n. [临床] 综合症状；并发症状；校验子；并发位

sentences.english: people who suffer from irritable bowel syndrome
sentences.chinese: 患有肠道过敏综合征的人

detailed_translations.chinese: [临床] 综合症状；并发症状；校验子；并发位
detailed_translations.english: an illness which consists of a set of physical or mental problems – often used in the name of illnesses

name: harvest
trans: n. 收获；产量；结果

sentences.english: every year at harvest time
sentences.chinese: 每年在收获的季节

sentences.english: Plum growers are expecting a bumper harvest this year.
sentences.chinese: 种植李树的农民期盼着今年有个好收成。

detailed_translations.english: the time when crops are gathered from the fields, or the act of gathering them
to gather crops from the fields

name: regime
trans: n. 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: speciality
trans: n. 专业，专长；特性

sentences.english: the region’s speciality cheese
sentences.chinese: 该地区的特色干酪

sentences.english: His speciality is international law.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是国际法。

detailed_translations.chinese: (specialty) 特色食品; 特产；专业；专门研究；专长
detailed_translations.english: Someone's speciality is a particular type of work that they do most or do best, or a subject that they know a lot about

name: disparage
trans: vt. 蔑视；毁谤

sentences.english: ...Larkin's tendency to disparage literature.
sentences.chinese: …拉金诋毁文学的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: If you disparage someone or something, you speak about them in a way which shows that you do not have a good opinion of them

name: pseudo
trans: n. 伪君子；假冒的人

sentences.english: In the limit of read-mostly applications this can rise to nearly 100% giving a dynamic system with pseudo static performance.
sentences.chinese: 在一个基本上只读的应用中，如果给动态系统以假的静态性能，这个数字几乎可以达到100%。

detailed_translations.english: not genuine; pretended

name: crocodile
trans: n. 鳄鱼

sentences.english: a crocodile briefcase
sentences.chinese: 鳄鱼皮公文包

detailed_translations.english: a large  reptile  with a long mouth and many sharp teeth that lives in lakes and rivers in hot wet parts of the world

name: tolerate
trans: vt. 忍受；默许；宽恕

sentences.english: We simply will not tolerate vigilante groups on our streets.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不容许有自行惩办犯罪的组织出现在我们的街头。

sentences.english: This sort of behaviour will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为是不能容许的。

detailed_translations.english: to allow people to do, say, or believe something without criticizing or punishing them

name: resident
trans: n. 居民；住院医生

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: linguistics
trans: n. 语言学

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: It took three hours for the doctor of linguistics to tell us this. Again I quit.
sentences.chinese: 关于这一点，这个语言学博士足足讲了三个小时，我再次退出了。

sentences.english: Then we have research center in Grenoble, France where the focus is all on linguistics, machine learning.
sentences.chinese: 我们在法国格勒诺布尔也有研究中心,研究重点是语言学和机器学习。

detailed_translations.english: the study of language in general and of particular languages, their structure, grammar, and history

name: distend
trans: vt. 使…膨胀；使…扩张

sentences.english: Blood vessels in the lungs are filled and distend. Capillary changes have been observed in the animal model of simulated microgravity.
sentences.chinese: 肺血管充盈、扩张，并在模拟微重力动物模型中观察到肺微血管损伤。

sentences.english: The primary role of AM is to distend blood vessel and decrease blood pressure, and it can also restrain the migration of vessel smooth muscle cells.
sentences.chinese: AM在休克发生发展过程的作用主要是扩张血管，降低血压，还具有抑制血管平滑肌细胞迁移等作用。

sentences.english: Conclusion:Nifedipine could distend ophthalmic artery and has similar function on other micro-cerebral vessels.
sentences.chinese: 结论：硝苯地平可扩张眼动脉，对脑部其它小动脉可能有相似作用。

name: variable
trans: n. [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: site
trans: n. 地点；位置；场所

sentences.english: an archaeological site
sentences.chinese: 考古现场

detailed_translations.english: a place where something important or interesting happened
to place or build something in a particular place

name: likelihood
trans: n. 可能性，可能

sentences.english: Using a seatbelt will reduce the likelihood of serious injury in a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 系安全带可以降低在车祸中受重伤的可能性。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something can reasonably be expected to happen

name: analysis
trans: n. 分析；分解；验定

sentences.english: She’s been in analysis for three years.
sentences.chinese: 她接受精神分析治疗已经三年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析， 分析报告； 分解， 解析
detailed_translations.english: a process in which a doctor makes someone talk about their past experiences, relationships etc in order to help them with mental or emotional problems

name: commensurate
trans: adj. 相称的；同量的；同样大小的

sentences.english: Employees are paid salaries commensurate with those of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 发给雇员的薪水与发给教师的薪水相当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 相称的；同量的；同样大小的
detailed_translations.english: matching something in size, quality, or length of time

name: chancellor
trans: n. 总理（德、奥等的）；（英）大臣；校长（美国某些大学的）；（英）大法官；（美）首席法官

sentences.english: Helmut Kohl, the former German Chancellor
sentences.chinese: 赫尔穆特•科尔，德国前总理

detailed_translations.chinese: 总理（德、奥等的）；（英）大臣；校长（美国某些大学的）；（英）大法官；（美）首席法官
detailed_translations.english: the Chancellor of the Exchequer

name: rare
trans: adj. 稀有的；稀薄的；半熟的

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: hip
trans: n. 臀部；蔷薇果；忧郁

sentences.english: She stood there with her hands on her hips glaring at him.
sentences.chinese: 她站在那里，双手叉腰瞪着他。

sentences.english: The old lady had fallen and broken her hip.
sentences.chinese: 那老妇人摔了一跤，髋部骨折。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two parts on each side of your body between the top of your leg and your waist

detailed_translations.chinese: 熟悉内情的；非常时尚的
detailed_translations.english: doing things or done according to the latest fashion

name: induce
trans: vt. 诱导；引起；引诱；感应

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: resolve
trans: n. 坚决；决定要做的事

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: truculence
trans: n. 野蛮；好战；刻薄；致命性（等于truculency）

name: forestall
trans: vt. 先发制人，预先阻止；垄断，屯积；领先；占先一步

sentences.english: a measure intended to forestall further attacks
sentences.chinese: 意在预先阻止进一步攻击的措施

detailed_translations.chinese: 先发制人，预先阻止；垄断，屯积；领先；占先一步
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from happening or prevent someone from doing something by doing something first

name: athletic
trans: adj. 运动的，运动员的；体格健壮的

sentences.english: a tall athletic man
sentences.chinese: 一个高大强壮的男子

detailed_translations.english: physically strong and good at sport

name: execution
trans: n. 执行，实行；完成；死刑

sentences.english: a public execution
sentences.chinese: 当众处死

sentences.english: The two men face execution (= They will be killed as a punishment ).
sentences.chinese: 两名男子面临处决。

sentences.english: Torture and summary execution (= execution without a trial or any legal process ) are common.
sentences.chinese: 严刑拷打和不经审判就地处决相当普遍。

sentences.english: He was granted a stay of execution (= delay in carrying out an execution ).
sentences.chinese: 他被准予缓期处决。

detailed_translations.chinese: 死刑； 实行， 执行， 履行； 演奏， 表演
detailed_translations.english: when someone is killed, especially as a legal punishment

name: predominate
trans: vt. 支配，主宰；在…中占优势

sentences.english: In this type of case, the rights of the parent predominate.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的案例，要首先考虑父母的权利。

detailed_translations.english: to have the most importance or influence, or to be most easily noticed

name: unique
trans: n. 独一无二的人或物

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: collective
trans: n. 集团；集合体；集合名词

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: sting
trans: n. 刺痛；讽刺，刺激；刺毛

sentences.english: She felt the sting of tears in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉泪水刺痛了眼睛。

sentences.english: He was stung by a bee.
sentences.chinese: 他被蜜蜂蜇了。

detailed_translations.english: a sharp pain in your eyes or skin, caused by being hit, by smoke etc
(of an insect or plant) to touch your skin or make a very small hole in it so that you feel a sharp pain

name: leisure
trans: n. 闲暇；空闲；安逸

sentences.english: Most people now enjoy shorter working hours and more leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 现在大多数人都喜欢工作时间短些，闲暇时间多些。

sentences.english: Watching television is now the nation’s most popular leisure activity.
sentences.chinese: 看电视是当前国民最普遍的消遣活动。

sentences.english: The hotel offers various leisure facilities such as a swimming pool and sauna.
sentences.chinese: 酒店提供游泳池、桑拿浴室等各种休闲设施。

sentences.english: The leisure industry (= the business of providing leisure activities ) is now an important part of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 现在休闲娱乐行业是经济的一个重要组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: time when you are not working or studying and can relax and do things you enjoy

name: spot
trans: n. 地点；斑点

sentences.english: a nice quiet spot on the beach
sentences.chinese: 海滩上一个安静的好地方

sentences.english: I chose a spot well away from the road.
sentences.chinese: 我选了一个远离马路的地点。

detailed_translations.english: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time

detailed_translations.chinese: 认出， 发现； 玷污
detailed_translations.english: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

name: free trade
trans: n. 自由贸易（制度）

name: stereotype
trans: n. 陈腔滥调，老套；铅版

sentences.english: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 对成功的商人们总有一种成见。

detailed_translations.english: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

name: awake
trans: adj. 醒着的

sentences.english: I hope he’s awake now.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.english: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.english: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
sentences.chinese: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？

sentences.english: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛忧心忡忡，半宿都没睡着。

sentences.english: The noise brought him wide awake (=  completely awake  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.english: It was midday when she awoke.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

detailed_translations.english: not sleeping
to wake up, or to make someone wake up

name: ban
trans: n. 禁令，禁忌

sentences.english: Smoking is banned in the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

name: facilitate
trans: vt. 促进；帮助；使容易

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: narrate
trans: vt. 叙述；给…作旁白

sentences.english: The main character narrates the story.
sentences.chinese: 主人公讲述故事。

detailed_translations.english: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: origin
trans: n. 起源；原点；出身；开端

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: enologist
trans: Not Found

name: shape
trans: n. 形状；模型；身材；具体化

sentences.english: What shape is the table?
sentences.chinese: 那张桌子是什么形状的？

sentences.english: You can recognize a tree by the shape of its leaves.
sentences.chinese: 可以根据树叶的形状辨认出是什么树。

sentences.english: His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
sentences.chinese: 他那顶破旧的帽子已经完全变形了。

sentences.english: The plants grow in every shape and size .
sentences.chinese: 这些植物有各种形状，各种大小。

sentences.english: The children cut out shapes (= squares, triangles etc ) from the piece of cardboard.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们把卡纸片剪成各种形状。

detailed_translations.english: the form that something has, for example round, square,  triangular  etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成；塑造，使成形；使符合
detailed_translations.english: to influence something such as a belief, opinion etc and make it develop in a particular way

name: dispersion
trans: n. 散布；[统计][数] 离差；驱散

name: wary
trans: adj. 谨慎的；机警的；惟恐的；考虑周到的

sentences.english: Keep a wary eye on the weather before you set sail.
sentences.chinese: 出航前要密切注意天气。

sentences.english: She had a wary expression on her face.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上带着小心谨慎的表情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谨慎的；机警的；惟恐的；考虑周到的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is wary is careful because they think something might be dangerous or harmful

name: golf
trans: n. 高尔夫球；高尔夫球运动

sentences.english: He plays golf on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 他星期天都去打高尔夫球。

sentences.english: a round of golf
sentences.chinese: 一场高尔夫球赛

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尔夫球；高尔夫球运动
detailed_translations.english: a game in which the players hit a small white ball into holes in the ground with a set of golf clubs, using as few hits as possible

name: simplicity
trans: n. 朴素；简易；天真；愚蠢

sentences.english: Mona wrote with a beautiful simplicity of style.
sentences.chinese: 莫娜的文笔朴实优美。

sentences.english: For the sake of simplicity, the tax form is divided into three sections.
sentences.chinese: 为简明起见，税单分成三个部分。

sentences.english: James’ solution to this problem was simplicity itself (= very simple ) .
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯对这个问题的解决办法十分简单。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being simple and not complicated, especially when this is attractive or useful

name: handle
trans: n. [建] 把手；柄；手感；口实

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

name: vital
trans: adj. 至关重要的；生死攸关的；有活力的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: advancement
trans: n. 前进，进步；提升

sentences.english: career advancement
sentences.chinese: 职业发展

sentences.english: advancements in science
sentences.chinese: 科学进步

detailed_translations.english: progress or development in your job, level of knowledge etc

name: attraction
trans: n. 吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物

sentences.english: Sexual attraction is a large part of falling in love.
sentences.chinese: 堕入爱河很大部分是由于性吸引。

sentences.english: gravitational/magnetic attraction
sentences.chinese: 地心引力；磁力

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of liking sb, especially sexually

name: geothermal
trans: adj. [地物] 地热的；[地物] 地温的

sentences.english: a geothermal energy plant
sentences.chinese: 地热能工厂

detailed_translations.english: relating to or coming from the heat inside the Earth

name: huge
trans: adj. 巨大的；庞大的；无限的

sentences.english: a huge dog
sentences.chinese: 一条大狗

sentences.english: huge crowds
sentences.chinese: 大群大群的人

sentences.english: Your room’s huge compared to mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的房间跟我的比很大。

sentences.english: These shoes make my feet look huge.
sentences.chinese: 这双鞋让我的脚看上去大极了。

sentences.english: the huge scale of the problem
sentences.chinese: 该问题的严重性

detailed_translations.english: extremely large in size, amount, or degree

name: derivative
trans: n. [化学] 衍生物，派生物；导数

sentences.english: the derivatives market
sentences.chinese: 金融衍生品市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 衍生物，派生物；导数
detailed_translations.english: something that has developed or been produced from something else

name: mode
trans: n. 模式；方式；风格；时尚

sentences.english: the most efficient mode of transport
sentences.chinese: 最高效的运输方式

sentences.english: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
sentences.chinese: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

name: combination
trans: n. 结合；组合；联合；[化学] 化合

sentences.english: a combination nightclub and café
sentences.chinese: 夜总会兼咖啡馆

detailed_translations.english: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together

name: sector
trans: n. 部门；扇形，扇区；象限仪；函数尺

sentences.english: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.
sentences.chinese: …该国的制造部门。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

name: parasitic
trans: adj. 寄生的（等于parasitical）

sentences.english: parasitic fungi
sentences.chinese: 寄生真菌

detailed_translations.english: living in or on another plant or animal and getting food from them

name: risk
trans: n. 风险；危险；冒险

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: merit
trans: n. 优点，价值；功绩；功过

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

detailed_translations.english: an advantage or good feature of something
to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

name: reprobate
trans: n. 恶棍，无赖

sentences.english: Surely His pleading with the lost, His offers of mercy to the reprobate, and the call of the gospel to all who hear are all sincere expressions of the heart of a loving God.
sentences.chinese: 他对迷失方向的的人的恳求，他对堕落的人的同情，他对所有听到他声音的人施与福音，这一切真挚的表达都源于他充满爱的心。

sentences.english: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
sentences.chinese: 他们说是认识神行事却和他相背。 本是可憎恶的，是悖逆的，在各样善事上是可废弃的。

name: intercourse
trans: n. 性交；交往；交流

sentences.english: social intercourse
sentences.chinese: 社交

detailed_translations.english: an exchange of ideas, feelings etc which make people or groups understand each other better

name: documentation
trans: n. 文件, 证明文件, 史实, 文件编制

sentences.english: Applicants must provide supporting documentation .
sentences.chinese: 申请人必须提供证明文件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文件, 证明文件, 史实, 文件编制
detailed_translations.english: official documents, reports etc that are used to prove that something is true or correct

name: cognitive
trans: adj. 认知的，认识的

sentences.english: cognitive psychology
sentences.chinese: 认知心理学

detailed_translations.english: related to the process of knowing, understanding, and learning something

name: discrepancy
trans: n. 不符；矛盾；相差

sentences.english: A modification of the common-origin theory accounts for the density discrepancy .
sentences.chinese: 关于共同起源的理论，有一种改进的论点解释了密度的不符。

detailed_translations.english: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same

name: comedian

sentences.english: He started as a stand-up comedian (= someone who tells jokes to an audience ) .
sentences.chinese: 他最初是一名单口喜剧演员。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to tell jokes and make people laugh

name: amphibian
trans: n. [脊椎] 两栖动物；水陆两用飞机；具有双重性格的人

sentences.english: At first this amphibian deals with the cooler days by burying itself in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 起初，天气乍凉的时候，这种两栖动物将自己埋在土壤里。

sentences.english: Why does the speaker choose that amphibian as her representative of a public creature?
sentences.chinese: 诗人为何选择这个两栖动物作为公众人物的代表？

sentences.english: "Almost all of them were abandoned somewhere in the city, " said Wu Weichun, the director of the zoo's amphibian department, to the Shanghai Dailynewspaper.
sentences.chinese: “它们中几乎所有都是在城市里被遗弃的，”动物园两栖动物馆主任吴文春对《上海每日新闻报》说。

detailed_translations.english: an animal such as a  frog  that can live both on land and in water

name: assignment
trans: n. 分配；任务；作业；功课

sentences.english: She’s gone to Italy on a special assignment.
sentences.chinese: 她去意大利执行一项特殊任务。

sentences.english: a history assignment
sentences.chinese: 历史作业

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that is given to someone as part of their job

name: architecture
trans: n. 建筑学；建筑风格；建筑式样；架构

sentences.english: modern/classical/medieval etc architecture
sentences.chinese: 现代/古典/中世纪等的建筑风格

sentences.english: He studied architecture at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学里读的是建筑学。

detailed_translations.english: the style and design of a building or buildings

name: torpor
trans: n. 不活泼；麻木；懒散，迟缓

sentences.english: He had slumped into a state of torpor from which nothing could rouse him.
sentences.chinese: 他陷入了一种麻木状态，什么事都不能唤起他的兴趣。

sentences.english: The sick person gradually falls into a torpor.
sentences.chinese: 这位病人逐渐陷入了萎靡状态中。

detailed_translations.english: Torpor is the state of being completely inactive mentally or physically, for example, because of illness or laziness

name: hardcore
trans: n. 硬核；硬底层；碎砖垫层

detailed_translations.english: a style of rock music characterized by short fast numbers with minimal melody and aggressive delivery

name: criteria
trans: n. 标准，条件（criterion的复数）

sentences.english: The most important criterion for entry is that applicants must design and make their own work.
sentences.chinese: 参加的最重要标准就是申请人必须设计并制作自己的作品。

detailed_translations.english: A criterion is a factor on which you judge or decide something

name: observation
trans: n. 观察；监视；观察报告

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

name: natural
trans: adj. 自然的；物质的；天生的；不做作的

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

name: bright
trans: n. 车头灯光

sentences.english: Her eyes were hurting from the bright lights.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的光线刺痛了她的眼睛。

sentences.english: bright sunshine
sentences.chinese: 灿烂的阳光

sentences.english: a large bright room
sentences.chinese: 明亮的大房间

sentences.english: He was an exceptionally bright child.
sentences.chinese: 他是个特别聪明的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: shining strongly, or with plenty of light

name: locust
trans: n. [植保] 蝗虫，[昆] 蚱蜢

sentences.english: a swarm of locusts
sentences.chinese: 一大群蝗虫

detailed_translations.english: an insect that lives mainly in Asia and Africa and flies in a very large group, eating and destroying crops

name: personal
trans: n. 人事消息栏；人称代名词

sentences.english: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
sentences.chinese: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。

sentences.english: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
sentences.chinese: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。

sentences.english: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。

sentences.english: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我到她房间时，她所有的私人物品都已不在了。

sentences.english: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
sentences.chinese: 艾伦死后，他母亲接收了他的私人物品。

sentences.english: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的亲身经验，我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。

sentences.english: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
sentences.chinese: 生意成功所需要的个人素质

sentences.english: The car is for personal use only.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。

sentences.english: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
sentences.chinese: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

sentences.english: celebrities with their own personal trainer
sentences.chinese: 拥有私人健身教练的名流

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to one particular person, rather than to other people or to people in general

name: cacophonous
trans: adj. 粗腔横调的；发音不和谐的

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗腔横调的；发音不和谐的

name: knot
trans: n. （绳等的）结；节瘤，疙瘩；海里/小时（航速单位）

sentences.english: A pretty scarf was loosely knotted around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的脖子上松松地系着一条漂亮的围巾。

detailed_translations.english: to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc
a hard round place in a piece of wood where a branch once joined the tree
to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc

name: undoubtedly
trans: adv. 确实地，毋庸置疑的

sentences.english: This is undoubtedly important.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是重要的。

sentences.english: While such ways of traveling certainly have their benefits, there are also undoubtedly some disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这种旅行方式当然有它们的长处所在，但毫无疑问也有一些缺憾。

name: shift
trans: n. 移动；变化；手段；轮班

sentences.english: They need to shift from farming to industry, and they need to do so desperately.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要从农业领域转移到工业领域。 他们需要拼命地那么做。

sentences.english: the shift from one type of economic system to another
sentences.chinese: 从一种经济体系向另一种经济体系的转变

detailed_translations.english: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one
a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

name: characteristic
trans: n. 特征；特性；特色

sentences.english: the highly characteristic (= very typical ) flint walls of the local houses
sentences.chinese: 当地房子非常有特色的燧石墙

sentences.english: Violent images are a defining characteristic of his work.
sentences.chinese: 暴力形象是他作品的一个鲜明特征。

detailed_translations.english: very typical of a particular thing or of someone’s character
a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

name: tension
trans: n. 张力，拉力；紧张，不安；电压

sentences.english: The tension was becoming unbearable, and I wanted to scream.
sentences.chinese: 这种紧张变得难以忍受，我真想大声尖叫。

sentences.english: Muscle tension can be a sign of stress.
sentences.chinese: 肌肉紧张可能是压力大的迹象。

sentences.english: This wire will take 50 pounds tension.
sentences.chinese: 这种金属线能承受50磅的张力。

detailed_translations.english: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax

name: percentage
trans: n. 百分比；百分率，百分数

sentences.english: Interest rates fell by six percentage points (= 6% ) .
sentences.chinese: 利息下降了6个百分点。

sentences.english: The numbers are small in percentage terms (= when calculated as a percentage ) .
sentences.chinese: 按百分比来看，这些数字很小。

detailed_translations.english: an amount expressed as if it is part of a total which is 100

name: intriguingly
trans: Not Found

name: swathe
trans: n. 带子，绷带；包装品

sentences.english: women swathed in expensive furs
sentences.chinese: 身穿名贵皮草的女人

sentences.english: The moon was swathed in mist.
sentences.chinese: 月亮笼罩在薄雾之中。

detailed_translations.english: to wrap or cover something in something

name: veracious
trans: adj. 诚实的；真实的

sentences.english: With the rapid development of network and communication technologies, there comes an urgent and higher requirement on the verification, which should be more veracious, safe and practicable.
sentences.chinese: 随着网络技术与通信技术的飞速发展，现代社会对个人身份识别的准确性、安全性与实用性提出了更高的要求。

detailed_translations.english: habitually truthful or honest

name: anticipate
trans: vt. 预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

name: exploitation
trans: n. 开发，开采；利用；广告推销；剥削

detailed_translations.english: the development and use of minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

name: involvement
trans: n. 牵连；包含；混乱；财政困难

sentences.english: School officials say they welcome parental involvement.
sentences.chinese: 校方说他们欢迎学生父母参与。

name: lethargic
trans: adj. 昏睡的；无生气的

sentences.english: The cat became lethargic and had trouble breathing.
sentences.chinese: 这只猫整天昏睡而且呼吸困难。

sentences.english: The koala seemed to be asleep, and I wondered for the first time just how one went about startling such a lethargic creature.
sentences.chinese: 那只树熊似乎睡着了。 第一次干这活儿，我真不知怎么去惊吓一只昏睡的动物。

sentences.english: The organisers say they are also considering giving a prize to the slowest cell, since lethargic cells would be a boon for cancer therapy.
sentences.chinese: 主办方表示他们也在考虑颁一个奖给速度最慢的细胞，因为这种昏睡细胞也是癌症治疗的福音。

name: after a fashion
trans: na. 勉强；马马虎虎

name: enhance
trans: vt. 提高；加强；增加

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: reverse
trans: n. 背面；相反；倒退；失败

sentences.english: Reverse the paper in the printer.
sentences.chinese: 把打印机中的纸翻过来。

sentences.english: The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.
sentences.chinese: 这种错误的态度会得到恰好相反的结果。

detailed_translations.english: if a vehicle or its driver reverses, they go backwards

detailed_translations.chinese: 反向的； 相反的； 颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: Reverse means opposite from what you expect or to what has just been described

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤销，废除；使完全相反，彻底转变；使反转，使次序颠倒
detailed_translations.english: to change something, such as a decision, judgment, or process so that it is the opposite of what it was before

detailed_translations.chinese: 相反情况，对立面；反面，背面，后面；损失，倒退
detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: nicotine
trans: n. [有化] 尼古丁；[有化] 烟碱

sentences.english: Nicotine produces a feeling of well-being in the smoker.
sentences.chinese: 尼古丁能让吸烟者产生一种愉悦的感觉。

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化] 尼古丁；[有化] 烟碱
detailed_translations.english: a substance in tobacco which makes it difficult for people to stop smoking

name: cross-cultural
trans: adj. 跨文化的；交叉文化的

name: variation
trans: n. 变化；[生物] 变异，变种

sentences.english: Most of his poems are variations on the theme of love.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部分诗作都是有关爱情主题的形式不同的作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变化；[生物] 变异，变种
detailed_translations.english: a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of something

name: passer-by
trans: n. 过路人；经过的人

sentences.english: A passerby described what he saw moments after the car bomb had exploded.
sentences.chinese: 一个过路人描述了汽车炸弹爆炸后瞬间他所看到的情景。

detailed_translations.english: A passerby is a person who is walking past someone or something

name: flow diagram
trans: Not Found

name: contaminate
trans: vt. 污染，弄脏

sentences.english: Drinking water supplies are believed to have been contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 据信饮用水已受到污染。

detailed_translations.english: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

name: customer
trans: n. 顾客；家伙

sentences.english: We aim to offer good value and service to all our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求为所有的客户提供物有所值的商品和服务。

sentences.english: We’ve had several letters from satisfied customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了几封顾客表示满意的来信。

sentences.english: He’s one of our regular customers .
sentences.chinese: 他是我们的一个老主顾。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys goods or services from a shop, company etc

name: purpose
trans: n. 目的；用途；意志

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: hostile
trans: n. 敌对

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

name: abeyance
trans: n. 中止，停顿；归属待定，暂搁

sentences.english: The question is in abeyance until we know more about it.
sentences.chinese: 问题暂时搁置，直到我们了解更多有关情况''。

sentences.english: The abbot was taken aback and could not abide her abeyance .
sentences.chinese: 男修道院院长很吃惊并且不能忍受她的中止。

detailed_translations.english: something such as a custom, rule, or system that is in abeyance is not being used at the present time

name: rescind
trans: vi. 解除；废除；撤回

sentences.english: The governor does not have the authority to rescind the ruling.
sentences.chinese: 该州长无权撤销这项裁决。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, or change a decision or agreement

name: onset
trans: n. 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻

sentences.english: the onset of winter
sentences.chinese: 冬天的来临

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始，着手；发作；攻击，进攻
detailed_translations.english: the beginning of something, especially something bad

name: notice
trans: n. 通知，布告；注意；公告

sentences.english: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
sentences.chinese: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。

sentences.english: I didn’t notice any smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我没注意到有烟。

sentences.english: Have you noticed any change in him?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

sentences.english: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.chinese: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.english: Firefighters were prepared to rush out at a moment’s notice.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

detailed_translations.english: if you notice something or someone, you realize that they exist, especially because you can see, hear, or feel them
when you notice or pay attention to someone or something

name: considerate
trans: adj. 体贴的；体谅的；考虑周到的

sentences.english: He was always kind and considerate.
sentences.chinese: 他总是很善良，为别人着想。

detailed_translations.english: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

name: package
trans: n. 包，包裹；套装软件，[计] 程序包

sentences.english: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

detailed_translations.english: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent

name: physics
trans: n. 物理学；物理现象

sentences.english: ...the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

detailed_translations.english: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

name: gather
trans: n. 聚集；衣褶；收获量

sentences.english: You two know each other, I gather.
sentences.chinese: 我想你们俩认识。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard

name: range
trans: n. 范围；幅度；排；山脉

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: eventually
trans: adv. 最后，终于

sentences.english: He eventually escaped and made his way back to England.
sentences.chinese: 他终于逃脱并返回英格兰。

sentences.english: Eventually, she got a job and moved to London.
sentences.chinese: 最终，她找到了工作并移居伦敦。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time, or after a lot of things have happened

name: taxonomist
trans: n. 分类学者

name: autonomous
trans: adj. 自治的；自主的；自发的

sentences.english: They proudly declared themselves part of a new autonomous province.
sentences.chinese: 他们自豪地宣布自己是新自治省的一部分。

detailed_translations.english: an autonomous place or organization is free to govern or control itself

name: undergo
trans: vt. 经历，经受；忍受

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: undercooked
trans: adj. 煎（或烤、炸） 得火候不足的；煮得欠熟的

name: expert
trans: n. 专家；行家；能手

sentences.english: ...a yoga expert.
sentences.chinese: …一位瑜伽专家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special skill or special knowledge of a subject, gained as a result of training or experience

name: pollution
trans: n. 污染

sentences.english: California’s tough anti-pollution laws
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州严厉的反污染法

detailed_translations.english: the process of making air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use, or the state of being dangerously dirty

name: sensor
trans: n. 传感器

sentences.english: The latest Japanese vacuum cleaners contain sensors that detect the amount of dust and type of floor.
sentences.chinese: 日本最新款吸尘器装有传感器，能测出灰尘量和地板类型。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used for discovering the presence of light, heat, movement etc

name: squirt
trans: n. 喷射；注射

sentences.english: Some kids squirted a water pistol in her face.
sentences.chinese: 有几个小孩用水枪朝她脸上喷水。

sentences.english: It just needs a little squirt of oil.
sentences.chinese: 它只需喷点油。

detailed_translations.english: if you squirt liquid or if it squirts somewhere, it is forced out in a thin fast stream

detailed_translations.chinese: 喷射； 〈口， 贬〉无名小辈
detailed_translations.english: Squirt is also a noun

name: capture
trans: n. 捕获；战利品，俘虏

sentences.english: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已经成功抓获叛乱分子的头目。

sentences.english: 40 captured French soldiers
sentences.chinese: 40名被俘虏的法国士兵

detailed_translations.english: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

name: soporific
trans: n. 催眠剂；安眠药

sentences.english: In Lavengro (or is it Romany Rye?) there is an impossible character, a victim of insomnia, who finds that a volume of Wordsworth's poems is the only sure soporific; but that was Borrow s malice.
sentences.chinese: 在《拉文格罗》（或者是《吉卜赛男人》）一书中有一个无可救药的人，患有失眠症，他发现华尔华斯的一卷诗集是惟一有效的催眠剂，但那只不过是伯罗的恶作剧而已。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel ready to sleep

name: extent
trans: n. 程度；范围；长度

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

name: harness
trans: n. 马具；甲胄；挽具状带子；降落伞背带；日常工作

sentences.english: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以利用风力发电。

detailed_translations.english: to control and use the natural force or power of something

name: viper
trans: n. 毒蛇；毒如蛇蝎的人，阴险的人

name: karat
trans: n. 开（黄金成色单位）；克拉（宝石的重量单位，等于carat）

detailed_translations.chinese: 开（黄金成色单位）；克拉（宝石的重量单位，等于carat）
detailed_translations.english: an American spelling of carat

name: cooperate
trans: vi. 合作，配合；协力

sentences.english: They agreed to co-operate with Brazil on a programme to protect the rain forests.
sentences.chinese: 他们同意和巴西合作进行一个保护热带雨林的项目。

sentences.english: I advised my client to cooperate fully with the police.
sentences.chinese: 我建议我的当事人要全力与警方配合。

detailed_translations.english: to work with someone else to achieve something that you both want

name: investment
trans: n. 投资；投入；封锁

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

name: stable
trans: n. 马厩；牛棚

sentences.english: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
sentences.chinese: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

sentences.english: Children like a stable environment.
sentences.chinese: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

detailed_translations.chinese: 稳定的，不变的；沉稳的，持重的
detailed_translations.english: steady and not likely to move or change
a building where horses are kept

name: simulate
trans: adj. 模仿的；假装的

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

name: predator
trans: n. [动] 捕食者；[动] 食肉动物；掠夺者

sentences.english: With no natural predators on the island, the herd increased rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 由于岛上没有天然食肉动物，牧群的数量迅速增加。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that kills and eats other animals

name: facility
trans: n. 设施；设备；容易；灵巧

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: ready
trans: n. 现款；预备好的状态

sentences.english: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
sentences.chinese: 快点，你还没准备好吗？

sentences.english: When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting .
sentences.chinese: 门铃响的时候，他已经准备好在等着了。

sentences.english: Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
sentences.chinese: 你外出怎么要准备那么长时间？

sentences.english: He's always ready to help his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐意帮助朋友。

detailed_translations.english: fully prepared for what you are going to do

name: ache
trans: n. 疼痛

sentences.english: His feet were aching from standing so long.
sentences.chinese: 他站了那么久，双脚隐隐作痛。

detailed_translations.english: if part of your body aches, you feel a continuous, but not very sharp pain there
a continuous pain that is not sharp or very strong

name: prolong
trans: vt. 延长；拖延

sentences.english: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

name: mandatory
trans: adj. 强制的；托管的；命令的

sentences.english: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.english: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
sentences.chinese: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

detailed_translations.english: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done

name: dozen
trans: n. 十二个，一打

sentences.english: a dozen eggs
sentences.chinese: 一打鸡蛋

sentences.english: Chris, Helen, and half a dozen others went on holiday together.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯、海伦和其他六个人一起去度假了。

sentences.english: (= about 12 ) cars were parked near the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 入口附近停了大约十二辆汽车。

detailed_translations.english: twelve

name: multilingual
trans: adj. 使用多种语言的

name: delineate
trans: vt. 描绘；描写；画…的轮廓

sentences.english: Biography must to some extent delineate characters.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，传记一定要描述人物。

detailed_translations.english: If you delineate something such as an idea or situation, you describe it or define it, often in a lot of detail

name: virtually
trans: adv. 事实上，几乎；实质上

sentences.english: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。

sentences.english: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
sentences.chinese: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: swap
trans: n. 交换；交换之物

sentences.english: a fair swap
sentences.chinese: 公平交换

sentences.english: We can do a swap if you like.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意我们可以交换。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you give something to someone and get another thing in return
to give something to someone and get something in return

name: appliance
trans: n. 器具；器械；装置

sentences.english: The device most often used to do this is a load balancer, which is an appliance that accepts requests from the outside world and hands them off to the next available application server.
sentences.chinese: 进行这一操作最常用的设备是一个负载均衡器，这是一个从外部接收请求并将它们移交给下一个可用应用程序服务器的装置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment, especially electrical equipment, such as a  cooker  or  washing machine  , used in people’s homes

name: electronics
trans: n. 电子学；电子工业

sentences.english: an electronics engineer
sentences.chinese: 电子工程师

detailed_translations.english: the study or industry of making equipment, such as computers and televisions, that work electronically

name: brandish
trans: n. 挥舞

sentences.english: A man leapt out, brandishing a kitchen knife.
sentences.chinese: 一个男人挥着一把菜刀跳了出来。

detailed_translations.english: to wave something around in a dangerous or threatening way, especially a weapon

name: optimize
trans: vt. 使最优化，使完善

sentences.english: They need to optimize the use of available resources.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要充分利用手上的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the way that something is done or used so that it is as effective as possible

name: imply
trans: vt. 意味；暗示；隐含

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

name: author
trans: n. 作者；作家；创始人

sentences.english: Nothomb is a Belgian author.
sentences.chinese: 诺东是位比利时作家。

sentences.english: It’s clear that the author is a woman.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这位作者是女性。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has written a book

name: noticeable
trans: adj. 显而易见的，显著的；值得注意的

sentences.english: Alcohol has a noticeable effect on the body.
sentences.chinese: 酒精对身体有明显的影响。

sentences.english: It was noticeable that many of them avoided answering the question.
sentences.chinese: 显而易见，他们中的许多人对这个问题都避而不答。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: nontoxic
trans: adj. 无毒的

name: presence
trans: n. 存在；出席；参加；风度；仪态

sentences.english: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is present in a particular place

name: trust
trans: n. 信任，信赖；责任；托拉斯

sentences.english: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
sentences.chinese: 起初，他们之间缺乏信任。

sentences.english: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust
sentences.chinese: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

sentences.english: You betrayed your father’s trust (= did something bad even though he trusted you ).
sentences.chinese: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

sentences.english: I just don’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 我就是不信任他。

sentences.english: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

detailed_translations.english: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

name: image
trans: n. 影像；想象；肖像；偶像

sentences.english: attempts to improve the image of the police
sentences.chinese: 提升警察形象的努力

sentences.english: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
sentences.chinese: 他脑海中对父母的印象极其清晰。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public

name: invaluable
trans: adj. 无价的；非常贵重的

sentences.english: The internet is an invaluable source of information.
sentences.chinese: 因特网是十分有价值的信息来源。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非常宝贵的， 极为贵重的， 无价的
detailed_translations.english: extremely useful

name: alacrity
trans: n. 敏捷；轻快；乐意

sentences.english: She accepted with alacrity.
sentences.chinese: 她欣然接受了。

detailed_translations.english: quickness and eagerness

name: Dinosaur
trans: Not Found

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: train
trans: n. 火车；行列；长队；裙裾

sentences.english: We went all the way to Inverness by train.
sentences.chinese: 我们一路坐火车到因弗内斯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of several carriages that are connected to each other and pulled along a railway line by an engine
to teach someone the skills of a particular job or activity, or to be taught these skills

name: mental
trans: adj. 精神的；脑力的；疯的

sentences.english: The centre provides help for people suffering from mental illness .
sentences.chinese: 该中心对精神病患者提供帮助。

sentences.english: Stress has an effect on both your physical and mental health .
sentences.chinese: 压力对身体健康和心理健康都有影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 心理的， 精神的， 思想上的； 精神病的； 智力的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the health or state of someone’s mind

name: reptile
trans: n. 爬行动物；卑鄙的人

sentences.english: Bird evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg--laid by a reptile.
sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.english: No matter how dry your skin gets, you will never turn into an alligator or any other type of reptile.
sentences.chinese: 不论皮肤多么干燥，你永远不会变成美洲鳄或任何其他一种皮肤粗糙的爬行动物。

sentences.english: This small reptile, which measures just 10 centimeters long, can swim through the sand dunes at up to 15 centimeters per second.
sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

name: permanent
trans: n. 烫发（等于permanent wave）

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: obsequious
trans: adj. 谄媚的；奉承的；顺从的

sentences.english: an obsequious smile
sentences.chinese: 谄媚的微笑

detailed_translations.english: very eager to please or agree with people who are powerful – used in order to show disapproval

name: technically
trans: adv. 技术上；专门地；学术上；工艺上

sentences.english: Agriculture is becoming more and more technically advanced .
sentences.chinese: 农业在技术上越来越先进。

detailed_translations.english: concerning the way machines are used to do work

name: faculty
trans: n. 科，系；能力；全体教员

sentences.english: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

detailed_translations.english: all the teachers in a university

name: sparingly
trans: adv. 节俭地；保守地；爱惜地

sentences.english: Use the spices sparingly .
sentences.chinese: 这种香料只要用一点点。

name: unsettle
trans: vt. 使动摇；使不安定；使心神不宁

sentences.english: The sudden changes unsettled Judy.
sentences.chinese: 突如其来的变化弄得朱迪心神不宁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使动摇；使不安定；使心神不宁
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel slightly nervous, worried, or upset

name: classical
trans: n. 古典音乐

sentences.english: the classical theory of relativity
sentences.chinese: 经典相对论

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a traditional style or set of ideas

name: forest
trans: n. 森林

sentences.english: a tropical forest
sentences.chinese: 热带森林

sentences.english: the danger of forest fires
sentences.chinese: 发生森林火灾的危险

detailed_translations.english: a large area of land that is covered with trees

name: ignite
trans: vt. 点燃；使燃烧；使激动

sentences.english: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹引起了一场火灾，烧毁了大约六十间房屋。

detailed_translations.english: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes
to start burning, or to make something start burning

name: paradoxical
trans: adj. 矛盾的；诡论的；似非而是的

sentences.english: Some sedatives produce the paradoxical effect of making the person more anxious.
sentences.chinese: 一些镇静剂产生出使人更紧张这样自相矛盾的结果。

detailed_translations.chinese: 矛盾的；诡论的；似非而是的
detailed_translations.english: If something is paradoxical, it involves two facts or qualities that seem to contradict each other

name: potent
trans: adj. 有效的；强有力的，有权势的；有说服力的

sentences.english: potent drugs
sentences.chinese: 强效药物

sentences.english: a potent symbol of oppression
sentences.chinese: 压迫的有力象征

sentences.english: Advertising is a potent force in showing smoking as a socially acceptable habit.
sentences.chinese: 广告的力量很大，把吸烟说成为社会所接受的习惯。

sentences.english: A good company pension scheme remains a potent weapon for attracting staff.
sentences.chinese: 良好的公司养老金计划依然是吸引员工的有效武器。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有效的；强有力的，有权势的；有说服力的
detailed_translations.english: having a very powerful effect or influence on your body or mind

name: funerary
trans: adj. 埋葬的；葬礼的

name: forbid
trans: vt. 禁止；不准；不允许；〈正式〉严禁

sentences.english: He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
sentences.chinese: 作为惩罚，他被禁止离开家。

sentences.english: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
sentences.chinese: 由于篇幅限制，无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

name: version
trans: n. 版本；译文；倒转术

sentences.english: Is the coffee break the adult version of recess?
sentences.chinese: 工间喝咖啡是成人的休息方式吗？

detailed_translations.english: a way of explaining or doing something that is typical of a particular group or period of time

name: extra
trans: n. 临时演员；号外；额外的事物；上等产品

sentences.english: Could you get an extra loaf of bread?
sentences.chinese: 你能多拿一条面包吗？

sentences.english: Allow extra time for your journey.
sentences.chinese: 要给你的旅程多留出点时间。

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to take extra care.
sentences.chinese: 建议司机开车要格外小心。

sentences.english: You’re going to have to work extra hard to pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 你要格外用功才能通过考试。

detailed_translations.english: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number
used to emphasize an adjective or adverb

name: science
trans: n. 科学；技术；学科；理科

sentences.english: Many leading scientists do not consider that science can give absolutely reliable knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 许多杰出科学家都不认为科学能够提供绝对可靠的知识。

sentences.english: the founder of modern science, Isaac Newton
sentences.chinese: 现代科学创始人艾萨克·牛顿

sentences.english: developments in science and technology
sentences.chinese: 科学技术的发展

detailed_translations.english: knowledge about the world, especially based on examining, testing, and proving facts

name: warn
trans: vt. 警告，提醒；通知

sentences.english: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
sentences.chinese: “小心，岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it

name: sketch
trans: n. 素描；略图；梗概

sentences.english: So if we just sketch that.
sentences.chinese: 那么如果我们把那画个草图。

sentences.english: He squiggled a sketch on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在地上胡乱地画了个草图。

detailed_translations.english: a simple, quickly made drawing that does not show much detail
a short humorous scene on a television programme, in a theatre etc, that is part of a larger show

name: favourite
trans: n. 特别喜爱的人（或物）

sentences.english: a child’s favourite toy
sentences.chinese: 孩子最喜欢的玩具

sentences.english: What’s your favourite colour?
sentences.chinese: 你最喜欢什么颜色？

sentences.english: a favorite spot for picnickers
sentences.chinese: 野餐者最喜欢的地方

detailed_translations.english: your favourite person or thing is the one that you like the most
something that you like more than other things of the same kind

name: clue
trans: n. 线索；（故事等的）情节

sentences.english: Police have found a vital clue .
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了至关重要的线索。

sentences.english: Archaeological evidence will provide clues about what the building was used for.
sentences.chinese: 考古证据将为这幢建筑的用途提供线索。

sentences.english: a desperate search for clues
sentences.chinese: 拼命寻找线索

detailed_translations.english: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

name: squash
trans: n. 壁球；挤压；咯吱声；南瓜属植物；（英）果汁饮料

sentences.english: Her suggestions were always squashed.
sentences.chinese: 她的建 议总是受到压制。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power or authority to stop something

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁球；挤压；咯吱声；南瓜属植物；（英）果汁饮料
detailed_translations.english: a game played by two people who use  rackets  to hit a small rubber ball against the walls of a square court

name: literally
trans: adv. 照字面地；逐字地；不夸张地；正确地；简直

sentences.english: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

detailed_translations.english: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

name: folk tale
trans: n. 民间故事；民间传说

name: advise
trans: vt. 建议；劝告，忠告；通知；警告

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

name: simultaneously
trans: adv. 同时地

sentences.english: If they have multiple test cases that will be run on the same platforms, they can select multiple configurations simultaneously and apply the configurations to several of them in batch mode.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们拥有多个将要运行在同一个平台上的测试用例的话，那么他们能够同时选择多个配置，并且将这些配置批量应用到平台上。

name: project
trans: n. 工程；计划；事业

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

name: unchanged
trans: adj. 未改变的

name: volatile
trans: n. 挥发物；有翅的动物

sentences.english: an increasingly volatile political situation
sentences.chinese: 日益动荡的政治局势

sentences.english: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
sentences.chinese: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning

name: diploma
trans: n. 毕业证书，学位证书；公文，文书；奖状

sentences.english: a High School diploma
sentences.chinese: 高中毕业文凭

detailed_translations.english: a document showing that a student has successfully completed their high school or university education

name: ambitious
trans: adj. 野心勃勃的；有雄心的；热望的；炫耀的

sentences.english: Alfred was intensely ambitious, obsessed with the idea of becoming rich.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德雄心勃勃，一心想着发财。

detailed_translations.english: determined to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: overseas
trans: adv. 在海外，海外

sentences.english: Chris is going to work overseas.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯要去国外工作。

sentences.english: Most applications came from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 大部分申请来自海外。

detailed_translations.english: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: inequality
trans: n. 不平等；不同；不平均

sentences.english: People are concerned about corruption and social inequality.
sentences.chinese: 人们对腐败和社会不公感到担忧。

detailed_translations.english: an unfair situation, in which some groups in society have more money, opportunities, power etc than others

name: legitimate
trans: adj. 合法的；正当的；合理的；正统的

sentences.english: So all of this is a legitimate source of concern.
sentences.chinese: 因此，这些情况都是引发忧虑的合理根源。

sentences.english: Even though I had legitimate reasons ( bullshit ). You know I have to make them dividends ( bullshit ).
sentences.chinese: 即使我有合法的理由（胡说）。你知道我必须支付利息（胡说）。

sentences.english: Often, as in this case, there is no intentional hoaxing: It is a legitimate, straightforward photograph of something curious.
sentences.chinese: 就像此事一样，它们通常都是无意的闹剧：这是某些稀奇的东西合法的、易懂的照片。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当的， 合理的； 合法的
detailed_translations.english: fair or reasonable

name: agriculture
trans: n. 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学

sentences.english: More than 75% of the land is used for agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of farming

name: seemingly
trans: adv. 看来似乎；表面上看来

sentences.english: seemingly unrelated bits of information
sentences.chinese: 似乎互不相关的零星信息

detailed_translations.english: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

name: hind
trans: n. 雌鹿

sentences.english: Suddenly the cow kicked up its hind legs.
sentences.chinese: 突然奶牛踢起了后腿。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the back part of an animal with four legs
a female  deer

name: royalty
trans: n. 皇室；版税；王权；专利税

sentences.english: At school the other children treated them like royalty .
sentences.chinese: 在学校里，其他孩子将他们奉若王族。

detailed_translations.english: members of a royal family

name: discourse
trans: n. 论述；谈话；演讲

sentences.english: "I do not know. " And thus ended their discourse.
sentences.chinese: “我也不晓得。”就这样，他们的谈话结束了。 。

sentences.english: They listened to his discourse on human relations.
sentences.chinese: 他们听他作关于人际关系的演讲。

sentences.english: In discourse thou must attend to what is said, and in every movement thou must observe what is doing.
sentences.chinese: 在谈话中你必须注意所说的话，在任何活动中你都必须观察在做什么。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演讲， 谈话， 论文
detailed_translations.english: a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject

name: fitness
trans: n. 健康；适当；适合性

sentences.english: He questioned McNeil’s fitness for high office.
sentences.chinese: 他质疑麦克尼尔是否适合身居高位。

sentences.english: Running marathons requires a high level of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑马拉松需要身体十分强健。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which someone or something is suitable or good enough for a particular situation or purpose

name: concession
trans: n. 让步；特许（权）；承认；退位

sentences.english: The British were not prepared to make any concessions .
sentences.chinese: 英国人没有打算作出让步。

sentences.english: the import/export concessions that had been granted to the island
sentences.chinese: 同意给该岛的进出口特许权

detailed_translations.english: something that you allow someone to have in order to end an argument or a disagreement

name: display
trans: n. 显示；炫耀

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: realize
trans: vt. 实现；认识到；了解；将某物卖得，把(证券等)变成现钱；变卖

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句:她一直未能实现赢取奥运会金牌的抱负。

detailed_translations.english: to know and understand something, or suddenly begin to understand it

name: straightforward
trans: adj. 简单的；坦率的；明确的；径直的

sentences.english: In this example, we will use the most straightforward method of all -- writing our object reference to a file that will be picked up by our client.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，我们将使用所有方法中最直截了当的一种 — 将对象引用写入一个文件，该 文件将由客户机选取。

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: welfare
trans: n. 福利；幸福；福利事业；安宁

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

name: mention
trans: vt. 提到，谈到；提及，论及；说起

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

name: tightly
trans: adv. 紧紧地；坚固地

sentences.english: Her eyes were tightly closed.
sentences.chinese: 她的双眼紧闭着。

sentences.english: a tightly packed crowd of tourists
sentences.chinese: 挤得严严实实的旅游人群

detailed_translations.english: closely and firmly; in a tight manner

name: charm
trans: n. 魅力，吸引力；魔力

sentences.english: Joe’s boyish charm
sentences.chinese: 乔身上的稚趣

sentences.english: She turned on the charm (= used her charm ) to all the men.
sentences.chinese: 她对所有那些男人都施展魅力。

sentences.english: The room had no windows and all the charm of a prison cell (= used to say that something has no charm ) .
sentences.chinese: 这房间没有窗，简直就是牢房。

detailed_translations.english: a special quality someone or something has that makes people like them, feel attracted to them, or be easily influenced by them – used to show approval

name: accentuate
trans: vt. 强调；重读

sentences.english: The photograph seemed to accentuate his large nose.
sentences.chinese: 照片似乎突出了他的大鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more noticeable

name: barrier
trans: n. 障碍物，屏障；界线

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。
