to attach a label onto something or write information on something

name: flow
trans: n. 流动；流量；涨潮，泛滥

sentences.english: a new road system to improve traffic flow through the city centre
sentences.chinese: 疏导市中心车流的新道路系统

sentences.english: These gates regulate the amount of water flowing into the canal.
sentences.chinese: 这些闸门调节流入运河的水量。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth steady movement of liquid, gas, or electricity
when a liquid, gas, or electricity flows, it moves in a steady continuous stream

name: debate
trans: n. 辩论；辩论会

sentences.english: the gun-control debate in the US
sentences.chinese: 美国有关控制枪支的争论

sentences.english: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

sentences.english: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
sentences.chinese: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。

sentences.english: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
sentences.chinese: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

sentences.english: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

detailed_translations.english: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution

name: exception
trans: n. 例外；异议

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: detail
trans: n. 细节，详情

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something
to list things or give all the facts or information about something

name: trigger
trans: n. 扳机；[电子] 触发器；制滑机

sentences.english: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.english: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.chinese: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

name: life expectancy
trans: n. 预期寿命；预计存在（或持续）的期限

sentences.english: And we recognize the progress we have made together: gains in literacy and life expectancy… the spread of knowledge and technology...
sentences.chinese: 我们肯定我们共同取得的进展：文盲减少了，预期寿命增加了…… 知识和技术得到了传播……

sentences.english: Over the past 25 years, life expectancy after 50 has risen in the United States, but at a slower rate than in countries like Japan and Australia, said the National Academy of Sciences report.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的25年中，美国人超过50岁的平均寿命有所增加，但是与日本、澳大利亚这样的国家相比其增长速度还是很低，美国国家科学院报道说。

sentences.english: Even Libya and Iran do well in this long-term assessment despite very low or even negative growth because they saw very rapid advances in life expectancy and school enrollments.
sentences.chinese: 甚至，增长率很低甚至是负增长的利比亚和伊朗在长期评估上都很不错。 这是因为他们在预期寿命以及入学率方面有了长足进展。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that a person or animal is expected to live

name: trend
trans: n. 趋势，倾向；走向

sentences.english: The current trend is towards more part-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。

sentences.english: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
sentences.chinese: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势

sentences.english: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
sentences.chinese: 一个令人担心的趋势是，暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。

sentences.english: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。

sentences.english: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，基本趋势仍是乐观的。

sentences.english: national and international economic trends
sentences.chinese: 国内和国际的经济趋势

sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。

detailed_translations.english: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

name: beleaguer
trans: vt. 围攻；围

sentences.english: Curiger sees “a lot of commonalities between the Venetian master's quest and the eagerness of some contemporary artists to defy the conventions which beleaguer art in our time.”
sentences.chinese: Curiger 看到“在威尼斯大师的探求和当代艺术家热心反抗习俗中的许多共性，在我们这个时代，艺术被围攻，这些当代艺术家们敢公然反抗习俗。”

name: circulation
trans: n. 流通，传播；循环；发行量

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

name: mediation
trans: n. 调解；仲裁；调停

sentences.english: Even if a marriage is doomed, the trend in family law is to resolve the dispute out of court, typically through mediation.
sentences.chinese: 即使是一桩婚姻注定要遭受失败，在家庭法中也将是趋向于在法庭外解决争执，典型的是通过调解。

sentences.english: Only solve those existing problems, the people's mediation can play better efficiency and cost advantages, and prevent and dissolve the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 解决好这几方面存在的问题才能更好发挥人民调解的效率与成本优势及预防、化解纠纷的能力。

sentences.english: It has been wisely negotiating with Syria via Turkey, and engaging Hamas on a truce deal through the mediation of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 它明智地透过土耳其与叙利亚谈判，并通过埃及的仲裁与哈马斯达成停战协议。

name: maximization
trans: Not Found

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: assume
trans: vt. 僭取；篡夺；夺取；擅用；侵占

sentences.english: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

name: fossil
trans: n. 化石；僵化的事物；顽固不化的人

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

name: fling
trans: n. 掷，抛；嘲弄；急冲

sentences.english: He flung the box into the river.
sentences.chinese: 他把盒子扔进河里。

sentences.english: People cheered and flung their hats into the air.
sentences.chinese: 民众欢呼着把帽子抛向空中。

detailed_translations.english: to throw something somewhere using a lot of force

name: voluntary
trans: n. 志愿者；自愿行动

sentences.english: Workers are being encouraged to take voluntary redundancy.
sentences.chinese: 工人被鼓励主动离职。

detailed_translations.english: done willingly and without being forced

name: transient
trans: n. 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: furnish
trans: vt. 提供；供应；装备

sentences.english: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

sentences.english: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
sentences.chinese: 买下房子后，他们没有钱买家具了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装备，布置 （房间、建筑物）；供应，提供
detailed_translations.english: to put furniture and other things into a house or room

name: oversee
trans: vt. 监督；审查；俯瞰；偷看到，无意中看到

sentences.english: A team leader was appointed to oversee the project.
sentences.chinese: 任命了一位组长来监管该工程。

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a group of workers and check that a piece of work is done satisfactorily

name: apparent
trans: adj. 显然的；表面上的

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: mathematical
trans: adj. 数学的，数学上的；精确的

sentences.english: mathematical analysis
sentences.chinese: 数学分析

sentences.english: the development of mathematical skills
sentences.chinese: 数学技能的发展

sentences.english: a mathematical genius
sentences.chinese: 数学天才

detailed_translations.english: relating to or using mathematics

name: membership
trans: n. 资格；成员资格；会员身份

sentences.english: You should carry your membership card with you at all times.
sentences.chinese: 你应该随身携带会员卡。

sentences.english: Membership fees are being increased this year.
sentences.chinese: 会费今年提高了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 会员身份， 会籍； 全体会员， 会员数
detailed_translations.english: when someone is a member of a club, group, or organization

name: invasion
trans: n. 入侵，侵略；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.english: the invasion of Normandy
sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

name: aberrant
trans: adj. 异常的；畸变的；脱离常轨的；迷乱的

sentences.english: aberrant behaviour
sentences.chinese: 异常行为

detailed_translations.chinese: 异常的；畸变的；脱离常轨的；迷乱的
detailed_translations.english: not usual or normal

name: hitchhike
trans: n. 搭便车（旅行）

sentences.english: Neff hitchhiked to New York during his Christmas holiday.
sentences.chinese: 内夫在圣诞节休假期间搭免费便车去了纽约。

name: theatre
trans: n. 电影院，戏院；戏剧；阶梯式讲堂

sentences.english: an open-air theatre (= a theatre that is outside )
sentences.chinese: 露天剧场

sentences.english: the Mercury Theater
sentences.chinese: 水星剧院

detailed_translations.english: a building or place with a stage where plays and shows are performed

name: centigrade
trans: adj. 摄氏的；[仪] 摄氏温度的；百分度的

sentences.english: ...daytime temperatures of up to forty degrees centigrade.
sentences.chinese: …高达40摄氏度的日间气温。

sentences.english: The number at the bottom is the recommended water temperature in centigrade.
sentences.chinese: 底部的数字为建议性摄氏度水温。

detailed_translations.english: Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.
Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.

name: prodigal
trans: n. 浪子；挥霍者

sentences.english: a prodigal lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

detailed_translations.english: spending money, wasting time etc in a careless way
someone who spends money carelessly and wastes their time – used humorously

name: outperform
trans: vt. 胜过；做得比……好

sentences.english: Stocks generally outperform other investments.
sentences.chinese: 股票总体上要优于其他投资。

detailed_translations.english: to be more successful than someone or something else

name: pale
trans: n. 前哨；栅栏；范围

sentences.english: He looked very pale and drawn.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去非常苍白憔悴。

sentences.english: pale blue curtains
sentences.chinese: 淡蓝色的窗帘

detailed_translations.chinese: 苍白的,灰白的；浅的,暗淡的
detailed_translations.english: having a skin colour that is very white, or whiter than it usually is

name: resort
trans: n. 凭借，手段；度假胜地；常去之地

sentences.english: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他那累人的工作日程已经使他不得不求助于毒品了。

sentences.english: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
sentences.chinese: 国会有责任确保在所有和平的手段用尽之后再诉诸武力。

detailed_translations.english: when you must use or depend on something because nothing better is available
The action of resorting to a course of action in a difficult situation

name: confound
trans: vt. 使混淆；挫败；讨厌；使混乱

sentences.english: His amazing recovery confounded the medical specialists.
sentences.chinese: 他的神奇康复使医学专家感到惊讶。

name: graze
trans: n. 放牧；轻擦

sentences.english: fields where they used to graze their sheep
sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

detailed_translations.english: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing
to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something
a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

name: abusive
trans: adj. 辱骂的；滥用的；虐待的

sentences.english: Smith denies using abusive language to the referee.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯否认辱骂裁判。

sentences.english: He became abusive and his wife was injured in the struggle.
sentences.chinese: 他动了粗，妻子在扭打中受伤。

detailed_translations.english: using cruel words or physical violence

name: negate
trans: vt. 否定；取消；使无效

sentences.english: Efforts to expand the tourist industry could be negated by reports that the sea is highly polluted.
sentences.chinese: 有关海洋受到严重污染的报道可能会使拓展旅游业的努力完全白费。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from having any effect

name: justification
trans: n. 理由；辩护；认为有理，认为正当；释罪

sentences.english: Hoggart felt, with some justification, that his colleagues had let him down.
sentences.chinese: 霍加特觉得同事令他失望，这是有理由的。

detailed_translations.english: a good and acceptable reason for doing something

name: abolish
trans: vt. 废除，废止；取消，革除

sentences.english: Slavery was abolished in the US in the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 美国于19世纪废除了奴隶制。

detailed_translations.english: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

name: insulate
trans: vt. 隔离，使孤立；使绝缘，使隔热

sentences.english: an insulated attic
sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.english: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

name: cassette
trans: n. 盒式磁带；暗盒；珠宝箱；片匣

sentences.english: His two albums released on cassette have sold 10 million copies.
sentences.chinese: 他以磁带形式发行的两张专辑已售出1000万份。

detailed_translations.english: a small flat plastic case containing  magnetic tape  , that can be used for playing or recording sound

name: emphasize
trans: vt. 强调，着重

sentences.english: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。

sentences.english: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 罗根发表演讲，强调需要更多的志愿者。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a strong way

name: difference
trans: n. 差异；不同；争执

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

name: excellence
trans: n. 优秀；美德；长处

sentences.english: ...the top award for excellence in journalism and the arts.
sentences.chinese: …新闻与艺术界的最高杰出奖。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way

name: electrical
trans: adj. 有关电的；电气科学的

sentences.english: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
sentences.chinese: 大火是电力故障引起的。

sentences.english: an electrical engineer
sentences.chinese: 电力[电气]工程师

detailed_translations.english: relating to electricity

name: receptionist
trans: n. 接待员；传达员

sentences.english: You tell the receptionist that you are expecting a call from this client and to put them through.
sentences.chinese: 你告诉传达员你正在等待一个来自这个客户的电话，并允许将他们接进来。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to welcome and deal with people arriving in a hotel or office building, visiting a doctor etc

name: desultory
trans: adj. 断断续续的；散漫的；不连贯的，无条理的

sentences.english: They talked briefly in a desultory manner.
sentences.chinese: 他们随意地谈了一小会儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断断续续的；散漫的；不连贯的，无条理的
detailed_translations.english: done without any particular plan or purpose

name: illusive
trans: adj. 错觉的；幻影的；迷惑人的

sentences.english: He was fond of calling his detractor illiterate, denouncing his scientific theories as illegitimate and illusive.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢把他的恶意批评者称作文盲，公然抨击他的科学理论是非法的，迷惑人的。

name: corruption
trans: n. 贪污，腐败；堕落

sentences.english: officials charged with bribery and corruption
sentences.chinese: 被指控受贿和贪污的官员

sentences.english: The investigation uncovered widespread corruption within the police force.
sentences.chinese: 这项调查揭发出了警察机关内部普遍的腐败。

detailed_translations.english: dishonest, illegal, or immoral behaviour, especially from someone with power

name: optimistic
trans: adj. 乐观的；乐观主义的

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

name: vessel
trans: n. 船，舰；[组织] 脉管，血管；容器，器皿

sentences.english: a fishing vessel
sentences.chinese: 渔船

sentences.english: a burst blood vessel
sentences.chinese: 破裂的血管

sentences.english: a Bronze Age drinking vessel
sentences.chinese: 青铜器时代的饮具

detailed_translations.english: a ship or large boat

name: individualism
trans: n. 个人主义；利己主义；个人特征

sentences.english: Capitalism encourages competition and individualism.
sentences.chinese: 资本主义鼓励竞争，提倡个人主义。

detailed_translations.chinese: 个人主义；利己主义；个人特征
detailed_translations.english: the belief that the rights and freedom of individual people are the most important rights in a society

name: row
trans: n. 行，排；划船；街道；吵闹

sentences.english: a family row
sentences.chinese: 家庭争吵

sentences.english: He had just had a row with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他刚刚和妻子吵了一架。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry argument, especially between people who know each other well

name: registration
trans: n. 登记；注册；挂号

sentences.english: Student registration (= for a course of study ) starts the first week in September.
sentences.chinese: 学生注册在9月份的第一个星期开始。

sentences.english: The registration fee is $75.
sentences.chinese: 注册费是75美元。

detailed_translations.english: the act of recording names and details on an official list

name: attainment
trans: n. 达到；成就；学识

sentences.english: a low level of educational attainment
sentences.chinese: 教育程度低

detailed_translations.english: success in achieving something or reaching a particular level

name: oceanologist
trans: Not Found

name: perceptive
trans: adj. 感知的，知觉的；有知觉力的

sentences.english: He was one of the most perceptive U.S. political commentators.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是美国最具洞察力的政治评论员之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感知的，知觉的；有知觉力的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their remarks or thoughts as perceptive, you think that they are good at noticing or realizing things, especially things that are not obvious

name: deterrent
trans: n. 威慑；妨碍物；挽留的事物

sentences.english: Their missiles are viewed as a defensive and deterrent force.
sentences.chinese: 他们的导弹被视为一种防卫和威慑力量。

sentences.english: However, this is a new age and those attacks will be stopped by a small nukeand therefore, it is not a deterrent anymore.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如今是新的时代，这样的攻击只要一枚核弹就完了，因此，这种战术已经不再是威慑。

sentences.english: Scientists do not know why this is the case but believe it could be an evolutionary throwback to less sophisticated times when crying acted as a deterrent to amorous males at times of turmoil.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们目前尚不明确为什么会这样，但是他们认为这可能是一种进化返祖现象，因为在蛮荒时代，哭泣在骚乱时是对发情男性的一种威慑。

name: charity
trans: n. 慈善；施舍；慈善团体；宽容；施舍物

sentences.english: Several charities sent aid to the flood victims.
sentences.chinese: 有几家慈善机构已向洪灾灾民送去了救援物资。

detailed_translations.english: an organization that gives money, goods, or help to people who are poor, sick etc

name: transition
trans: n. 过渡；转变；[分子生物] 转换；变调

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: deference
trans: n. 顺从；尊重

sentences.english: "Manners used to be enforced through fear and deference to the Maker, the monarch, and the men, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 他继续说：“礼仪规范过去通过对上帝，君主和男子的畏惧和顺从得以实现。

sentences.english: The second virtue they develop is deference, the willingness to listen and learn from the moral and intellectual storehouses of the people you are trying to elp.
sentences.chinese: 他们发展的第二个美德是顺从敬意，乐意听从其他他们试图帮助的品行端正和智慧的人，并从他们知识宝库中学习。

sentences.english: In practice, each public school is an independent kingdom that pays nominal deference to education authorities.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，每一所公办学校都是一个独立的王国，名义上顺从教育当局。

detailed_translations.english: polite behaviour that shows that you respect someone and are therefore willing to accept their opinions or judgment

name: chess
trans: n. 国际象棋，西洋棋

sentences.english: They meet fairly often to play chess .
sentences.chinese: 他们经常在一起下国际象棋。

detailed_translations.english: a game for two players, who move their playing pieces according to particular rules across a special board to try to trap their opponent’s king

name: vacillate
trans: vi. 犹豫；踌躇；摇摆

sentences.english: She vacillates between men twice her age and men younger than she.
sentences.chinese: 她在两个男人之间摇摆不定，一个年龄比她大一倍，一个比她小。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to change your opinions, decisions, ideas etc

name: enlarge
trans: vt. 扩大；使增大；扩展

sentences.english: There are plans to enlarge the recreation area.
sentences.chinese: 已经有了扩大娱乐场地的计划。

sentences.english: Police will have the pictures enlarged in an attempt to identify the thief.
sentences.chinese: 为了确认窃贼的身份，警方会将这些照片放大。

detailed_translations.english: to make sth bigger; to become bigger

name: appal
trans: vt. 使惊骇；惊吓

sentences.english: The way we kill animals appals a lot of people.
sentences.chinese: 我们屠杀动物的方式令许多人震惊。

sentences.english: The decision to execute the two men has appalled many politicians.
sentences.chinese: 处死那两名男子的判决令许多从政者震惊。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very shocked and upset

name: chamber
trans: n. （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所

sentences.english: a combustion chamber
sentences.chinese: 燃烧室

sentences.english: The heart has four chambers.
sentences.chinese: 心脏有四个腔。

detailed_translations.chinese: （身体或器官内的）室，膛；房间；会所
detailed_translations.english: an enclosed space, especially in your body or inside a machine

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关在室内；装填（弹药等）

name: violin
trans: n. 小提琴；小提琴手

sentences.english: He plays the violin in an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他在管弦乐队中演奏小提琴。

sentences.english: She is first violin of an orchestra .
sentences.chinese: 她是管弦乐队的第一小提琴手。

sentences.english: All this from playing the violin and the cello.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些都来自于小提琴和大提琴的演奏。

detailed_translations.english: a small wooden musical instrument that you hold under your chin and play by pulling a bow(= special stick ) across the strings

name: buttress
trans: n. 扶壁；拱壁；支撑物

sentences.english: ...the neo-Gothic buttresses of Riverside Church in Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: …曼哈顿的里弗赛德教堂中的新哥特式扶璧。

detailed_translations.english: a brick or stone structure built to support a wall
to support a system, idea, argument etc, especially by providing money

name: elective
trans: adj. 选修的；选举的；选任的

sentences.english: the 34 elective seats in the National Assembly
sentences.chinese: 国民议会中的34个选举席位

detailed_translations.english: an elective position or organization is one for which there is an election
a course that students can choose to take, but they do not have to take it in order to graduate

name: toxic
trans: adj. 有毒的；中毒的

sentences.english: fumes from a toxic waste dump
sentences.chinese: 有毒废料堆产生的毒气

sentences.english: a highly toxic pesticide
sentences.chinese: 毒性很强的杀虫剂

detailed_translations.english: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

name: attendance
trans: n. 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤

sentences.english: We have an average attendance of 4,000 fans per game.
sentences.chinese: 每场比赛平均有4,000名球迷来观战。

sentences.english: Last year’s fair saw attendance figures of 32,000.
sentences.chinese: 去年的交易会有3.2万人参加。

detailed_translations.chinese: 出席；到场；出席人数；考勤
detailed_translations.english: the number of people who attend a game, concert, meeting etc

name: recluse
trans: n. 隐士；隐居者

sentences.english: Stained glass windows, ceramic chimney and floral motifs adorn the house and make it an awe inspiring space for recluse.
sentences.chinese: 彩色玻璃窗户，陶瓷灯罩和花纹图案装饰的房子，让它对隐士来说成为一个令人敬畏的空间。

sentences.english: Nancy: Well, suit yourself. I don't recommend turning down too many invitations or you'll get a reputation for being a recluse.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，随你吧。我不建议你拒绝太多邀请，不然你会被别人当成一个隐居者（孤僻的人）

sentences.english: Terror of the lecher hope of the mad recluse: the sky! Black cover of the great cauldron in which boils vast imperceptible humanity.
sentences.chinese: 纵欲者的恐惧，疯隐士的希望：天空！那口大锅的黑色盖子锅中沸煮着无数渺小的人类。

detailed_translations.english: someone who chooses to live alone, and does not like seeing or talking to other people

name: suffer
trans: vi. 遭受，忍受；受痛苦；经验；受损害

sentences.english: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
sentences.chinese: 至少他死得突然，没有遭罪。

sentences.english: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
sentences.chinese: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: to experience physical or mental pain

name: deficit
trans: n. 赤字；不足额

sentences.english: the country’s widening budget deficit
sentences.chinese: 这个国家日益严重的预算赤字

sentences.english: the US’s foreign trade deficit
sentences.chinese: 美国的对外贸易逆差

detailed_translations.english: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need

name: specialist
trans: n. 专家；专门医师

sentences.english: a heart specialist
sentences.chinese: 心脏专科医生

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

name: crash
trans: n. 撞碎；坠毁；破产；轰隆声；睡觉

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

name: urbanization
trans: n. 都市化；文雅化

sentences.english: Much of this, she says, is due to increased urbanization.
sentences.chinese: 而这些，主要是由于不断增加的都市化造成的。

sentences.english: These diseases are now everywhere, driven as they are by universal forces, like urbanization and the globalization of unhealthy lifestyles.
sentences.chinese: 现在，在城市化和不健康生活方式的全球化等普遍因素的影响下，这些疾病无处不在。

sentences.english: Countries and regions all over the world face the challenge of urbanization.
sentences.chinese: 全球各地的国家和地区都面临城市化的挑战。

detailed_translations.english: Urbanization is the process of creating cities or towns in country areas

name: unadorned
trans: adj. 朴素的；未装饰的

sentences.english: They liked their churches to be unadorned.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望他们的教堂朴素无华。

detailed_translations.english: without unnecessary or special features or decorations

name: rupture
trans: n. 破裂；决裂；疝气

sentences.english: The pipe will rupture at its weakest point.
sentences.chinese: 管道最薄弱的地方会破裂的。

sentences.english: His liver was ruptured when a brick wall collapsed on him.
sentences.chinese: 一堵砖墙坍塌压住了他，导致他的肝脏破裂。

detailed_translations.english: to break or burst, or to make something break or burst
an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts

name: cater
trans: vt. 投合，迎合；满足需要；提供饮食及服务

sentences.english: We cater to an exclusive clientele.
sentences.chinese: 我们满足一个特殊客户群的需求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投合，迎合；满足需要；提供饮食及服务
detailed_translations.english: to provide and serve food and drinks at a party, meeting etc, usually as a business

name: imperious
trans: adj. 专横的；迫切的；傲慢的

sentences.english: She raised her hand in an imperious gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她傲慢地扬起手。

detailed_translations.english: giving orders and expecting to be obeyed, in a way that seems too proud

name: trio
trans: n. 三重唱；三件一套；三个一组

name: extension
trans: n. 延长；延期；扩大；伸展；电话分机

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: avoid
trans: vt. 避免；避开，躲避；消除

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: democratic
trans: adj. 民主的；民主政治的；大众的

sentences.english: a democratic government
sentences.chinese: 民主政府

sentences.english: the role of the media in the democratic process
sentences.chinese: 民主进程中媒体的作用

detailed_translations.english: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country

name: implicity
trans: Not Found

name: prediction
trans: n. 预报；预言

sentences.english: The data can be used to make useful economic predictions .
sentences.chinese: 这些数据可用于进行有用的经济预测。

detailed_translations.english: a statement about what you think is going to happen, or the act of making this statement

name: dissipate
trans: vi. 驱散；放荡

sentences.english: As he thought it over, his anger gradually dissipated.
sentences.chinese: 他想明白后，怒气就渐渐消了。

sentences.english: Little by little, the smoke was dissipated by the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 在微风的吹拂下烟雾渐渐地消散了。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 使消散， 使消失， 驱散； 浪费， 挥霍
detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

name: disappear
trans: vi. 消失；失踪；不复存在

sentences.english: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether (= disappear completely ) .
sentences.chinese: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

sentences.english: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school..
sentences.chinese: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。

detailed_translations.english: to become impossible to see any longer

name: inconsequential
trans: adj. 不重要的；不合理的；不合逻辑的

sentences.english: inconsequential but amusing chatter
sentences.chinese: 无谓但有趣的闲扯

detailed_translations.chinese: 不重要的；不合理的；不合逻辑的
detailed_translations.english: not important

name: stitch
trans: n. 针脚，线迹；一针

sentences.english: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
sentences.chinese: 他头上不得不缝了十针。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth

name: infrared
trans: n. 红外线

sentences.english: Both the model and the satellite sensor use infrared energy to measure clouds.
sentences.chinese: 模型和卫星传感器都使用红外能量来进行云的估算。

sentences.english: "This is an exciting result, " says Tinetti. "This is the first near-infrared spectrum of a planet.
sentences.chinese: 迪奈蒂说：“这是个令人兴奋的结果，这是行星上发现的第一个近红外光谱。

sentences.english: His discovery of the electromagnetic spectrum led to the development of television, radio, microwaves, as well as aiding in the development of radio and infrared telescopes.
sentences.chinese: 他发现的电磁特性最终导致电视、广播、微波炉的发明，并且也对无线电和红外望远镜的发明起到了重要作用。

detailed_translations.english: Infrared radiation is similar to light but has a longer wavelength, so we cannot see it without special equipment

name: syllabus
trans: n. 教学大纲，摘要；课程表

sentences.english: The course syllabus consisted mainly of novels by African-American authors, male and female.
sentences.chinese: 该课程的教学大纲主要包括了非裔美国男女作家的小说。

detailed_translations.english: a plan that states exactly what students at a school or college should learn in a particular subject

name: daunt
trans: vt. 使气馁，使畏缩；威吓

sentences.english: He felt utterly daunted by the prospect of moving to another country.
sentences.chinese: 他一想到要移居别的国家就感到十分害怕。

sentences.english: Don’t be daunted by all the technology.
sentences.chinese: 不要被所有这些技术给吓住。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel afraid or less confident about something

name: acceptance
trans: n. 接纳；赞同；容忍

sentences.english: He wrote a letter of acceptance (=  a letter in which you agree to accept a job, university place etc  ) to the university.
sentences.chinese: 他给那所大学写了一封接受函。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接受， 承认； 容忍
detailed_translations.english: when you officially agree to take something that you have been offered

name: react
trans: vi. 反应；影响；反抗；起反作用

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

name: mechanical
trans: adj. 机械的；力学的；呆板的；无意识的；手工操作的

sentences.english: The flight has been cancelled due to mechanical failure.
sentences.chinese: 因机械故障航班被取消了。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing because of mechanical problems.
sentences.chinese: 飞机因机械故障不得不紧急降落。

sentences.english: the mechanical properties of solids
sentences.chinese: 固体的力学性能

detailed_translations.english: affecting or involving a machine

name: comparatively
trans: adv. 比较地；相当地

sentences.english: a comparatively small number of people
sentences.chinese: 相对较少的人数

sentences.english: Comparatively few books have been written on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 有关这方面的书相对较少。

sentences.english: Crime on the island is comparatively rare .
sentences.chinese: 这个岛上犯罪活动相对较少。

sentences.english: Comparatively speaking, this part of the coast is still unspoiled.
sentences.chinese: 相对而言，这一段海岸尚未遭到破坏。

detailed_translations.english: as compared to something else or to a previous state

name: burgeon
trans: vt. 萌芽, 发芽

sentences.english: When spring is coming all trees begin to burgeon .
sentences.chinese: 当春天到来的时候，所有树开始发芽。

sentences.english: The brain-drain effect of studying abroad has started to burgeon due to flaws in the domestic academic environment.
sentences.chinese: 由于国内学术环境恶劣，出国留学造成人才外流的现象已经初显萌芽。

sentences.english: The seed of friendship and cooperation we sow today will burgeon and harvest in the future and China-US partnership of cooperation will definitely enjoy a better tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天播下的友好合作种子一定能够生根发芽、开花结果，中美合作伙伴关系一定能够迎来更加美好的明天。

name: sequence
trans: n. [数][计] 序列；顺序；续发事件

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

name: breakthrough
trans: n. 突破；突破性进展

sentences.english: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.
sentences.chinese: 该公司看上去稳将在中国实现一次重大突破。

detailed_translations.english: an important new discovery in something you are studying, especially one made after trying for a long time

name: connect
trans: vt. 连接；联合；关连

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: determine
trans: v. （使）下决心，（使）做出决定

sentences.english: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

detailed_translations.english: to find out the facts about something

name: grandiloquent
trans: adj. 夸张的；夸大的；大言不惭的

detailed_translations.chinese: 夸张的；夸大的；大言不惭的

name: subtract
trans: vt. 减去；扣掉

sentences.english: Then the deal is that when you sell the house they subtract -you've got to pay this.
sentences.chinese: 那么当你售出房子后，他们会从中减去，这个余额，这就是你要付给他们的。

sentences.english: That is, if you find that a sensor consistently overestimates by a certain value, you can subtract that value before the final value is reported.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，如果您发现某个传感器总是偏高于某个特定数值，那么就可以减去该数值后再报告最终的数值。

sentences.english: Thus, if you have staff activities in loops and want to run the above request, you need to ensure that you subtract only events which belong together.
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果您在循环中具有人员活动，并且想要运行以上的请求，那么您必须确保您只减去了属于一起的事件。

detailed_translations.english: to take a number or an amount from a larger number or amount

name: remove
trans: n. 移动；距离；搬家

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

name: tennis
trans: n. 网球（运动）

sentences.english: She excels all of us at tennis.
sentences.chinese: 她的网球比我们打得都好。

sentences.english: I like his smile and his tennis!
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢他的微笑和他的网球！

sentences.english: If she decides to go with her sister instead, then I can play tennis with you.
sentences.chinese: 要是她决定和她姐姐一起出去，那我就能和你去打网球。

detailed_translations.english: a game for two people or two pairs of people who use  rackets  to hit a small soft ball backwards and forwards over a net

name: proscribe
trans: vt. 剥夺……的公权；禁止

sentences.english: The Act proscribes discrimination on the grounds of race.
sentences.chinese: 这项法令禁止种族歧视。

detailed_translations.english: to officially say that something is not allowed to exist or be done

name: chef
trans: n. 厨师，大师傅

sentences.english: a master chef
sentences.chinese: 手艺高超的厨师长

sentences.english: a pastry chef
sentences.chinese: 糕饼师傅

detailed_translations.english: a skilled cook, especially the main cook in a hotel or restaurant

name: versatile
trans: adj. 多才多艺的；通用的，万能的；多面手的

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

name: reconsider
trans: vt. 重新考虑；重新审议

sentences.english: He should reconsider his decision to resign.
sentences.chinese: 他应该重新考虑辞职的决定。

sentences.english: We want you to come. Please reconsider.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望你来，请你重新考虑一下。

detailed_translations.english: to think again about something in order to decide if you should change your opinion or do something different

name: organism
trans: n. 有机体；生物体；微生物

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: inundate
trans: vt. 淹没；泛滥；浸水；（洪水般的）扑来

sentences.english: The tidal wave inundated vast areas of cropland.
sentences.chinese: 海啸淹没了大片农田。

detailed_translations.english: to cover an area with a large amount of water

name: participant
trans: n. 参与者；关系者

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

name: virtual
trans: adj. [计] 虚拟的；实质上的，事实上的（但未在名义上或正式获承认）

sentences.english: The website allows you to take a virtual tour of the art gallery.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站可让你对美术馆作一番虚拟参观。

sentences.english: constructing virtual worlds
sentences.chinese: 构筑虚拟世界

detailed_translations.english: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

name: transaction
trans: n. 交易；事务；办理；会报，学报

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: explosion
trans: n. 爆炸；爆发；激增

sentences.english: We heard a loud explosion.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

sentences.english: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately causing sth to explode

name: English
trans: n. 英语；英国人；英文；英格兰人

sentences.english: Do you speak English?
sentences.chinese: 你会说英语吗？

sentences.english: leaflets written in plain English
sentences.chinese: 用简单英语写的传单

sentences.english: the English countryside
sentences.chinese: 英格兰乡村

detailed_translations.english: the language used in Britain, the US, Australia, and some other countries
relating to England or its people

name: geography
trans: n. 地理；地形

sentences.english: a geography lesson
sentences.chinese: 地理课

detailed_translations.english: the study of the countries, oceans, rivers, mountains, cities etc of the world

name: spice
trans: n. 香料；情趣；调味品；少许

sentences.english: herbs and spices
sentences.chinese: 香草和香料

detailed_translations.english: a type of powder or seed, taken from plants, that you put into food you are cooking to give it a special taste
to add interest or excitement to something

name: meat
trans: n. 肉，肉类（食用）

sentences.english: I gave up eating meat a few months ago.
sentences.chinese: 我几个月以前开始不吃肉了。

sentences.english: raw meat
sentences.chinese: 生肉

sentences.english: a meat pie
sentences.chinese: 肉馅饼

sentences.english: a selection of cold meats
sentences.chinese: 各种冷盘肉

detailed_translations.english: the flesh of animals and birds eaten as food

name: hum
trans: n. 嗡嗡声；哼声；杂声

sentences.english: He began to hum a tune.
sentences.chinese: 他开始哼唱一支曲子。

detailed_translations.english: to sing a tune by making a continuous sound with your lips closed
a low continuous sound

name: aspire
trans: vi. 渴望；立志；追求

sentences.english: ...people who aspire to public office.
sentences.chinese: …志在获得公职的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to desire and work towards achieving something important

name: palette
trans: n. 调色板；颜料

sentences.english: The painter's right hand holds the brush, the left the palette.
sentences.chinese: 那位画家的右手握着画笔，左手拿着调色盘。

detailed_translations.english: a thin curved board that an artist uses to mix paints, holding it by putting his or her thumb through a hole at the edge

name: promise
trans: n. 许诺，允诺；希望

sentences.english: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: flotilla
trans: n. 小型船队；小舰队

name: favorable
trans: adj. 有利的；良好的；赞成的，赞许的；讨人喜欢的

sentences.english: favourable film reviews
sentences.chinese: 正面的影评

sentences.english: The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
sentences.chinese: 回应是一边倒的肯定。

detailed_translations.english: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them

name: table
trans: n. 桌子；表格；平地层

sentences.english: The food was served on long tables.
sentences.chinese: 食物放在长餐桌上供应。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture with a flat top supported by legs
to leave a bill etc to be discussed or dealt with in the future

name: trivialize
trans: vt. 使平凡；使琐碎

sentences.english: The article trivializes the whole issue of equal rights.
sentences.chinese: 文章对平等权利这个大问题轻描淡写。

sentences.english: The debate has been trivialized by the media.
sentences.chinese: 那场辩论在媒体的报道中变得无关紧要。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem less important or serious than it really is – used to show disapproval

name: failure
trans: n. 失败；故障；失败者；破产

sentences.english: Successful people often aren’t very good at dealing with failure.
sentences.chinese: 一帆风顺的人往往不太擅长应对失败。

sentences.english: I always felt a bit of a failure at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时总觉得自己有点失败。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of success in achieving or doing something

name: formulate
trans: vt. 规划；用公式表示；明确地表达

sentences.english: By visualizing where you want to be, you start helping your mind formulate ways to achieve that next goal in your life.
sentences.chinese: 通过把你想达到的程度形象化，你就开始帮助自己的头脑制定目标——为了达到你生活中的下一个目标。

sentences.english: With so much content floating around these days, if you want your writing to be read then you've got to take up an interesting topic, thoughtfully formulate your thoughts, and back up your argument.
sentences.chinese: 每天面对这么多漂浮在你身边的信息和内容，如果您希望您的文字被别人阅读，那么你可要找一个有趣的话题，花店功夫制定您的想法，并支持你的论点。

detailed_translations.english: to develop something such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done

name: embellish
trans: vt. 修饰；装饰；润色

sentences.english: The boat was embellished with carvings in red and blue.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船饰有红、蓝雕刻。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more beautiful by adding decorations to it

name: discordant
trans: adj. 不和谐的，刺耳的；不一致的

name: secret
trans: n. 秘密；秘诀；机密

sentences.english: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你，这是个秘密。

sentences.english: It was no secret that the two men hated each other.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人相互仇视，这算不得什么秘密。

sentences.english: Don’t worry. Your secret is safe with me (= I won’t tell anyone about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 别担心，我会替你保守秘密。

sentences.english: Your hair always looks so great – what’s your secret ?
sentences.chinese: 你的头发看起来总是很漂亮——你的秘诀是什么？

sentences.english: They kept their relationship secret from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩的关系瞒着父母。

detailed_translations.english: something that is kept hidden or that is known about by only a few people
known about by only a few people and kept hidden from others

name: insomniac
trans: n. 失眠症患者

sentences.english: I wish you knew me before I was an insomniac because I used to be a really nice person.
sentences.chinese: 我希望在我成为失眠症者之前你就认识我，因为我曾经是个地地道道的好人。

sentences.english: If both of you are insomniac, sitting by yourselves in a lounge, that is the hour when secret concerns and hopes are shared, out of the staff's earshot.
sentences.chinese: 如果你们两人都是失眠患者，你们独自坐在大厅里，那就是你们分享秘密的焦虑和希望的时刻，远离工作人员的耳目。

detailed_translations.english: someone who cannot sleep easily

name: skull
trans: n. 头盖骨，脑壳

sentences.english: Her husband was later treated for a fractured skull.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫后来因颅骨碎裂而接受治疗。

detailed_translations.english: the bones of a person’s or animal’s head

name: signaling light
trans: 号灯

name: identical
trans: n. 完全相同的事物

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: dependent
trans: n. 依赖他人者；受赡养者

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: garage
trans: n. 车库；汽车修理厂；飞机库

sentences.english: I’ll just go and put the car in the garage.
sentences.chinese: 我把车停到车库去。

sentences.english: an automatic garage door
sentences.chinese: 车库自动门

detailed_translations.english: a building for keeping a car in, usually next to or attached to a house

name: suburb
trans: n. 郊区；边缘

sentences.english: a London suburb
sentences.chinese: 一个伦敦郊区

sentences.english: a kid from the suburbs
sentences.chinese: 来自郊区的小孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 郊区， 郊外， 近郊
detailed_translations.english: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city

name: discount
trans: n. 折扣；贴现率

sentences.english: They are often available at a discount.
sentences.chinese: 它们经常可以以折扣价买到。

sentences.english: This has forced airlines to discount fares heavily in order to spur demand.
sentences.chinese: 这已经迫使多家航空公司对机票大幅打折以刺激需求。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the usual price of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…打折扣； 不信； 漠视， 低估
detailed_translations.english: If a shop or company discounts an amount or percentage from something that they are selling, they take the amount or percentage off the usual price

name: divorce
trans: n. 离婚；分离

sentences.english: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.chinese: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.english: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
detailed_translations.english: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage

name: consensus
trans: n. 一致；舆论；合意

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts

name: assurance
trans: n. 保证，担保；（人寿）保险；确信；断言；厚脸皮，无耻

sentences.english: Despite my repeated assurances, Rob still looked very nervous.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我再三保证，罗布看起来还是很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a promise that something will definitely happen or is definitely true, made especially to make someone less worried

name: component
trans: n. 成分；组件；[电子] 元件

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

name: exculpate
trans: vt. 开脱；使无罪

sentences.english: These causes, however, never served to exculpate "ordinary Germans" who shared in the guilt either for participating in or not resisting Nazi rule in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 但这些原因，都不足以证明所谓“德国平民”是无罪的，因为他们有些也参与了这场罪行，至少并没有反抗纳粹在德国的统治。

detailed_translations.chinese: 开脱； 申明无罪， 证明无罪
detailed_translations.english: to prove that someone is not guilty of something

name: ridiculous
trans: adj. 可笑的；荒谬的

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: shed
trans: n. 小屋，棚；分水岭

sentences.english: The company is planning to shed about a quarter of its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正计划裁减约四分之一的人员。

sentences.english: The magazine is desperately trying to shed its old-fashioned image.
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志急于摆脱其过时的形象。

sentences.english: a diet to help you shed pounds
sentences.chinese: 帮助你减肥的食谱

detailed_translations.chinese: 脱落，脱去；流出，流下；发出，散发
detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something that you no longer need or want
a small building, often made of wood, used especially for storing things

name: western
trans: n. 西方人；西部片，西部小说

sentences.english: the western end of the bay
sentences.chinese: 海湾的西端

sentences.english: Western Australia
sentences.chinese: 西澳大利亚

detailed_translations.chinese: 西方的，西部的；有西方特征的
detailed_translations.english: in or from the west of a country or area

detailed_translations.chinese: 西方人；西部片，西部小说
detailed_translations.english: a film about life in the 19th century in the American West, especially the lives of cowboys

name: paragraph
trans: n. 段落；短评；段落符号

sentences.english: the opening paragraphs of the novel
sentences.chinese: 小说开篇的几个段落

detailed_translations.english: part of a piece of writing which starts on a new line and contains at least one sentence

name: serve
trans: n. 发球，轮到发球

sentences.english: There was only one girl serving customers .
sentences.chinese: 只有一个女孩在接待顾客。

detailed_translations.chinese: 招待，供应；为…服务；对…有用；可作…用
detailed_translations.english: to help the customers in a shop, especially by bringing them the things that they want
the action in a game such as tennis or  volleyball  when you throw the ball in the air and hit it over the net

name: protection
trans: n. 保护；防卫；护照

sentences.english: the protection of the environment
sentences.chinese: 环境保护

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something is protected

name: repudiate
trans: vt. 拒绝；否定；批判；与…断绝关系；拒付

sentences.english: He repudiated all offers of friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝任何人给他的友谊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝；否定；批判；与…断绝关系；拒付
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept or continue with something

name: casual
trans: n. 便装；临时工人；待命士兵

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

name: quantitative
trans: adj. 定量的；量的，数量的

sentences.english: We need to do a proper quantitative analysis of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要对这个问题作一个正确的定量分析。

detailed_translations.english: relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of something

name: unsightly
trans: adj. 难看的；不雅观的

sentences.english: unsightly buildings
sentences.chinese: 难看的楼房

sentences.english: unsightly marks
sentences.chinese: 难看的污渍

detailed_translations.english: ugly or unpleasant to look at

name: irritate
trans: vt. 刺激，使兴奋；激怒

sentences.english: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

name: pungent
trans: adj. 辛辣的；刺激性的；刺鼻的；苦痛的；尖刻的

sentences.english: He expressed some fairly pungent criticisms.
sentences.chinese: 他提出了一针见血的批评。

detailed_translations.chinese: 辛辣的；刺激性的；刺鼻的；苦痛的；尖刻的
detailed_translations.english: having a strong taste or smell

name: ticket
trans: vt. 加标签于；指派；对…开出交通违规罚单

sentences.english: Slow down or you'll get a ticket.
sentences.chinese: 开慢点儿，否则你会接到一张罚款通知单。

sentences.english: parking/speeding ticket
sentences.chinese: 违法停车/超速行驶罚款单

detailed_translations.english: a printed note ordering you to pay money because you have done something illegal while driving or parking your car

name: tolerant
trans: adj. 宽容的；容忍的；有耐药力的

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: van
trans: n. 先锋；厢式货车；增值网

sentences.english: a delivery van
sentences.chinese: 运货车

sentences.english: a van driver
sentences.chinese: 小型货车司机

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle used especially for carrying goods, which is smaller than a truck and has a roof and usually no windows at the sides

name: partial
trans: adj. 局部的；偏爱的；不公平的

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: paucity
trans: n. 缺乏；少数；少量

sentences.english: Even the film's impressive finale can't hide the first hour's paucity of imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影在开头一个小时中毫无想象力，即使有个让人印象深刻的结局也无法掩盖这个缺憾。

detailed_translations.english: less than is needed of something

name: embrace
trans: n. 拥抱

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: coagulate
trans: vt. 使…凝结

sentences.english: The blood had not coagulated.
sentences.chinese: 血未凝结。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid coagulates, or something coagulates it, it becomes thick and almost solid

name: liability
trans: n. 责任；债务；倾向；可能性；不利因素

sentences.english: Tenants have legal liability for any damage they cause.
sentences.chinese: 承租人造成任何损坏都要负法律责任。

sentences.english: The company had assets of $138 million and liabilities of $120.5 million.
sentences.chinese: 该公司有1.38亿美元资产和1.205亿美元的负债。

detailed_translations.english: legal responsibility for something, especially for paying money that is owed, or for damage or injury

name: literature
trans: n. 文学；文献；文艺；著作

sentences.english: He has read many of the major works of literature.
sentences.chinese: 他读过许多重要的文学作品。

sentences.english: Italian literature
sentences.chinese: 意大利文学

sentences.english: literature on the history of science
sentences.chinese: 科学史的文献资料

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学，文学作品；文献；文献
detailed_translations.english: books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good

name: terse
trans: adj. 简洁的，精练的，扼要的

sentences.english: Derek’s terse reply ended the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 德里克的简短回答结束了谈话。

name: earnestly
trans: adv. 认真地；诚挚地

name: oscillate
trans: vt. 使振荡；使振动；使动摇

sentences.english: On an oscilloscope, you can see an electrical current oscillate up and down.
sentences.chinese: 在示波器上面你可以看到一股电流上下振动。

sentences.english: To oscillate about a selected value. Used of a machine, an instrument, or a system.
sentences.chinese: 在一特定值的附近摇摆：在某一选定值周围振荡。用于机器，仪器或系统。

sentences.english: Through the mechanism called locally excitatory globally inhibitory existing among the visual cortical neurons neurons can oscillate in terms of visual information.
sentences.chinese: 视觉皮层神经元之间存在的局部兴奋全局抑制机制能够使神经元根据接受到的视觉信息产生相应的振荡活动。

detailed_translations.english: if an electric current oscillates, it changes direction very regularly and very frequently

name: manipulate
trans: vt. 操纵；操作；巧妙地处理；篡改

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: elegy
trans: n. 挽歌，哀歌

sentences.english: ...a touching elegy for a lost friend.
sentences.chinese: ...致亡友的一首动人挽歌。

detailed_translations.english: a sad poem or song, especially about someone who has died

name: persistent
trans: adj. 固执的，坚持的；持久稳固的

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

name: convention
trans: n. 大会；[法] 惯例；[计] 约定；[法] 协定；习俗

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: attire
trans: n. 服装；盛装

sentences.english: business attire
sentences.chinese: 商务着装，正装

detailed_translations.english: clothes

name: plausible
trans: adj. 貌似可信的，花言巧语的；貌似真实的，貌似有理的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

name: explanation
trans: n. 说明，解释；辩解

sentences.english: She told the court she would give a full explanation of the prosecution's decision on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉法庭她将在星期一就控方的决定做出详尽的解释。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, fact, or situation that tells you why sth happened; a reason given for sth

name: accent
trans: n. 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

name: keen
trans: adj. 敏锐的，敏捷的；渴望的；强烈的；热心的；锐利的

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

name: organize
trans: vt. 组织；使有系统化；给予生机；组织成立工会等

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

name: paragon
trans: n. 模范；完美之物；优秀之人

sentences.english: We don't expect candidates to be paragons of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 我们不指望候选人都是道德完人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 模范；完美之物；优秀之人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is perfect or is extremely brave, good etc – often used humorously

name: radical
trans: n. 基础；激进分子；[物化] 原子团；[数] 根数

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

name: perfunctory
trans: adj. 敷衍的；马虎的；得过且过的

sentences.english: She gave him a perfunctory smile.
sentences.chinese: 她对他漫不经心地笑了笑。

sentences.english: The applause was perfunctory.
sentences.chinese: 掌声听上去是在敷衍了事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 敷衍的；马虎的；得过且过的
detailed_translations.english: a perfunctory action is done quickly, and is only done because people expect it

name: despair
trans: n. 绝望；令人绝望的人或事

sentences.english: To the despair of the workers, the company announced the closure of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 令工人们感到绝望的是，公司宣布关闭工厂了。

sentences.english: Despite his illness, Ron never despaired.
sentences.chinese: 尽管疾病缠身，罗恩却从不绝望。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you have no hope at all
to feel that there is no hope at all

name: waste
trans: n. 浪费；废物；荒地；损耗；地面风化物

sentences.english: excessive waste in state spending
sentences.chinese: 政府支出方面的过度浪费

detailed_translations.chinese: 浪费；废物；荒地；损耗；地面风化物
detailed_translations.english: when something such as money or skills are not used in a way that is effective, useful, or sensible
to use more money, time, energy etc than is useful or sensible
waste materials, substances etc are unwanted because the good part of them has been removed

name: rustic
trans: adj. 乡村的；纯朴的；粗野的；手工粗糙的

sentences.english: The village had a certain rustic charm .
sentences.chinese: 这个村庄有一种迷人的田园风情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乡村的；纯朴的；粗野的；手工粗糙的
detailed_translations.english: simple, old-fashioned, and not spoiled by modern developments, in a way that is typical of the countryside
someone from the country, especially a farm worker

name: indistinguishable
trans: adj. 不能区别的，不能辨别的；不易察觉的

sentences.english: Replica weapons are indistinguishable from the real thing.
sentences.chinese: 仿真武器与真武器难以辨别。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能区别的，不能辨别的；不易察觉的
detailed_translations.english: If one thing is indistinguishable from another, the two things are so similar that it is difficult to know which is which

name: solar
trans: n. 日光浴室

sentences.english: a solar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 日食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sun

name: goddess
trans: n. 女神，受崇拜的女性

sentences.english: Aphrodite, goddess of love
sentences.chinese: 爱神阿佛洛狄忒

detailed_translations.english: a female being who is believed to control the world or part of it, or represents a particular quality

name: ostentatious
trans: adj. 招摇的；卖弄的；夸耀的；铺张的；惹人注目的

sentences.english: She carried her car keys on an ostentatious gold key ring.
sentences.chinese: 她把汽车钥匙挂在一个夸张的金钥匙圈上。

sentences.english: an ostentatious display of wealth
sentences.chinese: 张扬地炫耀财富

detailed_translations.chinese: 招摇的；卖弄的；夸耀的；铺张的；惹人注目的
detailed_translations.english: something that is ostentatious looks very expensive and is designed to make people think that its owner must be very rich

name: mudguard
trans: Not Found

name: sceptic
trans: n. 怀疑论者；疑虑极深的人

name: travel
trans: n. 旅行；游历；漫游

sentences.english: Light travels faster than sound.
sentences.chinese: 光比声音传播得快。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旅行； 行进； 被传送， 被传播； 走过， 驶过
detailed_translations.english: to move at a particular speed or in a particular direction
the activity of travelling

name: thick
trans: n. 最拥挤部分；活动最多部分；事物的粗大浓密部分

sentences.english: a thick oak door
sentences.chinese: 一扇厚实的橡木门

sentences.english: a thick slice of homemade bread
sentences.chinese: 一片厚厚的自制面包

sentences.english: He was wearing thick glasses.
sentences.chinese: 他戴着厚厚的眼镜。

sentences.english: short thick fingers
sentences.chinese: 短粗的手指

sentences.english: thick wool socks (= socks that are heavy and warm )
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的羊毛袜子

sentences.english: If you want a thicker blanket, there are more here in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要更厚的毯子，这个柜子里还有。

sentences.english: The meat is done when the thickest part turns from pink to white.
sentences.chinese: 肉最厚的部分从粉红色变成白色，就说明熟了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides

name: crowd
trans: n. 群众,一伙;一堆,许多,大众

sentences.english: A vast crowd gathered in the main square.
sentences.chinese: 主广场上聚集了一大群人。

sentences.english: She mingled with the crowd of guests, exchanging greetings.
sentences.chinese: 她穿梭在宾客中间和他们打招呼。

sentences.english: Saturday’s game was watched by a capacity crowd (= the maximum number of people that a sports ground etc can hold ) .
sentences.chinese: 星期六的比赛座无虚席。

sentences.english: Troops fired tear gas and shots to disperse a crowd of 15,000 demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 军队发射催泪弹并开枪来驱散15,000名示威群众。

sentences.english: I didn’t know him; he wasn’t one of the usual crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我不认识他，他不是平时那一群人里的。

sentences.english: He wanted to go unnoticed, to be one of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他想默默无闻地做个普通人。

detailed_translations.english: a large group of people who have gathered together to do something, for example to watch something or protest about something

name: medieval
trans: adj. 中世纪的；原始的；仿中世纪的；老式的

sentences.english: These spices were first brought to Italy from the East in medieval times.
sentences.chinese: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。

sentences.english: a medieval castle
sentences.chinese: 一座中世纪城堡

detailed_translations.english: connected with the Middle Ages (= the period between about 1100 and 1500 AD )

name: double
trans: n. 两倍；双精度型

sentences.english: a double sink
sentences.chinese: 双水槽

sentences.english: a double wardrobe
sentences.chinese: 双门衣柜

sentences.english: the great double doors of the cathedral
sentences.chinese: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门

sentences.english: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
sentences.chinese: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

sentences.english: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
sentences.chinese: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same

name: esoteric
trans: adj. 秘传的；限于圈内人的；难懂的

sentences.english: ...esoteric knowledge.
sentences.chinese: …深奥难懂的知识。

detailed_translations.chinese: 秘传的；限于圈内人的；难懂的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as esoteric, you mean it is known, understood, or appreciated by only a small number of people

name: type
trans: n. 类型，品种；模范；样式

sentences.english: I’ve already seen a few movies of this type.
sentences.chinese: 我已经看过几部这种类型的影片了。

sentences.english: He types with two fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他用两个手指打字。

detailed_translations.english: one member of a group of people or things that have similar features or qualities
to write something using a computer or a typewriter

name: correlate
trans: n. 相关物；相关联的人

sentences.english: Obesity correlates with increased risk for hypertension and stroke.
sentences.chinese: 过度肥胖与高血压和中风的发病风险增加密切相关。

detailed_translations.english: if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other
if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

name: tool
trans: n. 工具，用具；器械，机床；手段

sentences.english: I don’t have the right tools to start fiddling around with the engine.
sentences.chinese: 我没有合适的工具来摆弄发动机。

sentences.english: a shop selling garden tools
sentences.chinese: 出售园艺工具的商店

detailed_translations.chinese: 工具，用具；器械，机床；手段
detailed_translations.english: something that you hold in your hand and use to do a particular job

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用工具；用机床装备工厂

name: swallow
trans: n. 燕子；一次吞咽的量

sentences.english: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。

sentences.english: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
sentences.chinese: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

name: trace
trans: n. 痕迹，踪迹；微量；[仪] 迹线；缰绳

sentences.english: There was no trace of anyone having entered the room since then.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何迹象表明在那以后有人进过这房间。

sentences.english: Petra’s lost all trace of her German accent.
sentences.chinese: 彼得拉已完全没有德国口音。

sentences.english: Officers were unable to find any trace of drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察未能找到毒品的蛛丝马迹。

sentences.english: I saw the faintest trace of a smile cross Sandra’s face.
sentences.chinese: 我看到桑德拉的脸上闪过一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We finally traced him to an address in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于追查到他在芝加哥的一个地址。

detailed_translations.english: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed
to find or discover sb/sth by looking carefully for them/it

name: withstand
trans: vt. 抵挡；禁得起；反抗

sentences.english: The Chancellor has withstood the criticism and held firm.
sentences.chinese: 总理顶住批评，坚持立场。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you

name: influence
trans: n. 影响；势力；感化；有影响的人或事

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: selective
trans: adj. 选择性的

sentences.english: selective schools
sentences.chinese: 择优录取学生的学校

sentences.english: He has a very selective memory (= he chooses what he wants to remember and what to forget ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的记忆选择性很强。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you choose to do, buy, allow etc

name: adulterate
trans: adj. 通奸的；搀杂的

sentences.english: The food had been adulterated to increase its weight.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物被掺了假以增加其重量。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink less pure by adding another substance of lower quality to it

name: strut
trans: n. 支柱；高视阔步

sentences.english: He struts around town like he owns the place.
sentences.chinese: 他在城里趾高气扬地走着，好像他拥有着这地方似的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 炫耀；在…上趾高气扬地走；给…加支撑
detailed_translations.english: to walk proudly with your head high and your chest pushed forwards, showing that you think you are important
a long thin piece of metal or wood used to support a part of a building, the wing of an aircraft etc

name: station
trans: n. 车站；驻地；地位；身份

sentences.english: I want to get off at the next station.
sentences.chinese: 我要在下一站下车。

sentences.english: Grand Central Station
sentences.chinese: 中央火车站

sentences.english: Is there a waiting room in the station?
sentences.chinese: 车站里有候车室吗？

sentences.english: the city bus station
sentences.chinese: 市内公共汽车站

detailed_translations.english: a place where trains or buses regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off, goods can be loaded etc, or the buildings at such a place
to send someone in the military to a particular place for a period of time as part of their military duty

name: expose
trans: vt. 揭露，揭发；使曝光；显示

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: scrutinize
trans: n. 仔细或彻底检查

sentences.english: He scrutinized the document.
sentences.chinese: 他细阅了这份文件。

sentences.english: She scrutinized his face.
sentences.chinese: 她细细端详他的脸。

detailed_translations.english: to examine someone or something very carefully

name: sociology
trans: n. 社会学；群体生态学

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: Basic courses in sociology and psychology as well as other humanities courses give students plenty of opportunity to explore their own emotions.
sentences.chinese: 社会学和心理学的基础，以及其他人文学科的课程，赋予学生大量的机会去探索其个人情感。

sentences.english: And I spent part of my second grade year in Sweden, where my father was on sabbatical as a professor of sociology.
sentences.chinese: 因为我父亲休假的缘故，我的小学二年级有一段时间是在瑞典上的，那个时候他是一名社会学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

name: piety
trans: n. 虔诚；孝敬；虔诚的行为或语言

sentences.english: an act of Christian piety
sentences.chinese: 表达基督徒虔诚的行为

detailed_translations.english: when you behave in a way that shows respect for your religion

name: additional
trans: adj. 附加的，额外的

sentences.english: Additional information can be obtained from the centre.
sentences.chinese: 可以从中心获取更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: more than what was agreed or expected

name: tutor
trans: n. 导师；家庭教师；助教

sentences.english: He was privately tutored.
sentences.chinese: 他是由家庭教师教的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who gives private lessons to one student or a small group, and is paid directly by them

name: impossible
trans: n. 不可能；不可能的事

sentences.english: ‘I want to speak to Mr Franks.’ ‘I’m afraid that’s impossible.’
sentences.chinese: “我想和弗兰克斯先生谈谈。”“恐怕不行。”

sentences.english: It’s impossible to be accurate about these things.
sentences.chinese: 这些事情不可能准确无误 。

sentences.english: The noise made sleep impossible.
sentences.chinese: 噪音吵得人无法睡觉。

sentences.english: Members with young children often found it impossible to attend evening meetings.
sentences.chinese: 有小孩的会员常觉得没法参加晚上的聚会。

sentences.english: It is difficult to find work these days, but for blind people it is virtually impossible.
sentences.chinese: 现在找工作很难，对于盲人来说几乎是不可能。

sentences.english: He was faced with a seemingly impossible task.
sentences.chinese: 他面临着似乎不可能完成的任务。

sentences.english: It was physically impossible to get the fridge through the door.
sentences.chinese: 根本不可能把冰箱从这扇门搬过去。

sentences.english: Six months ago, peace seemed an impossible dream.
sentences.chinese: 六个月前和平还似乎是个无法实现的梦。

sentences.english: Such mental attitudes are difficult, if not impossible, to change.
sentences.chinese: 即使有可能，要改变这样的心态也是很难的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done

name: obligation
trans: n. 义务；职责；债务

sentences.english: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
sentences.chinese: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。

sentences.english: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
sentences.chinese: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。

sentences.english: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
sentences.chinese: 你不必非要买更多的书。

sentences.english: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
sentences.chinese: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。

sentences.english: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
sentences.chinese: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务

sentences.english: a moral obligation to help the poor
sentences.chinese: 帮助穷人的道德义务
