sentences.chinese: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

detailed_translations.english: a moral or legal duty to do something

name: motivate

sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

name: lucid
trans: adj. 明晰的；透明的；易懂的；头脑清楚的

sentences.english: You must write in a clear and lucid style.
sentences.chinese: 你的写作风格一定要清楚易懂。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand

name: levy
trans: n. 征收；征兵，征税

sentences.english: ...an annual levy on all drivers.
sentences.chinese: …向所有司机征收的年税。

sentences.english: a new tax levied on all electrical goods
sentences.chinese: 对所有电器商品征收的一种新税

detailed_translations.english: an additional sum of money, usually paid as a tax
to officially say that people must pay a tax or charge

name: partisan
trans: n. 游击队；虔诚信徒；党羽

sentences.english: British newspapers are highly partisan .
sentences.chinese: 英国报纸的立场壁垒分明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 党派的；效忠的；偏袒的；盲目推崇的
detailed_translations.english: strongly supporting a particular political party, plan or leader, usually without considering the other choices carefully
a member of an armed group that fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country

name: tortuous
trans: adj. 扭曲的，弯曲的；啰嗦的

sentences.english: a tortuous path over the mountains to Kandahar
sentences.chinese: 翻山越岭通往坎大哈的一条蜿蜒小径

detailed_translations.english: a tortuous path, stream, road etc has a lot of bends in it and is therefore difficult to travel along

name: representatively
trans: Not Found

name: vigilant
trans: adj. 警惕的；警醒的；注意的；警戒的

sentences.english: Please remain vigilant at all times and report anything suspicious.
sentences.chinese: 请时刻保持警惕，有可疑情况随时报告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 警惕的；警醒的；注意的；警戒的
detailed_translations.english: giving careful attention to what is happening, so that you will notice any danger or illegal activity

name: succinct
trans: adj. 简洁的；简明的；紧身的

sentences.english: a succinct explanation
sentences.chinese: 简明扼要的解释

detailed_translations.english: clearly expressed in a few words – use this to show approval

name: drown
trans: vt. 淹没；把…淹死

sentences.chinese: 船翻后许多人淹死了。

sentences.english: Jane was drowned in the river.
sentences.chinese: 简在那条河里溺水身亡。

detailed_translations.english: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

name: engrave
trans: vt. 雕刻；铭记

sentences.chinese: 你的结婚戒指可以刻上个人题字不另收费。

sentences.english: The shop will also engrave your child's name on the side.
sentences.chinese: 商店也将在一侧刻上你孩子的名字。

sentences.english: ...a bottle engraved with her name.
sentences.chinese: …一个刻有她名字的瓶子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雕刻；  铭记， 深印于 ， 铭刻
detailed_translations.english: If you engrave something with a design or words, or if you engrave a design or words on it, you cut the design or words into its surface

name: vituperative
trans: adj. 责骂的

name: vogue
trans: n. 时尚；流行，时髦

sentences.english: Suntanning first came into vogue in the mid-1930s.
sentences.chinese: 晒黑皮肤最早流行于20世纪30年代中期。

detailed_translations.english: a popular and fashionable style, activity, method etc

name: respond
trans: n. 应答；唱和

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

name: representative
trans: n. 代表；典型；众议员

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

name: forum
trans: n. 论坛，讨论会；法庭；公开讨论的广场

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

name: occur
trans: vi. 发生；出现；存在

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

name: marine
trans: adj. 船舶的；海生的；海产的；航海的，海运的

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sea and the creatures that live there

name: primary
trans: n. 原色；最主要者

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: lean
trans: vi. 倾斜；倚靠；倾向；依赖

sentences.english: They were leaning forward, facing each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们面对面身体前倾。

sentences.english: He was leaning on the bridge, watching the boats go by.
sentences.chinese: 他靠在桥上，看着船来船往。

detailed_translations.english: to move or bend your body in a particular direction

name: concussive
trans: Not Found

name: newspaper
trans: n. 报纸

sentences.english: She had read about it in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 关于这件事她已经在报纸上看到了。

sentences.english: a series of newspaper articles about life in Cuba
sentences.chinese: 刊登在报纸上的一系列关于古巴生活的文章

detailed_translations.english: a set of large folded sheets of printed paper containing news, articles, pictures, advertisements etc which is sold daily or weekly

name: software
trans: n. 软件

sentences.chinese: 她给电脑装上新的软件。

sentences.english: a software company
sentences.chinese: 软件公司

detailed_translations.english: the sets of programs that tell a computer how to do a particular job

name: infect
trans: vt. 感染，传染

sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现

sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

name: rank
trans: n. 排；等级；军衔；队列

sentences.chinese: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange objects in a line or row

detailed_translations.english: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance

name: atheistic
trans: adj. 无神论的；无神论者的

name: exhibition
trans: n. 展览，显示；展览会；展览品

sentences.chinese: 到展览会参观的人都必须先到总服务台报到。

sentences.english: Our country will tie up with another country to host this exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我国将和另外一个国家联合主办这次展览会。

sentences.english: You go to the exhibition centre, I must hie myself to tell the new matters.
sentences.chinese: 你去展览中心吧，我得赶紧汇报一下这个新情况。

detailed_translations.english: a show of paintings, photographs, or other objects that people can go to see

name: compliance
trans: n. 顺从，服从；承诺

sentences.chinese: 监察员被派去参观核址并核实条约的遵守情况。

detailed_translations.english: when someone obeys a rule, agreement, or demand

name: coastal
trans: adj. 沿海的；海岸的

sentences.chinese: 英国的近海水域

sentences.english: the coastal path
sentences.chinese: 海滨小道

detailed_translations.english: in the sea or on the land near the coast

trans: n. 磨光，擦亮；上光剂，擦亮剂；优雅，精良

sentences.chinese: 你的文章不错，只要稍加润色就可以了。

trans: n. 评论；意见；批评

sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

name: everywhere
trans: n. 每个地方

sentences.english: I’ve looked everywhere but I can’t find the map.
sentences.chinese: 我到处都找过了，但就是找不到地图。

sentences.english: He’s travelled everywhere in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他走遍了欧洲各地。

sentences.english: The south should remain dry, but everywhere else will have heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 南部持续干旱，但其他地区会下暴雨。

detailed_translations.english: in or to every place

name: takeover
trans: n. 接管；验收

sentences.english: Thornbury has announced a takeover bid of a regional TV company.
sentences.chinese: 索恩伯里已经宣布将出价收购一家地方电视公司。

sentences.english: He prevented a hostile takeover (= when the takeover is not wanted by the company being bought ) of the company.
sentences.chinese: 他阻止了对公司的恶意收购。

detailed_translations.english: when one company takes control of another by buying more than half its  shares

name: sociable
trans: n. 联谊会

sentences.english: a pleasant, sociable couple
sentences.chinese: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；执照；专利品

sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: generalize
trans: vi. 形成概念

sentences.english: She has a tendency to generalize from her husband to all men.
sentences.chinese: 她总爱把自己对丈夫的看法推及所有的男人。

detailed_translations.english: to form a general principle or opinion after considering only a small number of facts or examples

name: construct
trans: n. 构想，概念

sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: administrative
trans: adj. 管理的，行政的

sentences.english: The job is mainly administrative.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是行政方面的。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the work of managing a company or organization

name: appoint
trans: vt. 任命；指定；约定

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for a position or a job

name: reservation
trans: n. 预约，预订；保留

sentences.english: a dinner reservation
sentences.chinese: 预订晚餐

sentences.english: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

name: decade
trans: n. 十年，十年期；十

sentences.english: ...the last decade of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: …19世纪的最后10年。

detailed_translations.english: a period of 10 years

name: roundabout
trans: n. 迂回路线；环状交叉路口

sentences.english: The bus took a very long and roundabout route .
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车路线很长，绕着圈子走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回的，绕道的；圆滚滚的
detailed_translations.english: a roundabout way of getting somewhere is longer and more complicated than necessary

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回路线；环状交叉路口
detailed_translations.english: a raised circular area where three or more roads join together and which cars must drive around

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: graduate
trans: n. 研究生；毕业生

sentences.english: a graduate student
sentences.chinese: 研究生

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involved in studies done at a university after completing a first degree
to obtain a degree, especially a first degree, from a college or university
someone who has completed a university degree, especially a first degree

name: reception
trans: n. 接待；接收；招待会；感受；反应

sentences.english: She was unsure of her reception after everything that had happened.
sentences.chinese: 发生了这些事后，她对自己是否还受欢迎没把握。

sentences.english: The plans received a mixed reception from unions (= some people liked them, others did not ) .
sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of welcome for someone, or a particular type of reaction to their ideas, work etc

name: radiation
trans: n. 辐射；发光；放射物

sentences.english: An accident at the power station could result in large amounts of radiation being released.
sentences.chinese: 发电站事故会造成大量核辐射泄漏。

sentences.english: a lethal dose of radiation
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的辐射

sentences.english: Sun creams work by blocking harmful ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜可隔离有害的紫外线辐射。

detailed_translations.english: a form of energy that comes especially from nuclear reactions, which in large amounts is very harmful to living things

trans: vi. 减轻；发亮

sentences.chinese: 她从父亲那儿拿过一个包以减轻他的负担。

sentences.english: This will lighten your spirit and give you strength and motivation.
sentences.chinese: 这样会减轻你的精神压力并会给你能力和动力。

sentences.english: I told you at the beginning of this article that I needed to lighten up my bike without sacrificing my suspension.
sentences.chinese: 在本文开始的部分，我告诉您我需要在不牺牲自行车避震系统的前提下，减轻自行车的重量。

name: elk
trans: n. 麋鹿；软鞣粗皮；驼鹿皮革

sentences.english: I covered the elk with a tarp and sat down near it, wrapping myself in blankets.
sentences.chinese: 我用一块防水布盖住了麋鹿，然后用毯子把自己裹起来，坐在它旁边。

sentences.english: When the elk got up, the tarp slid off.
sentences.chinese: 麋鹿站起来的时候，防水布从它身上滑落。

detailed_translations.english: a very large brown North American, European, and Asian animal with wide flat horns

name: section
trans: n. 截面；部分；部门；地区；章节

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

name: Nestle
trans: Not Found

name: extreme
trans: n. 极端；末端；最大程度；极端的事物

sentences.english: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

sentences.english: extreme cold
sentences.chinese: 严寒

sentences.english: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

detailed_translations.english: very great in degree
a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites

name: mimic
trans: vt. 模仿，摹拟

sentences.english: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
sentences.chinese: 他能模仿所有老师的口音。

sentences.english: ‘I’m so sorry,’ she mimicked.
sentences.chinese: “很抱歉。”她学着说道。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 效颦者，模仿者；仿制品；小丑

name: Empire
trans: Not Found

name: clinical
trans: adj. 临床的；诊所的

sentences.english: The drug has undergone extensive clinical trials (= tests to see if it is effective in treating people ) .
sentences.chinese: 该药已经过大量的临床试验。

sentences.english: The therapy has helped people with clinical depression (= a strong feeling of sadness, for which you need medical help ) .
sentences.chinese: 该疗法对临床抑郁症病人有帮助。

detailed_translations.english: relating to treating or testing people who are sick

name: emerge
trans: vi. 浮现；摆脱；暴露

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

name: retrieval
trans: n. 检索；恢复；取回；拯救

sentences.english: a new system that should speed up information retrieval
sentences.chinese: 能加速信息检索的新系统

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting back information stored on a computer system

name: rescue
trans: n. 营救；援救；解救

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: restriction
trans: n. 限制；约束；束缚

sentences.english: a 50 mph speed restriction
sentences.chinese: 每小时50英里的限速

detailed_translations.english: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

name: shoot
trans: n. 射击；摄影；狩猎；急流

sentences.english: Police shot one suspect when he pulled a gun on them.
sentences.chinese: 警方在一名嫌疑人拔枪指着他们时击毙了他。

sentences.english: Smith killed his wife, and then shot himself.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯杀死妻子，然后开枪自杀。

sentences.english: A woman was shot dead in an attempted robbery.
sentences.chinese: 一名女子在一桩未遂抢劫案中中枪身亡。

sentences.english: The guards have orders to shoot intruders on sight (= shoot them as soon as they see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫兵们奉命一见到有人闯入就开枪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 射击，射中；拍摄；发芽；使爆炸；给…注射
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately kill or injure someone using a gun
an occasion when someone takes photographs or makes a film

name: imperial
trans: n. 纸张尺寸；特等品

sentences.english: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
sentences.chinese: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

detailed_translations.english: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

name: ongoing
trans: adj. 不间断的，进行的；前进的

sentences.english: their ongoing search for a new director
sentences.chinese: 他们仍在寻找一个新主任

sentences.english: ongoing negotiations
sentences.chinese: 还在进行的谈判

sentences.english: The discussions are still ongoing.
sentences.chinese: 讨论仍在继续。

detailed_translations.english: continuing, or continuing to develop

name: temperature
trans: n. 温度；体温；气温；发烧

sentences.english: The temperature of the water was just right for swimming.
sentences.chinese: 这水温游泳正好。

sentences.english: Water boils at a temperature of 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 水在100摄氏度沸腾。

sentences.english: The nurse took (= measured ) my temperature .
sentences.chinese: 护士给我量了体温。

detailed_translations.english: a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is

name: infrastructure
trans: n. 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造

sentences.english: Some countries lack a suitable economic infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家缺乏适当的经济基础设施。

sentences.english: a $65 billion investment package in education, health care and infrastructure
sentences.chinese: 用于教育、医疗和基础设施的650亿美元一揽子投资计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础设施；公共建设；下部构造
detailed_translations.english: the basic systems and structures that a country or organization needs in order to work properly, for example roads, railways, banks etc

name: theory
trans: n. 理论；原理；学说；推测

sentences.english: Freudian theory has had a great influence on psychology.
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德理论对心理学产生过巨大影响。

detailed_translations.english: an idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something about life or the world, especially an idea that has not yet been proved to be true

name: collision
trans: n. 碰撞；冲突；（意见，看法）的抵触；（政党等的）倾轧

sentences.english: Two people were killed in a head-on collision (= between two vehicles that are moving directly towards each other ) on highway 218.
sentences.chinese: 218号公路上有两辆汽车迎面相撞，两人死亡。

sentences.english: a collision between the two countries over fishing rights
sentences.chinese: 两国为捕鱼权而发生的冲突

detailed_translations.english: an accident in which two or more people or vehicles hit each other while moving in different directions

name: diameter
trans: n. 直径

sentences.english: Draw a circle six centimetres in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径为六厘米的圆。

detailed_translations.english: a straight line from one side of a circle to the other side, passing through the centre of the circle, or the length of this line

name: monologue
trans: n. 独白

sentences.english: Henry looked up, then continued his monologue.
sentences.chinese: 亨利抬起头，然后继续他的长篇独白。

detailed_translations.english: a long speech by one person

name: titanic
trans: adj. 巨大的；四价钛的

sentences.english: a titanic struggle
sentences.chinese: 大搏斗

detailed_translations.english: very big, strong, impressive etc

name: asymmetrical
trans: adj. [数] 非对称的（等于asymmetric）；不均匀的；不匀称的

sentences.english: asymmetrical patterns
sentences.chinese: 不对称图案

detailed_translations.english: having two sides that are different in shape

name: panic
trans: n. 恐慌，惊慌；大恐慌

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

name: paradoxically
trans: adv. 自相矛盾地；似非而是地；反常地

sentences.english: Paradoxically, the prohibition of liquor caused an increase in alcoholism.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾的是，禁酒反而导致酗酒的增加。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is surprising because it is the opposite of what you would expect

name: consecutive
trans: adj. 连贯的；连续不断的

sentences.english: It had rained for four consecutive days.
sentences.chinese: 雨接连下了四天。

sentences.english: Can they win the title for the third consecutive season?
sentences.chinese: 他们能连续第三个赛季赢得冠军称号吗？

detailed_translations.english: consecutive numbers or periods of time follow one after the other without any interruptions

name: browser
trans: n. [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人

sentences.english: a Web browser
sentences.chinese: 网页浏览器

detailed_translations.chinese: [计] 浏览器；吃嫩叶的动物；浏览书本的人
detailed_translations.english: a computer program that finds information on the Internet and shows it on your computer screen

name: bolster
trans: n. 支持；长枕

sentences.english: I'll bolster you up.
sentences.chinese: 我支持你。

sentences.english: More timbers are needed to bolster the roof of the mine.
sentences.chinese: 需要更多的木材支撑矿顶。

sentences.english: If you have a bolster or several pillows, place your lower back onto the support.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一个支撑或者一些枕头，将你的下半身靠在这些支撑上。

detailed_translations.english: a long firm  pillow  , usually shaped like a tube

name: stabilize
trans: vt. 使稳固，使安定

sentences.english: The patient’s condition has now stabilized.
sentences.chinese: 病人的情况现已稳定下来了。

sentences.english: an attempt to stabilize the economy
sentences.chinese: 稳定经济的努力

detailed_translations.english: to become firm, steady, or unchanging, or to make something firm or steady

name: medium
trans: adj. 中间的，中等的；半生熟的

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
of middle size, level, or amount

name: flow chart
trans: n. 流程图

name: maverick
trans: n. 没打烙印的动物；持不同意见的人

sentences.english: He’s always been a bit of a maverick.
sentences.chinese: 他总是有点特立独行。

sentences.english: ...a maverick group of scientists, who oppose the prevailing medical opinion on the disease.
sentences.chinese: …一群特立独行的科学家，他们反对关于这种疾病的医学界的盛行观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 没打烙印的动物；持不同意见的人
未打烙印的；行为不合常规的；特立独行的
detailed_translations.english: Maverick is also an adjective

name: oyster
trans: n. 牡蛎，[无脊椎] 蚝；沉默寡言的人

sentences.english: How can I pull the pearl from the burning oyster?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样做才能算是从燃烧的牡蛎中取出珍珠？

detailed_translations.english: a type of shellfish that can be eaten cooked or uncooked, and that produces a jewel called a pearl

name: cogent
trans: adj. 强有力的；使人信服的

sentences.english: Every decision has to be backed up with rational and cogent arguments.
sentences.chinese: 每项决定都应该有合理和令人信服的论据做支持。

detailed_translations.english: if a statement is cogent, it seems reasonable and correct

name: perplex
trans: vt. 使困惑，使为难；使复杂化

sentences.english: Shea’s symptoms perplexed the doctors.
sentences.chinese: 谢伊的症状令医生们困惑。

detailed_translations.english: if something perplexes you, it makes you feel confused and worried because it is difficult to understand

name: launch
trans: vt. 发射（导弹、火箭等）；发起，发动；使…下水

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

sentences.english: The book launched his career as a novelist.
sentences.chinese: 这本书开启了他的小说创作生涯。

detailed_translations.english: to send a weapon or spacecraft into the sky or into space

name: noise abatement
trans: Not Found

name: diffidence
trans: n. 无自信；羞怯；内向

name: flexibility
trans: n. 灵活性；弹性；适应性

sentences.english: Employees expect flexibility in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 员工们盼望工作安排有弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to change or be changed easily to suit a different situation

name: professional
trans: n. 专业人员；职业运动员

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

name: cunning
trans: n. 狡猾

sentences.english: a cunning opponent
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的对手

detailed_translations.english: someone who is cunning is clever and good at deceiving people in order to get what they want
the ability to achieve what you want by deceiving people in a clever way

name: displace
trans: vt. 取代；置换；转移；把…免职；排水

sentences.english: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种主要能源，煤的地位已为天然气所取代。

sentences.english: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
sentences.chinese: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

detailed_translations.english: to take the place or position of something or someone

name: audio
trans: adj. 声音的；[声] 音频的，[声] 声频的

sentences.english: audio and video equipment
sentences.chinese: 音频视频设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 声音的；[声] 音频的，[声] 声频的
detailed_translations.english: relating to sound that is recorded or broadcast

name: sustain
trans: vt. 维持；支撑，承担；忍受；供养；证实

sentences.english: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: medical
trans: adj. 医学的；药的；内科的

sentences.english: medical research
sentences.chinese: 医学研究

sentences.english: medical staff
sentences.chinese: 医务人员

sentences.english: a medical student
sentences.chinese: 医科学生

sentences.english: a patient’s medical history
sentences.chinese: 患者的病史

sentences.english: medical or surgical treatment
sentences.chinese: 内科或外科疗法

detailed_translations.english: relating to medicine and the treatment of disease or injury

name: archaeology
trans: n. 考古学

sentences.english: He specializes in archaeology.
sentences.chinese: 他专修考古学。

sentences.english: In my recent research, I found that all three come together and, what is more, they help me to show that archaeology has relevance – it is not just old stones and bones.
sentences.chinese: 我在最近的研究中发现，这三点综合发生着作用，除此之外，它们也帮助我发现考古学的重要意义，它不仅仅意味着一堆石头和骨头。

sentences.english: "There was no access to clean water, there was no access to basic education especially in the rural areas where the archaeology was," she says.
sentences.chinese: 在那里的考古学特别是农村地区，我们并没有获得干净的水，有没有基本的教育的机会，“她说。

detailed_translations.english: the study of ancient societies by examining what remains of their buildings,  grave s  , tools etc

name: guarantee
trans: n. 保证；担保；保证人；保证书；抵押品

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

name: language
trans: n. 语言；语言文字；表达能力

sentences.english: How many languages do you speak?
sentences.chinese: 你能说几种语言？

sentences.english: one of the best-known poems in the English language
sentences.chinese: 最著名的英语诗歌之一

detailed_translations.english: a system of communication by written or spoken words, which is used by the people of a particular country or area

name: distill
trans: vt. 提取；蒸馏；使滴下

sentences.english: distilled water
sentences.chinese: 蒸馏水

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid such as water or alcohol more pure by heating it so that it becomes a gas and then letting it cool. Drinks such as  whisky  are made this way.

name: unemployment
trans: n. 失业；失业率；失业人数

sentences.english: Closure of the plant means 80 workers are facing unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

sentences.english: a town where there is high unemployment
sentences.chinese: 高失业率城镇

detailed_translations.english: when someone does not have a job

name: proposal
trans: n. 提议，建议；求婚

sentences.english: The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional crisis.
sentences.chinese: 总统将提出解决国家宪法危机的新议案。

sentences.english: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

detailed_translations.english: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

name: restitution
trans: n. 恢复；赔偿；归还

sentences.english: The offender must make restitution for the hurt that he or she has caused.
sentences.chinese: 违法者必须为其所造成的伤害作出赔偿。

detailed_translations.english: the act of giving back something that was lost or stolen to its owner, or of paying for damage

name: freedom
trans: n. 自由，自主；直率

sentences.english: People here like their freedom and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 这里的人喜欢他们所拥有的自由与隐私权。

sentences.english: the rights and freedoms of citizens
sentences.chinese: 公民的权利与自由

sentences.english: the freedom to vote
sentences.chinese: 选举自由

sentences.english: He thinks children have too much freedom these days.
sentences.chinese: 他认为如今的孩子太自由了。

detailed_translations.english: the right to do what you want without being controlled or restricted by anyone

name: spread
trans: n. 传播；伸展

sentences.english: The cancer had spread to her liver.
sentences.chinese: 癌已经扩散到她的肝脏。

sentences.english: The news spread like wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 消息如野火般迅速传开。

detailed_translations.english: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

name: conciliatory
trans: adj. 安抚的；调和的；调停的

sentences.english: Brooks felt in no mood to be conciliatory.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克斯不想作出和解。

detailed_translations.english: doing something that is intended to make someone stop arguing with you

name: tremendous
trans: adj. 极大的，巨大的；惊人的；极好的

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

name: follower
trans: n. 追随者；信徒；属下

sentences.english: Marx and his followers were convinced that capitalism would destroy itself.
sentences.chinese: 马克思及其支持者确信资本主义将自我毁灭。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in a particular system of ideas, or who supports a leader who teaches these ideas

name: hurt
trans: n. 痛苦；危害；痛苦的原因

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

name: deliberately
trans: adv. 故意地；谨慎地；慎重地

sentences.english: He deliberately upset her.
sentences.chinese: 他故意惹她不开心。

sentences.english: He shook his head slowly and deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 他缓缓而慎重地摇摇头。

detailed_translations.english: done in a way that is intended or planned

name: differ
trans: vi. 相异；意见分歧

sentences.english: The two systems differ in many respects.
sentences.chinese: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

sentences.english: Experts have differing views on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

detailed_translations.english: to be different from something in some way

name: accordingly
trans: adv. 因此，于是；相应地；照著

sentences.english: We have to discover his plans and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 我们得找出他的计划，照着办。

sentences.english: Some of the laws were contradictory. Accordingly, measures were taken to clarify them.
sentences.chinese: 有些法律相互矛盾，因此，采取了措施将其阐明。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

name: equally
trans: adv. 同样地；相等地，平等地；公平地

sentences.english: You must have a good education, but practical training is equally important.
sentences.chinese: 你必须接受良好的教育，不过实际培训也同样重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同样地；相等地，平等地；公平地
detailed_translations.english: to the same degree or amount

name: paddle
trans: n. 划桨；明轮翼

sentences.english: Each man had a paddle for an hour and then a rest.
sentences.chinese: 每人划一小时桨， 然后休息一下。

sentences.english: We strive to paddle to follow the stream, however, we are unsure if how and when we will reach the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着河流奋力划桨，但是我们无法确定我们什么时候和怎样才能到达地平线。

sentences.english: If you run your team as if they were self-leading, but in reality they’re chaos, then before long you’ll be heading up a certain creek without a paddle.
sentences.chinese: 如果你当他们是自我引导型的团队在运作，但其实他们事实上还是在混乱的状态，那么不久你就会在一条河上像没有桨似的乱窜。

detailed_translations.english: a short pole that is wide and flat at the end, used for moving a small boat in water
to move a small light boat through water, using one or more paddles

name: at stake
trans: na. 被赌着；在危险中；利害[生死]攸关

name: specious
trans: adj. 似是而非的；外表美观的；华而不实的；徒有其表的

sentences.english: a specious argument
sentences.chinese: 貌似有理的 论据

detailed_translations.chinese: 似是而非的；外表美观的；华而不实的；徒有其表的
detailed_translations.english: seeming to be true or correct, but actually false

name: malnourish
trans: Not Found

name: orientation
trans: n. 方向；定向；适应；情况介绍；向东方

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

name: aspiration
trans: n. 渴望；抱负；送气；吸气；吸引术

sentences.english: a high level of political aspiration
sentences.chinese: 崇高的政治抱负

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的愿望； 志向， 抱负
detailed_translations.english: a strong desire to have or achieve something

name: demographic
trans: adj. 人口统计学的；人口学的

sentences.english: In the same demographic breakdown of people may have different characteristics of the consumer mentality.
sentences.chinese: 处于同一人口统计细分的人们，可能具有不同的消费心态特征。

sentences.english: It is generally studied and mapped by an organization through lists and reportscontaining demographic information that may have an effect on the marketing of keyproducts or services.
sentences.chinese: 组织通常通过包含了可能对主要产品或服务的市场营销产生影响的人口统计信息的列表或包括来研究或划分它的。

name: disperse
trans: vt. 分散；使散开；传播

sentences.english: Police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察用催泪瓦斯驱散人群。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分散， 赶散； 消散， 驱散
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

detailed_translations.chinese: 使分散，散开；使消散，消失
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

name: express
trans: n. 快车，快递，专使；捷运公司

sentences.english: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.chinese: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.english: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.chinese: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.english: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 许多人反对这些提议。

sentences.english: He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.chinese: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.english: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
sentences.chinese: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

sentences.english: London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.chinese: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

sentences.english: Send these books by express.
sentences.chinese: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

detailed_translations.english: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

name: eligible
trans: n. 合格者；适任者；有资格者

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: PET
trans: n. 宠物；生气；受宠爱的人

name: migrant
trans: n. 候鸟；移居者；随季节迁移的民工

sentences.english: The government divides asylum seekers into economic migrants and genuine refugees.
sentences.chinese: 政府将寻求政治庇护的人划分为经济移民和真正的难民。

detailed_translations.chinese: 移居者， 移民； 候鸟， 迁移动物
detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: consciousness
trans: n. 意识；知觉；觉悟；感觉

sentences.english: The painful memories eventually faded from her consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 那些痛苦的回忆最终从她的意识中淡去了。

sentences.english: Hypnosis is an altered state of consciousness .
sentences.chinese: 催眠状态是一种被改变的意识状态。

sentences.english: research into human consciousness
sentences.chinese: 对人类意识的研究

detailed_translations.english: your mind and your thoughts

name: harm
trans: n. 伤害；损害

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

name: skeleton
trans: n. 骨架，骨骼；纲要；骨瘦如柴的人

sentences.english: We agreed on a skeleton outline of the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 我们给提案商定了一个基本框架。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骨架，骨骼；纲要；骨瘦如柴的人
detailed_translations.english: the most important parts of something, to which more detail can be added later

detailed_translations.chinese: 骨骼的；骨瘦如柴的；概略的

name: pledge
trans: n. 保证，誓言；抵押；抵押品，典当物

sentences.english: The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.
sentences.chinese: 会议以加快该地区6个州之间合作的承诺结束。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially
to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

name: detect
trans: vt. 察觉；发现；探测

sentences.english: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
sentences.chinese: 如果发现得早，许多种癌症都可以治愈。

sentences.english: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.
sentences.chinese: …一台探测辐射的敏感仪器。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc

name: dormitory
trans: n. 宿舍，学生宿舍

sentences.english: She lived in a college dormitory.
sentences.chinese: 她住在一幢大学宿舍楼里。

detailed_translations.english: a large building at a college or university where students live

name: fast
trans: n. 斋戒；绝食

sentences.english: a fast car
sentences.chinese: 速度很快的汽车

sentences.english: That can’t be the time - my watch must be fast.
sentences.chinese: 不可能是这个时间——一定是我的表快了。

sentences.english: Slow down – you’re driving too fast.
sentences.chinese: 慢点——你开得太快了。

detailed_translations.english: moving or able to move quickly
moving quickly

name: willow
trans: n. [林] 柳树；[木] 柳木制品

sentences.english: The willow trees cast their shadows all around.
sentences.chinese: 柳荫匝地。

sentences.english: He worships that big willow south of the house.
sentences.chinese: 他很崇拜房子南面的那颗大柳树。

sentences.english: He has also captured pollen from alder, pine and willow.
sentences.chinese: 他还从桤树、松树和柳树上捕捉到了花粉。

detailed_translations.english: a type of tree that has long thin branches and grows near water, or the wood from this tree

name: bestow
trans: vt. 使用；授予；放置；留宿

sentences.english: The United States bestowed honorary citizenship upon England's World War II prime minister, Sir Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 美国授予了二战期间的英国首相温斯顿·丘吉尔爵士荣誉公民的称号。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone something of great value or importance

name: preoccupation
trans: n. 全神贯注，入神；当务之急；关注的事物；抢先占据；成见

sentences.english: Karouzos's poetry shows a profound preoccupation with the Orthodox Church.
sentences.chinese: 卡鲁佐斯的诗歌表现出对东正教的深切关注。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全神贯注，入神；当务之急；关注的事物；抢先占据；成见
detailed_translations.english: when someone thinks or worries about something a lot, with the result that they do not pay attention to other things

name: contrite
trans: adj. 悔悟了的；后悔的；悔罪的

sentences.english: a contrite apology
sentences.chinese: 深感悔悟的道歉

detailed_translations.english: feeling guilty and sorry for something bad that you have done

name: prescribe
trans: vt. 规定；开处方

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: neighbour
trans: n. n. 邻居;同胞；仁慈的人

sentences.english: One of the neighbors complained about the noise from the party.
sentences.chinese: 有位邻居抱怨聚会太吵。

sentences.english: FBI agents were interviewing all their friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 联邦调查局人员正在向他们所有的朋友和邻居问话。

sentences.english: Our next-door neighbours (= the people who live in the house next to us ) say they’ll look after our cat for us while we’re away.
sentences.chinese: 我们隔壁的邻居说，我们不在时他们会照顾我们的猫。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives next to you or near you

name: deforestation
trans: n. 采伐森林；森林开伐

sentences.english: the deforestation of the tropics
sentences.chinese: 热带森林的毁坏

detailed_translations.english: the cutting or burning down of all the trees in an area

name: astrophysical
trans: Not Found

name: consult
trans: vi. 请教；商议；当顾问

sentences.english: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.
sentences.chinese: 如果症状持续的话，马上咨询医生。

sentences.english: Have you consulted a dictionary?
sentences.chinese: 你查过词典了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

name: mineral
trans: n. 矿物；（英）矿泉水；无机物；苏打水（常用复数表示）

sentences.english: The area is very rich in minerals .
sentences.chinese: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.english: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.english: mineral water
sentences.chinese: 矿泉水

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
of or containing or derived from minerals

name: capability
trans: n. 才能，能力；性能，容量

sentences.english: the country’s manufacturing capability
sentences.chinese: 该国的生产能力

sentences.english: I can speak French, but simultaneous translation is beyond my capabilities (= too difficult ).
sentences.chinese: 我能讲法语，但是同声传译我做不了。

detailed_translations.english: the natural ability, skill, or power that makes a machine, person, or organization able to do something, especially something difficult

name: contrary
trans: n. 相反；反面

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

name: grand
trans: n. 大钢琴；一千美元

sentences.english: a grand country house
sentences.chinese: 豪华的乡间大宅

sentences.english: The party was a grand affair.
sentences.chinese: 这个聚会场面隆重。

sentences.english: New Yorkers build on a grand scale.
sentences.chinese: 纽约人喜欢建高楼大厦。

detailed_translations.english: big and very impressive

name: cite
trans: vt. 引用；传讯；想起；表彰

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: appreciate
trans: vi. 增值；涨价

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: query
trans: n. 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询

sentences.english: Staff are always available to answer your queries.
sentences.chinese: 员工随时为您解答疑问。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疑问，质问；疑问号 ；[计] 查询
detailed_translations.english: a question that you ask to get information, or to check that something is true or correct
to express doubt about whether something is true or correct

name: rehearsal
trans: n. 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述

sentences.english: a wedding rehearsal
sentences.chinese: 婚礼的预演

detailed_translations.chinese: 排演；预演；练习；训练；叙述
detailed_translations.english: a time when all the people in a play, concert etc practise before a public performance

name: feature
trans: n. 特色，特征；容貌；特写或专题节目

sentences.english: Air bags are a standard feature in most new cars.
sentences.chinese: 气囊是大多数新车的标准配置。

sentences.english: Striped tails are a common feature of many animals.
sentences.chinese: 尾巴上有条纹是许多动物的共同特征。

sentences.english: The hotel’s only redeeming features (= things that make it acceptable ) were that it was cheap and near the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆仅有的可取之处就是价格低廉并且靠近市中心。

sentences.english: One of the distinguishing features (= features that are different from other things of the same sort ) of modern banking is its dependence on computers.
sentences.chinese: 现代银行业的显著特征之一就是依赖电脑。

sentences.english: It's a great film and it features a Spanish actor who is going to be a world star within a year.
sentences.chinese: 那是一部精彩的电影，它由一位西班牙演员主演，他一年之内就会成为国际明星。

sentences.english: The hour-long programme will be updated each week and feature highlights from recent games.
sentences.chinese: 这个一小时的节目将每周更新，重点介绍近期比赛的精彩部分。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特征，特色；面貌；特写，专题节目；故事片
detailed_translations.english: a part of something that you notice because it seems important, interesting, or typical
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it

name: physical
trans: n. 体格检查

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

name: possibility
trans: n. 可能性；可能发生的事物

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

name: witness
trans: n. 证人；目击者；证据

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: permission
trans: n. 允许，许可

sentences.english: He asked permission to leave the room.
sentences.chinese: 他请求离开房间的许可。

sentences.english: They cannot leave the country without permission.
sentences.chinese: 没有许可他们不得离开这个国家。

detailed_translations.english: the act of allowing sb to do sth, especially when this is done by sb in a position of authority

name: thaw
trans: n. 解冻；融雪

sentences.english: The lake thawed in March.
sentences.chinese: 3月里，湖水解冻了。

detailed_translations.english: if ice or snow thaws, or if the sun thaws it, it turns into water
a period of warm weather during which snow and ice melt

name: speed
trans: n. 速度，速率；迅速，快速；昌盛，繁荣

sentences.english: I got caught speeding on the A40 yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我在 A40 号干线公路上超速行驶被逮到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰，迅速前进，急行；加速；超速行驶
detailed_translations.english: to be driving faster than the legal limit
the rate at which something moves or travels

detailed_translations.chinese: 快速传送； 促进， 使加速
detailed_translations.english: to take someone or something somewhere very quickly

name: feat
trans: n. 功绩，壮举；技艺表演

sentences.english: A racing car is an extraordinary feat of engineering.
sentences.chinese: 赛车是工程学的一项非凡业绩。

detailed_translations.english: something that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength etc to do

name: recruit
trans: n. 招聘；新兵；新成员

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: placement
trans: n. 布置；定位球；人员配置

name: magnetic
trans: adj. 地磁的；有磁性的；有吸引力的

sentences.english: magnetic forces
sentences.chinese: 磁力

sentences.english: a magnetic personality
sentences.chinese: 富有魅力的个性

detailed_translations.english: concerning or produced by  magnetism

name: frivolous
trans: adj. 无聊的；轻佻的；琐碎的

sentences.english: I just decided I was a bit too frivolous to be a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 我只是认定自己有点儿太轻率，不适合当医生。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as frivolous, you mean they behave in a silly or light-hearted way, rather than being serious and sensible

name: boost
trans: n. 推动；帮助；宣扬

sentences.english: The new resort area has boosted tourism.
sentences.chinese: 新的度假区促进了旅游业的发展。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动， 促进， 激励； 替…做广告， 宣扬； 提高， 使增长
detailed_translations.english: to increase or improve something and make it more successful
something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

name: reproach
trans: n. 责备；耻辱

sentences.english: ‘You don’t need me,’ she said quietly, without reproach.
sentences.chinese: “你不需要我。”她语气平静，没有丝毫责备。

detailed_translations.english: criticism, blame, or disapproval

name: evoke
trans: vt. 引起，唤起；博得

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: temporary
trans: n. 临时工，临时雇员

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

name: review
trans: n. 回顾；复习；评论；检讨；检阅

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
