detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is noisy makes a lot of noise

name: relatively
trans: adv. 相当地；相对地，比较地

sentences.english: The system is relatively easy to use.
sentences.chinese: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。

sentences.english: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

detailed_translations.english: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things

name: integration
trans: n. 集成；综合

sentences.english: problems of racial integration
sentences.chinese: 种族融合的问题

detailed_translations.english: the combining of two or more things so that they work together effectively

name: contact
trans: n. 接触，联系

sentences.english: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 小镇与外界的联系被切断了。

sentences.english: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any queries.
sentences.chinese: 你如果有任何疑问，尽管和我联系。

detailed_translations.english: communication with a person, organization, country etc
to write to or telephone someone

name: persuasive
trans: adj. 有说服力的；劝诱的，劝说的

sentences.english: In either case it is persuasive because there is somebody whom it persuades.
sentences.chinese: 不管在那种情况下，它之所以有说服力，是因为有人被说服了。

sentences.english: Providing examples of what others are saying about your suitability and skills is extremely persuasive and the more you have, the more your influence rises.
sentences.chinese: 举例说明别人对你的适合性和技能的评价十分有说服力，这样的例子越多，你的影响力增长的就越大。

name: repellent
trans: n. 防护剂；防水布；排斥力

sentences.english: She found him physically repellent.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他的长相很讨厌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排斥的；防水的；弹回的；令人讨厌的
detailed_translations.english: very unpleasant

name: attune
trans: vt. 使协调；使合拍；为…调音；调合波长

sentences.english: Incense can attune the finite to the Infinite.
sentences.chinese: 熏香可以使有限调谐至无限。

sentences.english: Now let us sit quietly and attune to our soul oversoul and source along with the earth mother and nature kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 现在，让我们静静地坐着，调谐向我们的灵魂、超灵和源头，以及地球母亲和自然界王国。

detailed_translations.english: to adjust or accustom (a person or thing); acclimatize

name: workforce
trans: n. 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数

sentences.english: Women now represent almost 50% of the workforce.
sentences.chinese: 如今女性几乎占全部劳动人口的 50%。

sentences.english: The company is cutting its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正在裁员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劳动力；工人总数，职工总数
detailed_translations.english: all the people who work in a particular industry or company, or are available to work in a particular country or area

name: deficient
trans: adj. 不足的；有缺陷的；不充分的

sentences.english: Women who are dieting can become iron deficient.
sentences.chinese: 节食的女性有可能缺铁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不足的；有缺陷的；不充分的
detailed_translations.english: not containing or having enough of something

name: task
trans: n. 工作，作业；任务

sentences.english: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。

sentences.english: I was given the task of building a fire.
sentences.chinese: 我分配到生火的任务。

sentences.english: the skills required to carry out these tasks
sentences.chinese: 执行这些任务所需要的技能

sentences.english: He soon realized the scale of the task he had undertaken .
sentences.chinese: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。

sentences.english: Our first task is to gather information.
sentences.chinese: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。

sentences.english: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
sentences.chinese: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。

sentences.english: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们有个令人头疼的工作，就是管理国家最危险的监狱。

sentences.english: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单，吃力不讨好。

sentences.english: Trying to bring up a small daughter on your own is no easy task .
sentences.chinese: 独自抚养年幼的女儿不是件轻而易举的事。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly

name: formalistic
trans: Not Found

name: assemble
trans: vt. 集合，聚集；装配；收集

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: apologize
trans: vi. 道歉；辩解；赔不是

sentences.english: I’m so sorry, I do apologize.
sentences.chinese: 非常对不起，我真心道歉。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that you are sorry that you have done something wrong

name: aggressive
trans: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: cram
trans: n. 死记硬背；极度拥挤

sentences.english: She’s been cramming hard all week.
sentences.chinese: 她整个星期都在拼命准备应付考试。

detailed_translations.chinese: 狼吞虎咽地吃东西；死记硬背功课

name: adjustment
trans: n. 调整，调节；调节器

sentences.english: a period of adjustment
sentences.chinese: 一段调整期

detailed_translations.english: a small change made to a machine, system, or calculation

name: revenue
trans: n. 税收，国家的收入；收益

sentences.english: advertising revenue
sentences.chinese: 广告收入

sentences.english: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues .
sentences.chinese: 罢工造成的收入损失达到2,000万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

name: recycle
trans: n. 再生；再循环；重复利用

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

name: teach
trans: vt. 教；教授；教导

sentences.english: She taught me fractions and counting.
sentences.chinese: 他教我分数和计算。

detailed_translations.english: to give lessons in a school, college, or university, or to help someone learn about something by giving them information

name: precision
trans: n. 精度，[数] 精密度；精确

sentences.english: precision engineering
sentences.chinese: 精密工程

sentences.english: precision bombing
sentences.chinese: 精确轰炸

detailed_translations.chinese: 精度，[数] 精密度；精确
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very exact or correct
made or done in a very exact way

name: problematic
trans: adj. 问题的；有疑问的；不确定的

sentences.english: The reforms could turn out to be highly problematic .
sentences.chinese: 改革最终可能会困难重重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 问题的；有疑问的；不确定的
detailed_translations.english: involving problems and difficult to deal with

name: mechanism
trans: n. 机制；原理，途径；进程；机械装置；技巧

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

name: qualification
trans: n. 资格；条件；限制；赋予资格

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: greenhouse
trans: n. 温室

sentences.english: What we are seeking, after all, is not simply an agreement to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在寻求的目标毕竟不只是一项限制温室气体排放的协议。

sentences.english: I think each and every one of us is responsible for the greenhouse gases we emit in our daily actions and choices.
sentences.chinese: 我认为每一个人都是我们每天的行动和选择中排放的温室气体的责任。

sentences.english: But presently it was set in a greenhouse, where the sunlight fell warm upon it, and water was sprinkled over it, and day by day as it waited, a change began to come to it.
sentences.chinese: 但是过了不久，黏土又给人放进了一间温室，这里阳光和煦地照射着它，并且经常给它喷水，这样就在它一天天静静等候的时候，某种变化终于开始到来。

detailed_translations.english: a glass building used for growing plants that need warmth, light, and protection

name: flame
trans: n. 火焰；热情；光辉

sentences.english: Flames poured out of the windows of the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰从大楼窗口冒出来。

sentences.english: They rushed past us with buckets of water and tried to douse the flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们提着一桶桶水跑过我们身边去灭火。

sentences.english: They sat around the campfire, watching the flickering flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们围坐在篝火旁，看着跳动的火焰。

sentences.english: Flames quickly engulfed the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰很快吞噬了大楼。

sentences.english: a candle flame
sentences.chinese: 烛焰

detailed_translations.english: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire
to burn brightly

name: admission
trans: n. 承认；入场费；进入许可；坦白；录用

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

name: synthesis
trans: n. 综合，[化学] 合成；综合体

sentences.english: a synthesis of Eastern and Western philosophical ideas
sentences.chinese: 东西方哲学思想的结合

sentences.english: the synthesis of proteins
sentences.chinese: 蛋白质的合成

sentences.english: speech synthesis software
sentences.chinese: 语音合成软件

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合，综合物；（化学或生物学物质的）合成；（用电子方式对声音、语音或音乐的）合成
detailed_translations.english: something that has been made by combining different things, or the process of combining things

name: institutionalize
trans: vt. 使…制度化

sentences.english: the struggle to institutionalize equality for women
sentences.chinese: 使妇女平等制度化的斗争

detailed_translations.english: to make something a normal, accepted part of a social system or organization

name: badminton
trans: n. 羽毛球

sentences.english: Can I try you new badminton racket?
sentences.chinese: 我可以试用你的羽毛球拍吗？

sentences.english: I like playing basketball and  badminton.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢的篮球和羽毛球。

sentences.english: My friend and I take part in sports like tennis,badminton and swimming.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的朋友参加体育运动如打网球,羽毛球和游泳.

detailed_translations.english: a game that is similar to tennis but played with a  shuttlecock (=  small feathered object  )  instead of a ball

name: decrease
trans: n. 减少，减小；减少量

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

name: principle
trans: n. 原理，原则；主义，道义；本质，本义；根源，源泉

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: fundamental
trans: n. 基本原理；基本原则

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: british
trans: Not Found

name: brilliant
trans: adj. 灿烂的，闪耀的；杰出的；有才气的；精彩的，绝妙的

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

name: inclination
trans: n. 倾向，爱好；斜坡

sentences.english: My natural inclination was to say no.
sentences.chinese: 我生性爱说“不”。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that makes you want to do something

name: minimize
trans: vt. 使减到最少；小看，极度轻视

sentences.english: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.english: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

name: afford
trans: vt. 给予，提供；买得起

sentences.english: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们再也不能等下去了，否则会赶不上飞机的。

sentences.english: The room affords a beautiful view over the city.
sentences.chinese: 这房间可以俯瞰城市美景。

sentences.english: The new law will afford protection to employees.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将为雇员提供保障。

detailed_translations.english: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you

name: model
trans: n. 模型；典型；模范；模特儿；样式

sentences.english: a working model (= one with parts which move ) of a steam engine
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

sentences.english: a top fashion model
sentences.chinese: 顶级时装模特

detailed_translations.english: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

name: direction
trans: n. 方向；指导；趋势；用法说明

sentences.english: Which direction did they go in ?
sentences.chinese: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

sentences.english: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
sentences.chinese: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

sentences.english: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
sentences.chinese: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

detailed_translations.english: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed

name: conservative
trans: n. 保守派，守旧者

sentences.english: a very conservative attitude to education
sentences.chinese: 对待教育非常守旧的态度

sentences.english: conservative views
sentences.chinese: 保守的观点

sentences.english: an argument between reformers and conservatives in the organization
sentences.chinese: 该组织内部的改革派和保守派之争

detailed_translations.english: not liking changes or new ideas
someone who does not like changes in politics, ideas, or fashion

name: immature
trans: adj. 不成熟的；未成熟的；粗糙的

sentences.english: He forgave his son’s immature behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他原谅了儿子的幼稚行为。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不成熟的, 未完全发展的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is immature behaves or thinks in a way that is typical of someone much younger – used to show disapproval

name: mammal
trans: n. [脊椎] 哺乳动物

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: incompatible
trans: n. 互不相容的人或事物

sentences.english: Politeness and truth are often mutually incompatible.
sentences.chinese: 礼貌和实话往往互不相容。

sentences.english: Business interests are incompatible with public office.
sentences.chinese: 商业利益与公职不可兼得。

detailed_translations.english: two things that are incompatible cannot exist or be accepted together

name: pressurize
trans: vt. 密封；增压；使……加压，使……压入

sentences.english: After pinpointing their location via satellite tracker, rescue crews drilled a narrow hole down into the shaft, pumping in air to pressurize the chamber and keep the water at bay.
sentences.chinese: 在通过卫星追踪器确定了矿工们在地下所处位置后，救援人员钻开了一个窄洞，然后泵入空气进行增压将水阻挡住；

detailed_translations.english: to increase the pressure in (an enclosure, such as an aircraft cabin) in order to maintain approximately atmospheric pressure when the external pressure is low

name: handwrite
trans: vt. <古>用手写，亲手写

name: length
trans: n. 长度，长；时间的长短；（语）音长

sentences.english: We measured the length and width of the living room.
sentences.chinese: 我们量了客厅的长和宽。

sentences.english: You’ll need several pieces of string of different lengths.
sentences.chinese: 你需要几根长度不等的绳子。

sentences.english: a length of rope/pipe/wire etc
sentences.chinese: 一段绳子/管子/电线等

detailed_translations.english: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other

name: opposition
trans: n. 反对；反对派；在野党；敌对

sentences.english: He is confident in his ability to overcome all opposition with his personal charm.
sentences.chinese: 他自信有能力以个人魅力来化解一切反对力量。

sentences.english: The proposals have aroused the opposition of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 这些建议引起了教师们的反对。

sentences.english: Strong opposition resulted in rejection of the bill.
sentences.chinese: 在强烈反对下这项议案遭到否决。

sentences.english: Plans to turn the site into a £600 million leisure complex have met with stiff opposition.
sentences.chinese: 将该处改造成造价六亿英镑的综合性休闲大楼的计划遭到了激烈的反对。

sentences.english: Much public opposition to the new law remained.
sentences.chinese: 公众对这项新法律仍存在普遍的反对情绪。

sentences.english: Workers found themselves in opposition to local interests.
sentences.chinese: 工人们发现自己与当地人的利益存在冲突。

detailed_translations.english: strong disagreement with, or protest against, something such as a plan, law, or system

name: insinuate
trans: vt. 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入

sentences.english: What are you trying to insinuate?
sentences.chinese: 你想暗示什么？

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入
detailed_translations.english: to say something which seems to mean something unpleasant without saying it openly, especially suggesting that someone is being dishonest

name: sail
trans: n. 帆，篷；航行

sentences.english: a yacht with white sails
sentences.chinese: 扬着白帆的游艇

sentences.english: The trawler had sailed from the port of Zeebrugge.
sentences.chinese: 那只拖网渔船已经从泽布吕赫港启航。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of strong cloth fixed onto a boat, so that the wind will push the boat along
to travel on or across an area of water in a boat or ship

name: impression
trans: n. 印象；效果，影响；压痕，印记；感想；曝光（衡量广告被显示的次数。打开一个带有该广告的网页，则该广告的impression 次数增加一次）

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

name: logarithmic
trans: Not Found

name: urgency
trans: n. 紧急；催促；紧急的事

sentences.english: In case of urgency, call the police.
sentences.chinese: 一旦发生紧急情况，打电话给警察。

sentences.english: I appreciate the sense of urgency because I feel it myself.
sentences.chinese: 我欣赏这种紧迫的感觉因为我自己就能体会到。

sentences.english: However pressing the need and urgency of the problem one should not proceed without a plausible plan.
sentences.chinese: 无论需要多么紧迫，问题多么紧急，一个人不能没有看似有理的计划就开始行动。

name: strategy
trans: n. 战略，策略

sentences.english: the government’s long-term economic strategy
sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

name: solicitous
trans: adj. 热切期望的；热心的；挂念的

sentences.english: He was so solicitous of his guests.
sentences.chinese: 他是如此挂念自己的客人们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热切期望的；热心的；挂念的
detailed_translations.english: very concerned about someone’s safety, health, or comfort

name: candidate
trans: n. 候选人，候补者；应试者

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

name: hillside
trans: n. 山坡，山腹；山腰

sentences.english: The airplane crashed on a hillside.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在山坡上坠毁。

sentences.english: They are quarrying the hillside for marble.
sentences.chinese: 他们正从山坡上采大理石。

sentences.english: They sat and had their lunch on a grassy hillside.
sentences.chinese: 他们坐在长满草的山坡上吃午饭。

detailed_translations.english: the sloping side of a hill

name: lawn
trans: n. 草地；草坪

sentences.english: I spent all morning mowing the lawn (= cutting the grass ).
sentences.chinese: 我整个上午都在修剪草坪。

sentences.english: a carefully tended lawn
sentences.chinese: 受到细心呵护的草坪

detailed_translations.english: an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass

name: acknowledge
trans: vt. 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到

sentences.english: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.english: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter.
sentences.chinese: 收到此信后请告知，不胜感谢。

detailed_translations.english: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

name: survey
trans: n. 调查；测量；审视；纵览

sentences.english: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
sentences.chinese: 被调查的 100 家公司中，10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

sentences.english: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。

sentences.english: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

sentences.english: a geological survey
sentences.chinese: 地质勘察

detailed_translations.english: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

name: independence
trans: n. 独立性，自立性；自主

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: mail
trans: n. 邮件；邮政，邮递；盔甲

sentences.english: You shouldn’t read other people’s mail.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该看别人的信件。

sentences.english: He found a mountain of mail waiting for him.
sentences.chinese: 他发现有堆积如山的邮件等着他处理。

sentences.english: She promised to forward my mail to my new address (= send it from your old home or office to your new one ) .
sentences.chinese: 她答应把我的邮件转寄到我的新地址。

sentences.english: He gets sacks of fan mail (= letters from people who admire him ) .
sentences.chinese: 他收到成堆仰慕者的来信。

sentences.english: The weekly newsletter is mailed to women all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 每周一期的简报邮寄给全国各地的妇女。

detailed_translations.english: the letters and packages that are delivered to you
to send a letter or package to someone

name: specify
trans: vt. 指定；详细说明；列举；把…列入说明书

sentences.english: Payments will be made for a specified number of months.
sentences.chinese: 款项将在规定的几个月内支付。

sentences.english: They specified a spacious entrance hall.
sentences.chinese: 他们明确要求门厅要宽敞。

detailed_translations.english: to state something in an exact and detailed way

name: physicist
trans: n. 物理学家；唯物论者

sentences.english: a nuclear physicist
sentences.chinese: 一位核物理学家

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who has special knowledge and training in physics

name: anatomy
trans: n. 解剖；解剖学；剖析；骨骼

sentences.english: a professor of anatomy
sentences.chinese: 解剖学教授

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies

name: sweater
trans: n. 毛线衣，运动衫；大量出汗的人，发汗剂

sentences.english: Somebody pinched my sweater.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的运动衫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 毛线衣，运动衫；大量出汗的人，发汗剂
detailed_translations.english: a piece of warm wool or cotton clothing with long sleeves, which covers the top half of your body

name: deft
trans: adj. 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的

sentences.english: He sketched her with quick, deft strokes.
sentences.chinese: 他给她画素描，下笔又快又熟练。

sentences.english: deft footwork
sentences.chinese: 敏捷的步法

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵巧的；机敏的；敏捷熟练的
detailed_translations.english: a deft movement is skilful, and often quick

name: expand
trans: vt. 扩张；使膨胀；详述

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: prove
trans: vi. 证明是

sentences.english: You’re wrong, and I can prove it.
sentences.chinese: 你错了，我可以证明。

sentences.english: To prove his point (= show that he was right ) , he mentioned several other experiments which had produced similar results.
sentences.chinese: 为了证明自己的观点，他提到了另外几个结果相似的实验。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc

name: labour
trans: n. （英国）工党

sentences.english: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

sentences.english: Many women do hard manual labour(= work with their hands ).
sentences.chinese: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。

sentences.english: Workers withdrew their labour (= protested by stopping work ) for twenty-four hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人罢工24小时。

sentences.english: a shortage of skilled labor
sentences.chinese: 熟练工人短缺

detailed_translations.english: work, especially physical work

name: opponent
trans: n. 对手；反对者；敌手

sentences.english: She bowled out her opponent.
sentences.chinese: 她打败了她的对手。

sentences.english: The soldier jabbed at his opponent.
sentences.chinese: 那个战士猛击他的对手。

sentences.english: He avowed himself an opponent of all alliances.
sentences.chinese: 他声称他是所有联盟的反对者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument

name: moderation
trans: n. 适度；节制；温和；缓和

sentences.english: Some people think drinking in moderation can prevent heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为适量饮酒可以预防心脏病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 温和， 中庸； 适度， 合理

name: take off
trans: v. (飞机)起飞；出去；拿掉；移送

sentences.english: We eventually took off at 11 o'clock and arrived in Juneau at 1:30.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于在11点起飞，1:30到达朱诺。

sentences.english: He took off at once and headed back to the motel.
sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地立刻就离开了，然后回到了那家汽车旅馆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 中文释义:（飞机等）起飞；匆忙离开
detailed_translations.english: When an aeroplane takes off, it leaves the ground and starts flying

name: futile
trans: adj. 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的

sentences.english: My efforts to go back to sleep proved futile.
sentences.chinese: 我努力想再次入睡，但怎么也睡不着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
detailed_translations.english: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

name: performance
trans: n. 性能；绩效；表演；执行；表现

sentences.english: This evening’s performance will begin at 8.00 pm.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的演出8点开始。

sentences.english: the performance of his official duties
sentences.chinese: 履行他的职务

sentences.english: Sean’s performance at school has greatly improved.
sentences.chinese: 肖恩在学校的表现进步很大。

detailed_translations.english: when someone performs a play or a piece of music

name: slender
trans: adj. 细长的；苗条的；微薄的

sentences.english: She is slender and stylish.
sentences.chinese: 她身材修长，穿着时髦。

sentences.english: The company only has a slender hope of survival.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司维持下去的希望很渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: thin in an attractive or graceful way

name: insensible
trans: adj. 昏迷的；无知觉的；麻木不仁的

sentences.english: He fell to the ground, insensible.
sentences.chinese: 他跌倒在地，失去了知觉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏迷的；无知觉的；麻木不仁的
detailed_translations.english: unable to feel something or be affected by it

name: unconventional
trans: adj. 非常规的；非传统的；不依惯例的

sentences.english: Linus Pauling is an unconventional genius.
sentences.chinese: 莱纳斯·鲍林是个奇才。

sentences.english: He was known for his unconventional behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他曾因另类行为而出名。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非传统的, 不合惯例的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their attitude or behaviour as unconventional, you mean that they do not behave in the same way as most other people in their society

name: speculative
trans: adj. 投机的；推测的；思索性的

sentences.english: speculative investments
sentences.chinese: 投机性的投资

detailed_translations.chinese: 投机的；推测的；思索性的
detailed_translations.english: based on guessing, not on information or facts

name: cheerful
trans: adj. 快乐的；愉快的；高兴的

sentences.english: a bright cheerful Italian restaurant
sentences.chinese: 一家明亮宜人的意大利餐馆

sentences.english: There was a cheerful picture on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 墙上有一张赏心悦目的画。

sentences.english: The house has a cheerful atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子有一种令人愉快的气氛。

detailed_translations.english: something that is cheerful makes you feel happy because it is so bright or pleasant

name: droplet
trans: n. 小滴，微滴

sentences.english: Droplets of sweat were welling up on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 一颗颗小汗珠从他额头上不断冒出来。

detailed_translations.english: a very small drop of liquid

name: negotiation
trans: n. 谈判；转让；顺利的通过

sentences.english: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执。

detailed_translations.english: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: experiment
trans: n. 实验，试验；尝试

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

name: conscious
trans: adj. 意识到的；故意的；神志清醒的

sentences.english: I became conscious of someone watching me.
sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

name: lure
trans: n. 诱惑；饵；诱惑物

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
detailed_translations.english: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

name: publish
trans: vi. 出版；发行；刊印

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

name: irrational
trans: n. [数] 无理数

sentences.english: an irrational fear of flying
sentences.chinese: 对飞行非理性的恐惧

sentences.english: He’s becoming increasingly irrational.
sentences.chinese: 他变得越来越不可理喻了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不合理的；无理性的；荒谬的
detailed_translations.english: not based on clear thought or reason

name: analogy
trans: n. 类比；类推；类似

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

name: confuse
trans: vt. 使混乱；使困惑

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

name: bunch
trans: n. 群；串；突出物

sentences.english: She bunched the cloth up and threw it away.
sentences.chinese: 她把布揉成一团扔了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中， 挤在一起； 形成一束
detailed_translations.english: to pull material together tightly in folds
a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together
to hold or tie things together in a bunch

name: climb
trans: n. 爬；攀登

sentences.english: Harry climbed the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 哈里爬上楼梯。

sentences.english: Boys were climbing trees along the river bank.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在河边爬树。

detailed_translations.english: to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do
to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do

name: loose
trans: adj. 宽松的；散漫的；不牢固的；不精确的

sentences.english: a loose floorboard
sentences.chinese: 松动的地板

sentences.english: This tooth feels very loose.
sentences.chinese: 这颗牙感觉松动得厉害。

sentences.english: The screw has come loose (= become loose ) .
sentences.chinese: 螺丝松了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽松的；散漫的；不牢固的；不精确的
detailed_translations.english: not firmly fastened in place
to make something unpleasant begin

name: acute
trans: adj. 严重的，[医] 急性的；敏锐的；激烈的；尖声的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: militancy
trans: n. 战斗性；交战状态

sentences.english: But the army says militancy is down to a “subcritical” level.
sentences.chinese: 但是军队称交战状态已经降到“临界点以下”的等级。

name: tentative
trans: n. 假设，试验

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

name: weed
trans: n. 杂草，野草；菸草

sentences.english: the constant battle against weeds
sentences.chinese: 对付杂草的长期斗争

sentences.english: I've been weeding the flower beds.
sentences.chinese: 我一直在除花坛里的杂草。

detailed_translations.english: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly
to remove unwanted plants from a garden or other place

name: isolation
trans: n. 隔离；孤立；[电] 绝缘；[化学] 离析

sentences.english: Because of its geographical isolation, the area developed its own unique culture.
sentences.chinese: 由于地理上的隔绝，该地区发展了自己独特的文化。

sentences.english: The mansion sits in splendid isolation on top of the hill (= it is far from everything and looks impressive ).
sentences.chinese: 宅邸位于山顶，远离尘嚣。

sentences.english: a patient’s isolation period
sentences.chinese: 病人的隔离期

detailed_translations.english: when one group, person, or thing is separate from others

name: impend
trans: vi. 迫近；即将发生

sentences.english: This very recklessness makes me feel that these costly operations may be only the prelude to far larger events which impend on land.
sentences.chinese: 这种孤注一掷的作法，使我感到这些代价重大的战役，也许正是陆上即将发生。

detailed_translations.english: (esp of something threatening) to be about to happen; be imminent

name: directory
trans: n. [计] 目录；工商名录；姓名地址录

sentences.english: I couldn’t find your number in the telephone directory.
sentences.chinese: 我在电话簿上找不到你的电话号码。

sentences.english: a new business directory
sentences.chinese: 新的商业名录

detailed_translations.english: a book or list of names, facts etc, usually arranged in alphabetical order

name: supermarket
trans: n. 超级市场；自助售货商店

sentences.english: His eyes roved round the supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼睛环视了一下超级市场。

sentences.english: The whole supermarket was ruined in a great fire.
sentences.chinese: 整个超级市场被一场大火烧掉。

sentences.english: The supermarket near our school will be reopened soon.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校附近的那个超级市场不久将重新开业。

detailed_translations.english: a very large shop that sells food, drinks, and things that people need regularly in their homes

name: garrulous
trans: adj. 唠叨的；喋喋不休的；多嘴的

sentences.english: Ian isn’t normally this garrulous!
sentences.chinese: 伊恩一般不这么唠叨！

detailed_translations.chinese: 唠叨的；喋喋不休的；多嘴的
detailed_translations.english: always talking a lot

name: cooperation
trans: n. 合作，协作；[劳经] 协力

sentences.english: the need to strengthen international co-operation
sentences.chinese: 加强国际合作的需要

detailed_translations.english: when you work with someone to achieve something that you both want

name: rid
trans: vt. 使摆脱；使去掉

sentences.english: a promise to rid the country of nuclear weapons
sentences.chinese: 销毁本国核武器的承诺

detailed_translations.english: to take action so that a person, place etc is no longer affected by something bad or no longer has it

name: remark
trans: n. 注意；言辞

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: particle
trans: n. 颗粒；[物] 质点；极小量；小品词

sentences.english: dust particles
sentences.chinese: 尘埃

sentences.english: the sub-atomic particles that make up matter
sentences.chinese: 构成物质的次原子微粒

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of something

name: usage
trans: n. 使用；用法；惯例

sentences.english: land usage
sentences.chinese: 土地的利用

sentences.english: a book on modern English usage
sentences.chinese: 关于现代英语用法的书

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which something is used or the way in which it is used

name: maintenance
trans: n. 维护，维修；保持；生活费用

sentences.english: the cost of repairs and maintenance
sentences.chinese: 维修保养费

sentences.english: The theatres were closed on Saturday and Sunday for routine maintenance .
sentences.chinese: 戏院周六和周日关闭进行例行维护。

sentences.english: Engineers are carrying out essential maintenance work on the main line to Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 机修工正在对通往剑桥的干线进行必要的养护。

sentences.english: an evening class in car maintenance
sentences.chinese: 汽车保养的夜校课程

detailed_translations.chinese: 维持； 保养； 抚养费
detailed_translations.english: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

name: soul
trans: n. 灵魂；心灵；精神；鬼魂

sentences.english: the immortality of the soul
sentences.chinese: 灵魂的不灭

sentences.english: It was as if those grey eyes could see into the very depths of her soul .
sentences.chinese: 仿佛那双灰眼睛能看到她的灵魂深处。

sentences.english: the souls of the dead
sentences.chinese: 亡灵

detailed_translations.english: the part of a person that is not physical, and that contains their character, thoughts, and feelings. Many people believe that a person’s soul continues to exist after they have died.

name: graphic
trans: adj. 形象的；图表的；绘画似的

sentences.english: ...fine and graphic arts.
sentences.chinese: …美术与制图艺术。

detailed_translations.chinese: 生动的， 形象的； 绘画的， 文字的， 图表的
detailed_translations.english: Graphic means concerned with drawing or pictures, especially in publishing, industry, or computing

name: museum
trans: n. 博物馆

sentences.english: the Museum of Modern Art
sentences.chinese: 现代艺术博物馆

sentences.english: The museum has an extensive collection of early photographs.
sentences.chinese: 这座博物馆藏有大量早期的照片。

detailed_translations.english: a building where important  cultural, historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public

name: bread
trans: n. 面包；生计

sentences.english: Would you like some bread with your soup?
sentences.chinese: 你喝汤时要吃点面包吗？

sentences.english: a loaf of brown bread
sentences.chinese: 一条黑面包

sentences.english: a piece of bread and butter
sentences.chinese: 一块黄油面包

detailed_translations.english: a type of food made from flour and water that is mixed together and then baked

name: keep a low profile
trans: Not Found

name: straight
trans: n. 直；直线；直男，直女，异性恋者

sentences.english: a long, straight road
sentences.chinese: 一条笔直的长路

sentences.english: Try to keep your legs straight.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把腿伸直。

sentences.english: Always lift with a straight back.
sentences.chinese: 提东西的时候，一定要把背挺直。

sentences.english: her long, straight black hair
sentences.chinese: 她又长又直的黑发

sentences.english: They sat down in a straight line .
sentences.chinese: 他们坐成一直溜儿。

sentences.english: The road was dead straight (= completely straight ) .
sentences.chinese: 那条路是笔直的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直的；连续的；笔直的；正直的；整齐的；异性恋的
detailed_translations.english: something that is straight does not bend or curve

detailed_translations.chinese: 直接地；不断地；立即；坦率地
detailed_translations.english: in a level or correct position

detailed_translations.chinese: 直；直线；直男，直女，异性恋者
detailed_translations.english: the straight part of a  racetrack

name: average
trans: n. 平均；平均数；海损

sentences.english: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
sentences.chinese: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。

sentences.english: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
sentences.chinese: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

detailed_translations.english: having qualities that are typical of most people or things

name: phonograph
trans: n. 留声机；[电子] 电唱机

sentences.english: Edison is credited with the invention of the phonograph.
sentences.chinese: 留声机的发明应归功于爱迪生。

sentences.english: American inventor Thomas Edison, who was considered the father of sound recording, developed the phonograph in 1877, the first device to record music in the world.
sentences.chinese: 被誉为录音之父的美国发明家托马斯·爱迪生于1877年发明了留声机，这是世界上第一台录音设备。

detailed_translations.english: a  record player

name: equation
trans: n. 方程式，等式；相等；[化学] 反应式

sentences.english: When children enter the equation , further tensions may arise within a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

name: passive
trans: n. 被动语态

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: satiate
trans: adj. 饱足的；厌腻的

sentences.english: The dinner was enough to satiate the gourmets.
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭足够让美食家们吃个够。

detailed_translations.english: to satisfy a desire or need for something such as food or sex, especially so that you feel you have had too much

name: confusion
trans: n. 混淆，混乱；困惑

sentences.english: a scene of indescribable confusion
sentences.chinese: 难以形容的混乱场面

sentences.english: To avoid confusion, the teams wore different colours.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免混淆，各队穿着不同颜色的服装。

detailed_translations.english: a very confusing situation, that usually has a lot of noise and action, so that it is difficult for someone to understand it or control it

name: fragile
trans: adj. 脆的；易碎的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: inherent
trans: adj. 固有的；内在的；与生俱来的，遗传的

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

name: platitude
trans: n. 陈词滥调；平凡；陈腐

sentences.english: His excuse was the platitude ‘boys will be boys.’
sentences.chinese: 他还是那一套理由:“男孩总归是男孩。”

detailed_translations.english: a statement that has been made many times before and is not interesting or clever – used to show disapproval

name: overdraft
trans: n. [金融] 透支；[金融] 透支额

sentences.english: a £250 overdraft
sentences.chinese: 250英镑的透支额

sentences.english: Many students have a free overdraft facility (= agreement with their bank to have an overdraft up to a particular limit ).
sentences.chinese: 许多学生都能享受免费透支服务。

detailed_translations.chinese: [金融] 透支；[金融] 透支额
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money you owe to a bank when you have spent more money than you had in your account

name: collapse
trans: n. 倒塌；失败；衰竭

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: rapidly
trans: adv. 迅速地；很快地；立即

sentences.english: The disease was spreading more rapidly than expected.
sentences.chinese: 疾病的蔓延比预期的要快。

detailed_translations.english: very quickly and in a very short time

name: target
trans: n. 目标；靶子

sentences.english: There is no target date for completion of the new project.
sentences.chinese: 这个新的项目何时完工没有预定日期。

sentences.english: The government may fail to meet (= achieve ) its target of recycling 25% of domestic waste.
sentences.chinese: 政府可能达不到回收利用25%的生活垃圾的目标。

sentences.english: Jiang set annual growth targets of 8–9%.
sentences.chinese: 江确定了8%至9%的年增长目标。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying to achieve, such as a total, an amount, or a time
to make something have an effect on a particular limited group or area

name: encourage
trans: vt. 鼓励，怂恿；激励；支持

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: carbon dioxide
trans: n. 二氧化碳

sentences.english: How much carbon dioxide you save, if any, depends on how far you live from work and how you get there, among other things.
sentences.chinese: 如果真有的话，你可以节约多少二氧化碳？ 它取决于你住得有多远还是你如何完成目标抑或其他因素？

sentences.english: And then we have gas cooled reactors which can use supercritical carbon dioxide or helium.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们有气体冷却反应堆,那能使用超临界二氧化碳或者氦。

sentences.english: But as Solomon and colleagues suggest in a new study published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, it is not true for the most abundant greenhouse gas: carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 但是，正如所罗门和他的同事提出的一项发表在《美国国家科学院院刊》的新研究表明，对最丰富的温室气体，二氧化碳，这是不正确的。

detailed_translations.english: the gas produced when animals breathe out, when carbon is burned in air, or when animal or vegetable substances decay

name: parrot
trans: n. 鹦鹉；学舌者，应声虫；机械模仿别人的人

sentences.english: We recited poems parrot fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我们鹦鹉学舌般机械地背诵诗歌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鹦鹉；学舌者，应声虫；机械模仿别人的人
detailed_translations.english: a tropical bird with a curved beak and brightly coloured feathers that can be taught to copy human speech

name: escape
trans: n. 逃跑；逃亡；逃走；逃跑工具或方法；野生种；泄漏

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: install
trans: vt. 安装；任命；安顿

sentences.english: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

name: spectacle
trans: n. 景象；场面；奇观；壮观；公开展示；表相，假相 n.（复）眼镜

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

name: glimpse
trans: n. 一瞥，一看

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

name: whimsical
trans: adj. 古怪的；异想天开的；反复无常的

sentences.english: He has a wonderful whimsical sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 他怪异的幽默感令人惊叹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的；异想天开的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: unusual or strange and often amusing

name: Tokyo
trans: n. 东京（日本首都）

sentences.english: Her flight will be rerouted via Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 她乘坐的航班将改变航线途经东京。

sentences.english: They are going from Shanghai to Los Angeles via Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 他们从上海经东京去洛杉矶。

sentences.english: On my way to New York, I stopped over in Tokyo for two days.
sentences.chinese: 我在去纽约的途中在东京停了两天。

name: inflation
trans: n. 膨胀；通货膨胀；夸张；自命不凡

sentences.english: Inflation is now at over 16%.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率现已超过16%。

detailed_translations.english: a continuing increase in prices, or the rate at which prices increase

name: impulse
trans: n. 冲动；[电子] 脉冲；刺激；神经冲动；推动力

sentences.english: a sudden impulse to laugh
sentences.chinese: 突然想笑的冲动

sentences.english: It is the passions which provide the main impulse of music.
sentences.chinese: 激情是音乐创作的主要动力。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

name: renovation
trans: n. 革新；修理；恢复活力

sentences.english: It often results in lower renovation, cleaning and maintenance costs, too.
sentences.chinese: 它通常还导致较低的翻新、清洁和保养维修费用。

sentences.english: For novice friends, we do not know how much the specific renovation costs?
sentences.chinese: 对于新手朋友来说，大家都不了解具体装修费用是多少？

name: presume
trans: vi. 相信；擅自行为

sentences.english: They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务怨恨不已。

sentences.english: I presume you're here on business.
sentences.chinese: 我想你是来这儿出差的吧。

sentences.english: "Had he been home all week?"—"I presume so."
sentences.chinese: “他整个星期都在家吗？”—“我想是。”

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it

detailed_translations.chinese: 推测，假定，相信；冒昧，擅自；认定，推定
detailed_translations.english: If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain

name: knowledge
trans: n. 知识，学问；知道，认识；学科

sentences.english: He did not have much knowledge of American history.
sentences.chinese: 他对美国历史所知不多。

sentences.english: Evans denied all knowledge of the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯说他对这次抢劫一无所知。

detailed_translations.english: the information, skills, and understanding that you have gained through learning or experience

name: priority
trans: n. 优先；优先权；[数] 优先次序；优先考虑的事

sentences.english: The club’s priority is to win the League.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

sentences.english: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (= very important and needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后，治安成了当务之急。

sentences.english: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (= not important and not needing attention soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 可用的钱这么少，只好暂时放下维修事宜了。

sentences.english: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
sentences.chinese: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。

sentences.english: List your tasks in order of priority (= most important first ) .
sentences.chinese: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

name: torturous
trans: adj. 折磨人的，痛苦的

sentences.english: a torturous five days of fitness testing
sentences.chinese: 五天痛苦的体能测试

detailed_translations.english: very painful or unpleasant to experience

name: stamp
trans: n. 邮票；印记；标志；跺脚

sentences.english: a 29-cent stamp
sentences.chinese: 一枚 29 美分的邮票

sentences.english: Richard collects stamps.
sentences.chinese: 理查德集邮。

sentences.english: a second-class stamp
sentences.chinese: 一张二类邮件的邮票

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of paper that you buy and stick onto an envelope or package before posting it

detailed_translations.chinese: 铭记；标出；盖章于…；贴邮票于…；用脚踩踏
detailed_translations.english: to put your foot down onto the ground loudly and with a lot of force

name: colorful
trans: adj. 华美的；有趣的；富有色彩的

sentences.english: I hope my life to be colorful and valuable.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的生活是丰富多彩的和有价值的。

sentences.english: And he often finds his life so colorful and interesting as he overcomes all the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他经常觉得他的生活是丰富多彩和有趣的，因为他克服了所有的困难。

sentences.english: Because of her hard working, her garden was so colorful.
sentences.chinese: 因为她的努力，她的花园是如此的丰富多彩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有色彩的； 有趣的

name: zealot
trans: n. 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒

sentences.english: religious zealots
sentences.chinese: 宗教狂热分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 狂热者；犹太教狂热信徒
detailed_translations.english: someone who has extremely strong beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, and is too eager to make other people share them

name: microbe
trans: n. 细菌，微生物

sentences.english: ...a type of bacteria that include the microbes responsible for tuberculosis and leprosy.
sentences.chinese: …包括引起结核病和麻风病的微生物在内的一类细菌。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.

name: homogeneous
trans: adj. 均匀的；[数] 齐次的；同种的；同类的，同质的

sentences.english: a homogeneous society
sentences.chinese: 同种族人组成的社会

detailed_translations.english: consisting of people or things that are all of the same type

name: traumatic
trans: adj. （生理）外伤的

name: appropriate
trans: adj. 适当的；恰当的；合适的

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: insomnia
trans: n. 失眠症，失眠

sentences.english: If you have insomnia, try my simple cure.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有失眠症，试试我的简单疗法。

sentences.english: In my insomnia, you have to hold me to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在我失眠的时候，你要抱着我睡。

sentences.english: I know someone with insomnia who only gets two hours of sleep each night.
sentences.chinese: 我认识一个患有失眠症的人，他每天晚上只能睡上两个小时。

detailed_translations.english: if you suffer from insomnia, you are not able to sleep

name: guide
trans: n. 指南；向导；入门书

sentences.english: a tour guide
sentences.chinese: 导游

sentences.english: an experienced mountain guide
sentences.chinese: 一位有经验的登山向导

sentences.english: We were guided around the museums.
sentences.chinese: 我们在导游的带领下参观了博物馆。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to take tourists to a place and show them around
to show sb the way to a place, often by going with them

name: pick
trans: n. 选择；鹤嘴锄；挖；掩护

sentences.english: The Roman Swiss Army knife has a knife, spoon, fork, spike, spatula, and small pick.
sentences.chinese: 这种古罗马瑞士军刀包含了刀，勺，叉，长钉，抹刀和小鹤嘴锄。

detailed_translations.english: a  pickaxe

name: abstract
trans: n. 摘要；抽象；抽象的概念

sentences.english: By the age of seven, children are capable of thinking in abstract terms .
sentences.chinese: 儿童到了七岁就具有抽象思维的能力。

sentences.english: Human beings are the only creatures capable of abstract thought (=  thinking about ideas  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人类是唯一具有抽象思维能力的动物。

detailed_translations.english: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要，梗概；抽象派艺术作品
detailed_translations.english: a painting, design etc which contains shapes or images that do not look like real things or people

name: retain
trans: vt. 保持；雇；记住

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

name: similarly
trans: adv. 同样地；类似于

sentences.english: The first letter she wrote me was less than a page long, and her second letter was similarly brief.
sentences.chinese: 她写给我的第一封信不到一页，第二封信也一样简短。

sentences.english: The cost of food and clothing has come down in recent years. Similarly, fuel prices have fallen quite considerably.
sentences.chinese: 吃穿的费用近年来下降了。 同样地，燃料价格也有大幅 回落。

detailed_translations.english: in a similar way

name: behaviour
trans: n. 行为；习性；运行状况（=behavior）

sentences.english: It is important to reward good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 表现好要给予奖励，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the things that a person or animal does

name: riddle
trans: n. 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等

sentences.english: See if you can solve this riddle .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能猜出这个谜语。

detailed_translations.english: to solve, explain, or interpret (a riddle or riddles)

detailed_translations.chinese: 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
detailed_translations.english: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer

name: disabuse
trans: vt. 使省悟；解迷惑；释疑；矫正

sentences.english: Their view of country people was that they like to please strangers. I did not disabuse them of this notion.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为乡下人爱讨好外地人。我没有纠正他们的这种想法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打消错误念头， 使醒悟
detailed_translations.english: If you disabuse someone of something, you tell them or persuade them that what they believe is in fact untrue

name: exacerbate
trans: vt. 使加剧；使恶化；激怒

sentences.english: The recession has exacerbated this problem.
sentences.chinese: 经济衰退使这个问题更加严重。

sentences.english: I don’t want to exacerbate the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不想使情况变得更糟。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation worse

name: jut
trans: vt. 使…伸出；使…突出

sentences.english: Tall jagged rocks jutted out over the beach.
sentences.chinese: 高耸嶙峋的岩石突兀于海滩之上。

detailed_translations.english: something that juts out sticks out further than the other things around it

name: accurate
trans: adj. 精确的

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: personnel
trans: n. 人事部门；全体人员

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

name: apocalyptic
trans: adj. 启示录的；天启的

name: jostle
trans: vt. 推挤，撞；争夺

sentences.english: A thousand thoughts were jostling around inside my mind.
sentences.chinese: 千头万绪在我脑海中翻涌。

detailed_translations.english: to push or knock against someone in a crowd, especially so that you can get somewhere or do something before other people

name: syllabe
trans: n. 音节

name: Wise
trans: Not Found

name: choice
trans: n. 选择；选择权；精选品

sentences.english: I think London was a good choice as a venue.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得伦敦是个很好的选址。

sentences.english: choice steak
sentences.chinese: 上等牛排

detailed_translations.english: the person or thing that someone chooses
(especially of food) of very good quality

name: circumference
trans: n. 圆周；周长；胸围

sentences.english: ...a scientist calculating the Earth's circumference.
sentences.chinese: …一位正在计算地球周长的科学家。

detailed_translations.english: the distance or measurement around the outside of a circle or any round shape

name: pause
trans: n. 暂停；间歇

sentences.english: There was a pause while Alice changed the tape.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯换磁带的时候出现了短暂的停顿。

sentences.english: After a long pause , she went on.
sentences.chinese: 停了好一会儿，她才继续下去。

detailed_translations.english: a short time during which someone stops speaking or doing something before starting again
to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again

name: contain
trans: vi. 含有；自制

sentences.english: The thieves stole a purse containing bank-notes.
sentences.chinese: 小偷们偷到了一个里面有钞票的钱包。

sentences.english: The museum contains a number of original artworks.
sentences.chinese: 这家博物馆藏有一些原创艺术品。

detailed_translations.english: if something such as a bag, box, or place contains something, that thing is inside it

name: check
trans: n. <美>支票；制止，抑制；检验，核对

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: column
trans: n. 纵队，列；专栏；圆柱，柱形物

sentences.english: He writes a weekly column for ‘The Times’.
sentences.chinese: 他每周为《泰晤士报》写一篇专栏文章。

detailed_translations.english: an article on a particular subject or by a particular writer that appears regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: shift work
trans: n. 倒班；轮班

name: aquarium
trans: n. 水族馆；养鱼池；玻璃缸

sentences.english: We saw a ray at the aquarium.
sentences.chinese: 我们在水族馆看见了一只鳐。

sentences.english: In Amsterdam the girls all stand in the windows shimmering as tantalising as tropical fish beyond the gleam of aquarium glass.
sentences.chinese: 在阿姆斯特丹，姑娘们都站在窗后，光芒四射柔情撩人宛如水族馆玻璃背后脉脉含情的热带鱼。

sentences.english: Recently the bakers created an octopus complete with tentacles and suckers for a charity event held for a local aquarium.
sentences.chinese: 最近，面包师为当地水族馆举行的慈善活动制作了这只章鱼，它拥有完整的触手和吸盘。

detailed_translations.english: a clear glass or plastic container for fish and other water animals

name: diffuse
trans: vt. 扩散；传播；漫射

sentences.english: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
sentences.chinese: 污染物渗进了土壤。

sentences.english: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

sentences.english: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

detailed_translations.english: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this
using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly

name: folklore
trans: n. 民俗学；民间传说；民间风俗

sentences.english: In Chinese folklore the bat is a symbol of good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在中国民间传说中，蝙蝠是好运的象征。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民俗学；民间传说；民间风俗
detailed_translations.english: the traditional stories, customs etc of a particular area or country

name: article
trans: n. 文章；物品；条款；[语] 冠词

sentences.english: The paper’s leading article (=  the main article  ) described the government as weak.
sentences.chinese: 该报社论称政府软弱。

sentences.english: newspaper articles
sentences.chinese: 报纸上的文章

sentences.english: household articles
sentences.chinese: 家居用品

sentences.english: Article 1 of the constitution guarantees freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 宪法的第一条保障宗教信仰自由。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine

name: proportion
trans: n. 比例，占比；部分；面积；均衡

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

name: cramp
trans: n. 痉挛，绞痛；[五金] 铁夹钳

sentences.english: Several players were suffering from cramp.
sentences.chinese: 有几名球员抽筋了。

sentences.english: muscle cramps
sentences.chinese: 肌肉痉挛

detailed_translations.chinese: 痉挛，绞痛；[五金] 铁夹钳
detailed_translations.english: a severe pain that you get in part of your body when a muscle becomes too tight, making it difficult for you to move that part of your body

detailed_translations.chinese: 束缚，限制；使…抽筋；以铁箍扣紧
detailed_translations.english: to prevent the development of someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: 狭窄的；难解的；受限制的

name: tournament
trans: n. 锦标赛，联赛；比赛

sentences.english: She is aching to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望参加比赛。

sentences.english: They dropped two games in a row and were eliminated from the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他们在划船比赛中输了两场比赛，并被淘汰出局。

sentences.english: It's no use egging him on; he's made up his mind not to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他已拿定主意不参加比赛了，你再将他也没有用。

name: Speech Recognition
trans: Not Found

name: indicate
trans: vt. 表明；指出；预示；象征

sentences.english: The study indicates a connection between poverty and crime.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示贫穷和犯罪有关联。

detailed_translations.english: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

name: readable
trans: adj. 可读的；易读的；读起来津津有味的

sentences.english: This is a well researched and very readable book.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本研究深刻、可读性强的书。

detailed_translations.english: interesting and enjoyable to read, and easy to understand

name: prosperity
trans: n. 繁荣，成功

sentences.english: a time of economic prosperity
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣时期

detailed_translations.english: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

name: output
trans: n. 输出，输出量；产量；出产

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: ultimate
trans: n. 终极；根本；基本原则

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: perfidious
trans: adj. 背信弃义的；不忠的

sentences.english: Their feet will trample on the dead bodies of their perfidious aggressors.
sentences.chinese: 他们将从背信弃义的侵略者的尸体上踏过。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is perfidious is not loyal and cannot be trusted

name: graduation
trans: n. 毕业；毕业典礼；刻度，分度；分等级

sentences.english: After graduation Neil returned to Ohio.
sentences.chinese: 尼尔毕业以后回到了俄亥俄州。

sentences.english: On graduation (= after completing a first degree ) , Nancy became an art teacher.
sentences.chinese: 南希毕业以后当了一名美术老师。

detailed_translations.chinese: 毕业；毕业典礼；刻度，分度；分等级
detailed_translations.english: the time when you complete a university degree course or your education at an American  high school

name: proper
trans: adj. 适当的；本身的；特有的；正派的

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

name: exigency
trans: n. 紧急；紧急事件

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧急要求， 迫切需要

name: bizarre
trans: adj. 奇异的（指态度，容貌，款式等）

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: intermission
trans: n. 幕间休息；暂停；中断

name: credit
trans: n. 信用，信誉；[金融] 贷款；学分；信任；声望

sentences.english: We found his statement hard to credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们觉得他的说法令人难以信服。

sentences.english: The witness’s story gained credit with the jury.
sentences.chinese: 证人的陈述被陪审团采信了。

detailed_translations.english: to believe that something is true
the belief that something is true or correct

name: beard
trans: n. 胡须；颌毛

sentences.english: He's decided to grow a beard.
sentences.chinese: 他已经决定蓄胡须。

detailed_translations.english: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks

name: postpone
trans: vt. 使…延期；把…放在次要地位；把…放在后面

sentences.english: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.chinese: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.english: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.chinese: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one

name: exploration
trans: n. 探测；探究；踏勘

sentences.english: oil exploration facilities in the North Sea
sentences.chinese: 北海的石油勘探设施

sentences.english: You can then use this hut as a base for explorations into the mountains around.
sentences.chinese: 你到时可以把这间小屋当大本营，去周围的山里探险。

detailed_translations.english: the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or find something such as oil or gold in it

name: nature
trans: n. 自然；性质；本性；种类

sentences.english: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.english: nature conservation
sentences.chinese: 自然保护

sentences.english: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.english: I tried appealing to his better nature (= his feelings of kindness ) but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
sentences.chinese: 我想唤起他的善良本性，但他就是不同意帮助我们。

sentences.english: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
sentences.chinese: 从本质而言，资本主义社会是不稳定的。

detailed_translations.english: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

name: embarrass
trans: vt. 使局促不安；使困窘；阻碍

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

name: nimbus
trans: Not Found

name: phase
trans: n. 月相

sentences.english: a new drug that is in the experimental phase
sentences.chinese: 处于试验阶段的一种新药

sentences.english: It’s just a phase he’s going through.
sentences.chinese: 这只是他要经历的一个阶段。

detailed_translations.english: one of the stages of a process of development or change

name: metabolism
trans: n. [生理] 新陈代谢

sentences.english: This drug speeds up your metabolism.
sentences.chinese: 这种药物会加快你的新陈代谢。

detailed_translations.english: the chemical processes by which food is changed into energy in your body

name: waterfall
trans: n. 瀑布；瀑布似的东西

sentences.english: ...Angel Falls, the world's highest waterfall.
sentences.chinese: …安赫尔瀑布，世界上最高的瀑布。

detailed_translations.english: a place where water from a river or stream falls down over a cliff or rock

name: statement
trans: n. 声明；陈述，叙述；报表，清单

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

name: exclaim
trans: vt. 大声说出

sentences.english: ‘No!’ she exclaimed in shock.
sentences.chinese: “不！”她惊呼道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

name: swim
trans: n. 游泳；漂浮；眩晕

sentences.english: Let’s go swimming this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午我们游泳去吧。

sentences.english: kids learning to swim the backstroke
sentences.chinese: 学习仰泳的孩子们

sentences.english: She was the first woman to swim the Channel.
sentences.chinese: 她是第一个游过英吉利海峡的女性。

detailed_translations.english: to move yourself through water using your arms and legs
a period of time that you spend swimming

name: overfish
trans: vt. 对（鱼、渔场）捕捞过度

sentences.english: But humans can help too, if we just learn to overfish the lionfish.
sentences.chinese: 但只要我们学习过度捕捞的狮子鱼，人类就能够有所帮助。

name: reference
trans: n. 参考，参照；涉及，提及；参考书目；介绍信；证明书

sentences.english: Keep their price list on file for future reference (= so that it can be looked at in the future ) ..
sentences.chinese: 将他们的价目表存档，以供日后参考。

sentences.english: There is no direct reference to her own childhood in the novel.
sentences.chinese: 小说里没有直接提及她自己的童年。

detailed_translations.english: the act of looking at sth for information

name: symbolic
trans: adj. 象征的；符号的；使用符号的

sentences.english: Each element of the ceremony has a symbolic meaning .
sentences.chinese: 仪式的每一个元素都具有象征意义。

detailed_translations.english: a symbolic action is important because of what it represents but may not have any real effect

name: edge
trans: n. 边缘；优势；刀刃；锋利

sentences.english: Put the eggs in the centre of the dish, with the vegetables and herbs around the edge.
sentences.chinese: 把鸡蛋放在盘子中间，盘边一圈放些蔬菜和香草。

sentences.english: He stood at the water’s edge staring across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 他站在水边，凝视着湖对面。

sentences.english: A leaf was on the ground, curling up at the edges.
sentences.chinese: 地上有一片叶子，叶边卷曲着。

sentences.english: a knife with a sharp edge
sentences.chinese: 刀刃锋利的小刀

detailed_translations.english: the part of an object that is furthest from its centre

name: baffle
trans: n. 挡板；困惑

sentences.english: The question baffled me completely.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题把我彻底难倒了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…困惑；使…受挫折；用挡板控制
detailed_translations.english: if something baffles you, you cannot understand or explain it at all

name: lassitude
trans: n. 疲乏；懒散；厌倦

sentences.english: Symptoms of anaemia include general fatigue and lassitude.
sentences.chinese: 贫血症状包括全身疲劳和困乏。

detailed_translations.english: tiredness and lack of energy or interest

name: slave
trans: n. 奴隶；从动装置

sentences.english: a slave to fashion
sentences.chinese: 时尚的奴隶

detailed_translations.english: someone who is owned by another person and works for them for no money
to work very hard with little time to rest

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过多的，极度的；过分的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

name: pursuit
trans: n. 追赶，追求；职业，工作

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: competence
trans: n. 能力，胜任；权限；作证能力；足以过舒适生活的收入

sentences.english: Typing is considered by most employers to be a basic competence.
sentences.chinese: 大多数雇主认为打字是一项基本技能。

detailed_translations.chinese: 能力，胜任；权限；作证能力；足以过舒适生活的收入
detailed_translations.english: the ability to do something well

name: loan
trans: n. 贷款；借款

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

name: auxiliary
trans: n. 助动词；辅助者，辅助物；附属机构

sentences.english: a nursing auxiliary
sentences.chinese: 护理辅助人员

detailed_translations.chinese: 助动词；辅助者，辅助物；附属机构
detailed_translations.english: a worker who provides additional help for another group of workers
auxiliary workers provide additional help for another group of workers

name: transform
trans: vt. 改变，使…变形；转换

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: guru
trans: n. 古鲁（指印度教等宗教的宗师或领袖）；领袖；专家

sentences.english: It's up to us to either ignore the morale booster inside us or go out to the world and search for spiritual guru's and happiness, when all these things are very much present within us.
sentences.chinese: 当我们面临这些问题的时候，我们该决定是否忽略我们内心的道德推动或者接触这个世界来寻找精神领袖和快乐。

sentences.english: Become a trader, bounty hunter, rebel, stock market guru or a deadly space pirate.
sentences.chinese: 成为一个商人，津贴猎人，叛乱者，股票市场领袖或者一名极度的空间盗版者。

name: discover
trans: vi. 发现

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

name: accompany
trans: vt. 陪伴，伴随；伴奏

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: navicular
trans: Not Found

name: hazard
trans: n. 危险，冒险；冒险的事

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

name: odd
trans: adj. 奇数的；古怪的；剩余的；临时的；零散的

sentences.english: It was an odd thing to say.
sentences.chinese: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.english: an odd way to behave
sentences.chinese: 古怪的行为

sentences.english: They’re an odd couple.
sentences.chinese: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.english: There was something odd about him.
sentences.chinese: 他这人有些奇怪。

sentences.english: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

sentences.english: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

detailed_translations.english: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand

name: beneath
trans: prep. 在…之下

sentences.english: The top layer should now point down to the layer beneath.
sentences.chinese: 现在，顶部图层应当有小箭头指向下面的图层。

sentences.english: The fortress on the hill covered the harbour area beneath.
sentences.chinese: 山上的炮楼把下面的海港地区置于射程之内。

sentences.english: They must all be drowning beneath him, in the watery caves of the rock!
sentences.chinese: 他们一定是在他下面的水里，就在那岩石充满了水的洞中游泳了！

detailed_translations.english: in or to a lower position than something, or directly under something

name: aggregate
trans: n. 合计；集合体；总计

sentences.english: Sheila’s earnings from all sources aggregated £100,000.
sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

name: network
trans: n. 网络；广播网；网状物

sentences.english: Hungary’s telephone network
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利的电话网

sentences.english: a high-speed European rail network
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的高速铁路网

sentences.english: the network of blood vessels in the body
sentences.chinese: 人体内的血管网

detailed_translations.english: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

name: cash
trans: n. 现款，现金

sentences.english: Cash was taken during a burglary of the apartment.
sentences.chinese: 在一次公寓盗窃案中现金被盗。

sentences.english: There are similar charges if you want to cash a cheque or withdraw money at a branch other than your own.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在其他银行兑现支票或支取现金，将会产生差不多的手续费。

detailed_translations.english: money in the form of coins or notes rather than cheques,  credit card s  etc
If you cash a cheque, you exchange it at a bank for the amount of money that it is worth

name: economics
trans: n. 经济学；国家的经济状况

sentences.english: a Harvard professor of economics
sentences.chinese: 哈佛大学的经济学教授

detailed_translations.english: the study of the way in which money and goods are produced and used

name: mountainous
trans: adj. 多山的；巨大的；山一般的

sentences.english: the mountainous coast of Wales
sentences.chinese: 威尔士多山的海岸

sentences.english: mountainous waves
sentences.chinese: 如山的巨浪

detailed_translations.english: having many mountains

name: altitude
trans: n. 高地；高度；[数] 顶垂线；（等级和地位等的）高级；海拔

sentences.english: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机已经达到了大约三万九千英尺的巡航高度。

detailed_translations.english: the height of an object or place above the sea

name: caffeine
trans: n. [有化][药] 咖啡因；茶精（兴奋剂）

sentences.english: Avoid caffeine (= drinks with caffeine ) before bedtime.
sentences.chinese: 睡觉前不要喝含有咖啡因的饮料。

sentences.english: a caffeine-free cola
sentences.chinese: 不含咖啡因的可乐

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化][药] 咖啡因；茶精（兴奋剂）
detailed_translations.english: a substance in tea, coffee, and some other drinks that makes you feel more active

name: subordinative
trans: Not Found
